column2: ['Queens Academy high school is a school that helps you achieve what it is you need to graduate and go to college. It’s a small school so teacher and students are able to communicate one on one with situations regarding each persons grade and status, which is very beneficial. It’s a relatively easy school and it’s nice to know that you can rely on them for things. They include a common point learn to work program to obtain internships even working in the school,  they have several clubs that are steadily increasing through the years (currently in robotics club) and generally opportunities you can get to win things (a sweepstakes, per say for your academic success as you’re in the school). I personally love the school because it has helped me with what I need academically, and I know I can rely on my teachers to help me with anything.', 'All the staff members are super accepting and understanding. They help make sure everyone is safe and on the right track', 'My experience at queens academy high school was awesome! While in That school i was able to obtain numerous awards. Passing all my classes, leadership, citizenship, honors. One thing i liked about this school was the school faculties. They were very supportive and always pushed me to do better. They seen potential in me when i didnt ! They were more than teachers to me , i looked up to each and EVERY person in many different ways. I appreciate them & the support they gave me', 'This school helps students succeed!', 'The school staff treats the students with maturity like adults . We are all on the second page as in to keep everything straight forward', 'The teachers at my school are caring about the students well being . They get to know you and want you to do your best . The teachers at queens academy push you to do better all the time', 'At queens academy high school in flushing , NY they have a wide variety of clubs and classes that interest my fellow classmates like Entrepreneurship courses that help you create a business with a legitimate business plan , it is guided by NFL a organization that help intercity kids make and create business . There are also other courses like forensics that covers real life senarios', 'Like every other high school this school had very little variety of food and were little options to eat healthy.', 'There are many disciplinary actions in this school.', 'There are no sports other than the activities you do during gym time.', 'I felt that there were many times where a teacher could have gone a little bit above and beyond for some students. Teachers lacked a sense of determination for students. Many taught lessons with little vigor and had a carefree attitude towards learning.', "Aside from gym there weren't any extracurricular activities to do after school ended. There wasn't any sport teams or competitions going on.", "The school actively helped students who were serious in graduating. However, I didn't receive lessons in how to properly right an essay or resume. I felt that there were a few things that the teachers lacked when interacting with some students. Some of these things were patience and understanding.", "Dress code was not available in my school. Female students couldn't wear shorts above the knees and male students couldn't wear bandannas or any gang related clothing.", 'The students were a a bit out of control, but teachers and staff did try their best to prevent every negative situation. It made an impact on me because of the positive choices they taught us.', "My school didn't have a field. We would walk to the nearby park which was located approximately five blocks away from the school. The recreational center was located two blocks away from the school. My school was a two floor brick building that only had an entrance and three exits. Queens Academy had a softball, basketball, and tennis team.", "After graduating high school i was somewhat prepared. I didn't realize how hard it would be to maintain yourself and find  job. But with all my experiences have taught me so much.", 'The teachers I came across during my academic experience at this high school were friendly and very helpful. They had great knowledge about the subjects they were teaching.']

column1: Bergen County Technical High School - Paramus
column2: ['The school was a great place to learn and the staff were amazing people.What I would change about the school is the policies and procedures about cell phones.', 'I originally did not want to go to this school... My home district was a blue ribbon high school all the other campus over look this school.First off if you truly want to start working after high school this is the school for you if you have an IEP they will baby you in this school the academics here do not prepare you for college at all.I only learned 3 new things in this high school I have learned everything in my middle school.The students mindset here are horrible they all aren\'t motivated to do anything because In the school environment to be "mediocre" and for the teachers don\'t push there students to want to get an education. There ok for the with kids to "just meet the requirements" Now the resources here are ok, the guidance counselors have a good background on colleges and are open to helping the students.', 'Your there for the education, it’s  not the traditional high school experience. Sports not so great but take advantage of getting involved in other areas. Its all about what you make of your time.', 'all different clubs are available', 'The teachers are very involved with the students', 'They have many different topics on subjects for teenagers', 'This school help me raise to be a leader in my class and has prepared me for my next step in my education.', 'Teachers are willing to take there time to help a student', 'Rules are not often imply since there is to much favoritism', 'Students accept other students the way they are.', 'There are many student involve in sports', 'Not many option to eat. Also not cook well', "Students won't often show what they cary around", 'My technical teacher prepare me well for the real word. She treated her teaches as if we were working for someone else', 'The teachers will take there time to help a student in need', "$3 for a carton of milk.?! That's most likely expired.?!?!?! Overpriced. Poor quality. Thank God I had free lunch..!", "We recently got a new gym. Its beautiful, but how come he haven't improved the food .?! We have tons of flat screen tvs hung up in the hallways displaying achievements and events at BT , but no piano. They bought the school an Xbox, but yet, we still don't have new computers. Who is investing their money??? ", 'School is a "safe-zone" . No bullying whatsoever,', 'This school had high standards with the courses taught. However, not all the students attending go to college afterwards. My friends either went to the military, found a job with the certification received at this high school, or went to college. ', 'Dress code is a little strict and rigid. Someone wearing sweats with a tank top lifted a little got her attention called. Its school, not a court session. ']

column1: Mathematics, Science Research & Technology Magnet High School
column2: ['My experience at this school is alright. There many things that need to be changed. The students need to be more involved in the school. There aren’t much clubs or anything like it. The faculty needs to become more organized. The students never know what’s going on. I could go on but I’d be writing a whole encyclopedia.', 'In my four years of math and science my first three years were okay however when my new Principal came she flipped everything around giving a new and beautiful atmosphere for the school.', 'Has greatly improved over the years. With new principal my freshman year and senior year were dramatically different. Energy in the school is for sure changing for the better.', 'The programs at the school are decent. Small school wit smaller class room sizes, which meant more attention towards the students. Sports and after school activities were good and had a wide variety. Student wise, not so friendly, but academically, good. Overall good experience at this high school', 'To me mathematics, science research and technology magnet high school is a overall good school.  We have app classes extra curriculum activities, regents prep, sat prep and also pm classes students can take to make up credits that they are missing.  They award students that are on the merit, honors and principals list to any restaurants for breakfast. They also has programs were we can go to college campuses and pick which classes we would like to take to earn the credits, which I am in right now,psychology101. My school is diverse, I see kids from many different country attending.', "Mathematics science reasearch and technology is a relatively small school in the campus magnet complex. Typically it gets a bad reputation because of its past as the andrew jackson highschool. However as an alumni of the school I can say that its nothing of what it use to be. The teachers are motivated and actually take their time out to ensure every student has a good learning experience. They're clubs and trips that we go on annually to help build school culture and promote a healthy acceptable environment for the students. Lastly students feel safe at this school, there's minimal fights and students are not afraid to go to a teacher, administrator, or school safety if there's an issue. All in all mathematics science research and technology is a great school that cares about the well being of students and promotes a family environment for everyone.", 'I like that they offer Saturday classes in the time period when regents are upcoming. The teachers keep us updated with upcoming topics and ensure that we do well and understand the syllabus.', "Best high school I've ever attended. I loved all my teachers. And I felt as though I have finally learnt something in school. Especially in Mathematics and History. I wanted to attend school everyday and never wanted to miss a class. Best teachers ever.", 'M.A.S.T HS takes pride in integrating children from all races and all background. They provide a safe environment and deal with problems that arise as quickly as possible. They have well informed and experience teacher that take pride in teach students. They need to provide more extra curricular activities for students after school.', 'My experience at my school was well spent. I enjoyed the different activities they offered. They offer programs that completely help with high school credits and for college readiness. I enjoyed my time there because I was very active and apart of the school. I was the president of my class grade from sophomore to my senior year. I believe the school should keep the peer group connection (PGC) alive because it helps each and every freshman to adapt and get comfortable in school.', "I like how my teachers tried to work with me, and take their time to help me understand the classwork give. Field trips are awesome and the kids are bad but nothing those strict teachers couldn't straighten out.", 'The school and the teachers are great, but what makes the school so bad is the type of kids that attend that school.', 'The teachers at this high school go up and beyond for their students. They offer tutoring extra credit sobstudents are able to get the help they need .', "This school has a Boy's and Girl's Varsity Soccer Team, Indoor and Outdoor Track and Field, Cross Country, Varsity Football, Volleyball, Boy's and Girl's Basketball, Gymnastics and Cheerleading.  There is a high level of commitment to these sports and an okay administrative support is provided to these sports.  The most popular options are Football, Soccer, Track and Field and Basketball.", 'My experience at this school has proved to be most interesting.  The students that go to this school make it very unique as there are many students from varying ethnic backgrounds, like New York State itself.  My favorite experience at this school was participating on the soccer team.  I love soccer and the people who I met while playing the game made me fall in love with the sport even more.  Though my experience was pleasant, i would choose not to do this school all over again because it holds events that I would never like to experience again.', 'The teachers at my school execute the high level of knowledge needed to teach their students,  They incorporate fun activities and interesting technologies in order to impart knowledge onto us.  The peak most students interests with their initiation of invigorating class discussions which allows us to gain participation points needed to bolster our grades.', "It's an alright school , you just have to do what you have to do and stay focused. It's not the school that is bad but it's the students .", 'The school could use a lot of improvement, many of our facilities are not funded many teachers leave during the year, and many of the children there are not there to learn but to distract others', 'Would NOT choose this school again except for the fact that this is where I met my best friend.', "It's a small school, we all get along the best we can"]

column6: ['Nonetheless, it could always be better', "It was an okay experience, could've been better.", 'Just your average NYC school', 'They know when to put students in their place.', 'Not the best, again, could use financial support!', 'We have amazing and very dedicated teachers!', "We have a wide range of clubs and sports to choose from, the teachers running these clubs are amazing and inspirational. Yet we aren't funded the way bigger schools are.", 'In my school there are good and qualified teachers who dedicate their time and effort to get the best out of students by helping them improve academically. my school also hold after school programs and marathons in other to help student practice hard to pass their reagents and graduate with flying colors. my school will do whatever it takes to bring make the best out of a student and to set them as good examples of the school and the society, even after graduating.', "It's bad because teachers every year are leaving.", 'It depeneds on what sport you play.', 'They are not the best choice for athletics at all.', 'Student Involvement in school related activities are great! Most of the students at the Campus are involved in the sports that the school offer such as Track and Field, Gymnastics, Football and Swimming. They compete with other schools in the region and have fun bragging about their wins the next school day on the morning announcement!', 'This institution has somewhat prepared me for the "real world" because it has allowed me to mature and develop the skills needed to effectively function in a working-class environment.', 'As far as academics is concerned it is quite commendable. The teachers have a vast amount of knowledge about their subject area and are willing to work with students after school Mondays-Thursdays. The workload can sometimes be difficult if you are in an AP class or any college related course, however it can be quite manageable as related to Regents course related classes.', 'The guidance counselors were best.  They were great listeners. They always helped when things went wrong or if you need certain classes to pass', 'The most popular club was arista. For kids with an 85 or better for 3 terms. They raised.money went on trips.', 'Mast has a great pta system & teachers who love kids. They do find activites for kids outside of school & during school. Example tutoring trips & College programs', '.the students can be kind but also disrespectful. Most of the students are doing sports & got scholarships . They are also.smart and bright students that do attend there classes on a regular. The school is mostly filled with african americans', 'They made sure they punished students when they got the chance', "Even though this wasn't the greatest school, I wouldn't give it up for nothing. If I was able to I would redo the four years I spent there"]

column2: ["my experience was good but then it wasn't. I went to high school there and my senior class didn't really get everything we needed. we had unfairness but at the end I guess it was good.", 'I’m an upcoming freshman and I have no clue when school starts. I was suppose to get sent a letter with the information but it never came. I’m also very confused on why the school doesn’t have a website. If anyone can tell me when school starts for freshmen in 2019 I’d appreciate it', 'I love the gym, ITS LITERALLY THE BEST !!!!!!!!The basket ball games are the best, our volleyball team is so cute.', "Although the school is very small and has changed since I was a freshman, I still had created many good memories with my friends and had many opportunities given to me.  I didn't like all the changes in staff we seemed to have every month. I didn't appreciate the lack of attention the honor students faced. However many of the teachers tried their best to keep students from giving up or being lazy.", 'Overall this school is pretty average. It has positive things and negative things as well. There are a lot of clubs and organizations like the National Honor Society and we also have a basketball team.', 'The School has various clubs and after school programs to help you academically.They also come up with different activities for student to engage in such as dances, field trips and benefits to raise charity money.', 'It’s a very diverse school, lots of AP classes to choose from such as us histkry, Spanish, computer science, and English. Guidance counselors help you out through the college process which is super helpful for those that are not sure where to start or know nothing about college apps', 'When it comes to my school, everyone knows each other. So its pretty cool that you can talk to a teacher that you never had. What I want to change is probably the level of work.  I wish we were challenged a lot more.', 'I like that the school is in Times Square the location is great.What i don’t like about the school is the lack of Extra curriculum activities.There is very minimum activities to do.', 'Going to JKO Highschool in the city is a very different experience, But Overall I love it Getting to see Times Square everyday and being around a variety of different talented people , I don’t think anything needs to be changed . The time we start & get out of school is very adaptable ! Mostly all trains have close stops to the school to get you to there so you have different options. I love going to school in the city !! From the train ride to my school being in the heart of New York ! Supper different experience for me', 'I absolutely  loved my time at Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis. The teachers at this school are motivated to help you and continually assist you when you struggle with any subject. Additionally, because the school is located in times square, most of the students are all over NYC! You will not be disappointed by the academics here.', 'Joke highschool is a great school where smart talented students strive to succeed. I would like for the bathroom rule to change. There’s a rule where 10 minutes before and 10 minutes after the bell students are not allowed to use the restroom. It’s a safe measure to prevent student cutting yet it’s not mindful for those who actually need to use the restroom before or after the bell.', 'Although teachers and staff are great people, the children there can be out of control. Somethings to suggest is more sports club and a need of a gym.', "JKO it's a pretty good school! The teachers are really nice and they encourage students a lot. One thing that I would like to change is the the way students get too comfortable with the environment sometimes.", "Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis High School is like any regular high school. The teachers and staff have to be the best part of the school experience because they're all extremely helpful and genuinely care about their students. It is easy to make friends since it's such a small school. It is located in the middle of Times Square so there is always something to do in the area. The school offers many great opportunities to its students, and there are endless things to do including dance, National Honors Society, Video Game Club, Virtual Enterprise, Smash Arts in partnership with the Roundabout Theater, Basketball, Table Tennis and Volleyball teams, plus the various Advanced Placement courses they offer.  Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis gives equal opportunities to all of its students and that is why I think it is a great school.", 'I like their Virtual Enterprise International program because it got me interested in Accounting. In addition I learned how a company works and made connections with NBC Universal and Viacom. They also have amazing dance concerts that I love to participate in.', "I extremely regret not transferring when I had the chance. Students are definitely not performing where they should be in respect to their grade level. This is due to passing grades being handed out despite a student not putting in the effort and work. As a senior headed off to college in less than a year, I am disgusted by my peer's inability to recognize MLA format and produce coherent essays. If you are seeking a valuable education and a cohort of motivated students who genuinely want to learn, DO NOT COME HERE!", "It's an okay school. I liked it there, but there were no actual gym and the extra curricular they say they have, they don't. Academically, everything is alright. But, I wish they'd at least have a girls basketball team.", "My overall experience in my school Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis High School is pretty much moderate. I say this because I'd never want to knock the teachings of an overall good teacher, yet there are some who are under active. Some teachers and staff in the school actually care for us students and other don't. I've learned a lot in the school but I wish I could've have been inspired and motaviated a bit more. I feel like the school doesn't push us and urge us to want to attend college. The students in the school are also very careless and inact in very vulgar behavior, the maintenance of the school could be a bit better. I also wish they had more clubs and extracurricular activities for us to participate in. To be fair the school isn't the worst school ever but it definitely could use some improvements.", "They don't care to help you with a better schedule at all. They carry nasty attitudes and are very lazy."]

There’s a rule where 10 minutes before and 10 minutes after the bell students are not allowed to use the restroom. It’s a safe measure to prevent student cutting yet it’s not mindful for those who actually need to use the restroom before or after the bell.', 'Although teachers and staff are great people, the children there can be out of control. Somethings to suggest is more sports club and a need of a gym.', "JKO it's a pretty good school! The teachers are really nice and they encourage students a lot. One thing that I would like to change is the the way students get too comfortable with the environment sometimes.", "Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis High School is like any regular high school. The teachers and staff have to be the best part of the school experience because they're all extremely helpful and genuinely care about their students. It is easy to make friends since it's such a small school. It is located in the middle of Times Square so there is always something to do in the area. The school offers many great opportunities to its students, and there are endless things to do including dance, National Honors Society, Video Game Club, Virtual Enterprise, Smash Arts in partnership with the Roundabout Theater, Basketball, Table Tennis and Volleyball teams, plus the various Advanced Placement courses they offer.  Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis gives equal opportunities to all of its students and that is why I think it is a great school.", 'I like their Virtual Enterprise International program because it got me interested in Accounting. In addition I learned how a company works and made connections with NBC Universal and Viacom. They also have amazing dance concerts that I love to participate in.', "I extremely regret not transferring when I had the chance. Students are definitely not performing where they should be in respect to their grade level. This is due to passing grades being handed out despite a student not putting in the effort and work. As a senior headed off to college in less than a year, I am disgusted by my peer's inability to recognize MLA format and produce coherent essays. If you are seeking a valuable education and a cohort of motivated students who genuinely want to learn, DO NOT COME HERE!", "It's an okay school. I liked it there, but there were no actual gym and the extra curricular they say they have, they don't. Academically, everything is alright. But, I wish they'd at least have a girls basketball team.", "My overall experience in my school Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis High School is pretty much moderate. I say this because I'd never want to knock the teachings of an overall good teacher, yet there are some who are under active. Some teachers and staff in the school actually care for us students and other don't. I've learned a lot in the school but I wish I could've have been inspired and motaviated a bit more. I feel like the school doesn't push us and urge us to want to attend college. The students in the school are also very careless and inact in very vulgar behavior, the maintenance of the school could be a bit better. I also wish they had more clubs and extracurricular activities for us to participate in. To be fair the school isn't the worst school ever but it definitely could use some improvements.", "They don't care to help you with a better schedule at all. They carry nasty attitudes and are very lazy."]
column6: ['Jko is not the place to get social.', "It's not the best, never felt safe, I almost got jumped by about 10 girls and no staff nor security was around, they knew about the situation.", 'They hold events that benefits them.', "No parents attend anything. They don't invite parents personally. The students invite parents for shows. The faculty only invites parents for suspensions and issues.", 'Every teacher is different, most teachers are great though.', 'This part of the school is extremely bad as there are only two teams that can not practice in the school due to the small size of it and they are force to waste their own time to accommodate the school.', 'The school environment is the worst i have seen through my four years the lack of funds for almost anything is very notable as of the limited size of the school and the lack of many activities that should be there for the students to enjoy.', 'Although the teachers in the school are very friendly people that are approachable and try to help all students no matter what. The lack of control in the class and the not engaging lesson they give is a big problem for my self and many students in my school', 'It could be better, but overall the school made me feel safe.', "There's something for everyone and makes everyone feel welcomed, no matter what.", 'The teachers here show devotion to helping students succeed and prosper.', 'The safety policies are ok, sometimes things could get out of hand but most of the times things barely happen, just gotta be at the right place, at the right time.', "The extracurriculars are fun, like i'm in the debate club, community service club, and year book club. Their all a fun way to end each day.", 'As a senior this as been a great experience so far at JKO, I made so much friends and achieved so much, such as my stage fright and many more obstacles that has affected me.', 'Teachers at JKO high school are wonderful people, they inspire their to students to do the best that they can and most never give up until their students make it where they have to be.', "My overall experience in this school so far is great. I feel like in Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis High School anyone can feel safe and comfortable. Since its a small compact school many know each other and that establishes a sense of family and connection between the students. One of my favorite experiences is definitely doing community service. Our school offers a lot of community service and its usually so entertaining. Another favorite experience I could say is I love the clubs. I'm in a club called Gay Straight Alliance, a place where both Gay people and Straight people are welcome and a place where we talk about relationships and basically and where there is an understanding on how we all go through the same issues and are equal.What makes this school unique and special is the freedom. We have no uniform policy, we are able to express ourselves not only verbally and spiritually but artistically through what we wear. Our school is also extremely LGBTQ friendly. I would choose this school again because  I wouldn't have met such great friends/teachers/staffs.", 'Overall this school was very welcoming, and actually have a good variety of opportunities for students like the Virtual Enterprise Program, Teen Choice, Dance Education, The Smash Arts production, Ping-pong, Community Service, Male basketball team, Pep-squad, debate club, and business classes. if your looking for a new experience, Jko has these programs, but if you looking for any other program specifically its hard to find it at jko because its such a small school.\r also jko school is really open minded when i comes to the LGBT community.', 'I hate that the gym is too small and the lunch room also. The things I like about JKO is that all the teacher are cool and you could count on some of them.', 'its small but if you focus on your work then everything will be alright', 'Administration want students to do their best and will enforce school rules.']
column8: ['Every school has its good or bad moments.', 'There is one or two sport options.', 'Teachers are really friendly and are willing to give it their all to help a student.', 'There is not enough options in extracurriculars.', 'Through its virtual enterprise business program I was able to learn about myself. I was able to direct my interest and see what I had to do in order to obtain what I wanted.', 'in the school we had a program called avid which was to help students get in to college. it was a class that was very helpful. it got you ready for what college was going to be like', 'we really did not have nothing in this school. the gym was to small there was no sports team. so yea bad', 'most teachers help students out. if one student is doing bad in class they would help them after school or during lunch', 'i rules against bullys is fair. i mean it not tolerated. that one thing i believe was good', 'if i had a chances to start all over i would have pick a different school. why because everything one though of the school was a lie. in the paper it talk about how they have this and that . when u get there u see it not even true', 'for 4 years we tried to get a soccer team but every year was the same thing they said no', 'i think it a good i mean i never had any problem', 'Too many bad kids (delinquents) for the administration to know how to handle properly at all  times.', 'School is physically too small and dislocated for sports.', 'Most (not all) teachers are friendly but most teaching styles can be improved.', 'Most boys are interested in sports but the only team (basketball) sucks', 'There is a lot of safety, though at times it may not be safe in the school. But there is a lot of help!', 'We accept each other and make a lot of new friends, regardless of race and/or ethnic', 'At times there are staff who can help students with any situation', "Some meals are good, but there are other that aren't"]

column2: ["I like the friends I've made in this school and specific teachers that have helped me along the way. I would like to see change in student voice, and the representation of minorities in the school.", 'Since I was a transfer senior it was really hard to fix in at the beginning of the school year until the end because I became antisocial. One thing that I liked about the school is that teachers are supportive and the school itself gives the student a lot of chances to pass their classes and not attend summer school', "Spending for years at Bronx Collaborative really taught me the importance of writing and revision. Writing PBAT'S will get you ready for not only for college but also for all the term papers.", 'Bronx Collaborative has a very unique curriculum, with less focus on tests and more focused on projects. I think this system of learning is more useful and fulfilling, as the projects are often highly individualized and therefore when you complete them, it feels that much more satisfying. The school is relatively  new, and as such, certain aspects (like the scheduling) are prone to being messy. Bronx Collaborative has some very talented and helpful teachers, and some lackluster ones. The administration can occasionally be unhelpful, rude, and arguably lazy. But if you focus on the good things, Bronx Collaborative is a fine school! It just needs more time to find its footing.', 'I liked the people that I was surrounded with throughout my years in this school. I would like to change the disorganization of this school because it has an affect on the students work.', 'Bronx Collaborative High School is a small school where help is all you receive. Good teachers, you are definitely treated with respect in every aspect. The administrators make sure you are able to get what you are missing if you need a little more push to get to that certain academic level. However, since students in this school have gotten very comfortable wanting help, the offices sometimes get too busy and you won´t always be able to get help when you need it. Despite every issue and success, this school is a great school for new students to apply to.', "I would like for there to be more creative or crafty electives, have more equipment for classes like science and gym. For there to be more outside time, and trips. I'd like if all the bad students had consequences and the good students get rewarded.", 'I came to Bronx Collaborative High School mid-year of the first semester. I was surprised by how the students and teachers bond. There is no hierarchy between students and teacher. The teacher treat students equal respect and love and student treat teacher with respect and love. One thing I like about this school is that teachers are tend to be approachable and understanding. Most teachers here are patient and determined to teach students to their best capabilities. As a matter of fact, teachers here also hear out opinions from students and allows student to explore in what they want to do. However, some students abuse this opportunity. And I think I want to change those students perspective. I want to make sure they could learn things they want. After all this school collaborates to make students to be their best and achieve the things they wanted to be.', 'I overall like my school. The teachers are friendly and well educated. I never felt unsafe among teachers or students. I feel like college readiness is important to teachers and administrators. We have a College Advisor who is accessible at all times and have the chance to do CollegeNow. We have computers, IPads, and Laptops in classrooms if we need them. We get to choose our classes and they are very interesting courses like Food Chemistry and Gentrification. We have Japanese and some students is Japanese class took an 11 day trip to Japan. Overall, great school. My Only complaint is the organization of important events.', "The teachers at the school don't nt have a bond with their students at times, and causes the child to fall behind in their classes because of the fear of being put down by their teacher.", "I've had many challenges in this school. This school is a project based school so it was stressful having to deal with all the project deadline. It's an a okay school.", "Bronx Collaborative High School is a good school. At times it can be unorganized, but to be truthfully honest this school does care for its students. I see teachers stay after school to help students if they even need help. If a student doesn't have a computer at home, they are allowed to stay after school in the tech lab to finish it. The teachers are the best, they explain things to you if you don't understand they ask about your day, they even remember small details you tell them. The school is very diverse, no really cares where you came from, they care more about you as a person. This school also helps you a lot when it comes to college. They help you fill out FAFSA and TAP. Honestly, in a few years, I feel like this school can grow.", 'I’ve never experienced the emotional issues until high school, not saying it’s a good thing but it’s better than being in the dark and surreal.', "In Bronx Collaborative attending to that school was a different experience, it showed me that high school can be difficult but you can also have fun and enjoy your time there. Students show their identities and where they come from. The classes are not that bad but the teachers are excellent, they help the students prepare for college. In the school they don't do regents, they do big projects which can be very difficult. Sometimes it can be a little disorganized but they try they best since its a new school.", 'I liked that it was different compared to other schools because it was a project based school. I feel like it prepared us more for college with half of the work we did. I enjoyed how I was apart of the first graduating class.', 'BXCH has provided my child with a stable, functional, safe, family friendly, environment to improve in all areas of his academics. They have forced him to be responsible for his future by giving him help to better is grades and be a positive figure in society. I love this school and the way they care for each and every one of their students. I recommend this school to any and all students who wish to be around educators who will lift you up and force you to be a better you.', 'At this school you feel like your apart of a family.  Everyone here has the desire to help you get the most out of your education be it staying late to get extra help, counseling, or just being around people who care about you.', 'They really care about you in the school you feel like family and they push you as much as they can so you can strive and do your best']

["What I loved about the school the most is how small the school is and  the teachers, even though its a try-mester school for people who wasn't doing what they were supposed to be doing in regular high school, the teachers never treated us different. They made it fun to learn and actually made me want to be on time. They always saw potential in everybody and pushed us to see the greatness in ourselves that we didn't see before. We all are a family.", "The teachers were a amazing . They always motivated the students to better. The classes are are always easy. The teachers are pretty much friends with the kids, always helping us out. It we have any problem it's easy to talk to a teacher about it."]

['For the most part, Memorial High School is a great school. I just feel that it is too old-fashioned for my taste and should be renovated to reflect the year we are in. The teachers are great and care about the well-being of students. There are many different types of clubs for any kind of student to enjoy and partake in. The negatives are that there is no air conditioning and it is way too overcrowded, even with a separate Freshman Academy.', 'Memorial High School has given us information and readiness towards our paths into the future. Something that should change is that there should be a medical field type of club/ program to engage students who are looking into going into the medical field. Overall, Memorial High School has amazing teachers who teach us on a day to day basis and are looking out for us.', "According to my experience, this school not only gives suitable high academic classes but tries to get students to be at the places they need to be. Most teachers aren't hard workers or take an interest in teaching their students the subject.", 'Honestly I love the place but You don’t feel welcome the teacher are just somehow boring and it feel like they don’t really love their job. I love the campus and the place honestly is beautiful but is not only about that. I wish their were more activities and dances.', 'Memorial High School is an okay school. They are some things that i would change such as better bathrooms, more active sports, more security, better uniform rules. Also, this school does not have air conditioning so in the summer it gets really hot. Better technology, the wifi is bad and this had caused some technical difficulties in my classes. This school needs a makeover but over all not to bad. Many teachers are really nice and just good overall teachers.', "My experience at Memorial High School wasn't the most exciting or spiritual school so it was an average High school. Memorial at times will be the outcast when it comes to comparing the school to the county. Although it wasn't a good outcast in this case. It lack a lot of equipment along with expecting so much, and putting high standards on students when they themselves different provide much back. That's one thing I'll like to change and how the money is being use.", 'I can honestly say that I thank God for the teachers that I got all these four years ... I thought it would be hard bit these teachers taught me good and I will never forget where I graduated from.', "Great volleyball program! Coaches are absolutely wonderful. Academic experience wasn't the best though.", "Memorial High School is okay. I've met some amazing people and have had a handful of teachers I've actually learned from my past four years. I'm an athlete and I've come to the realization how little administration cares about who they put in charge of a team.", 'Good school. Great teachers who impact your life over all. Classes are great, teachers teach at their pace. One thing I would like to see change is more time in between periods.', 'I am a senior right now but my time at Memorial has been a great 4 years. When making great connections with my teachers, guidance counselors, and faculty I have made connections that will benefit me on my journey towards college', 'As long as you stay active within the school community and take advantage of the school’s difficult courses, Memorial is an amazing school!', "Memorial was below average. Nothing special, definitely not college prep. Lots of favoritism in everything. Bad in sports. The only good things are letting you out for lunch and having special programs like acting and dance. Strangers get into the school frequently. It's very hot in the summer.  They give you lots of problems when registering.", 'Great school with great opportunities to get a head start for college. The school offers AP classes as well as college credit courses from Kean, Syracuse, and Hudson County Community College.', 'As an incoming senior at Memorial High School, I reminisce about the first time I ever stepped a foot in the school. My experience has been full of extravagant memories and opportunities. Memorial High School is a school full of diversity and that is what I love about it. The opportunity of being exposed to various different people and cultures enables me as a person to build character and be able to understand what everything each person and their culture have to offer to the world. Although I am beyond grateful with the school I currently attend, schools are not perfect. I would like to see my school incorporate more access to computers as well as inform us more about colleges and scholarship opportunities.', 'Memorial Highschool Might not be one of the greatest schools but My experience here was one of the best. Teaching wise they are really good with a great Math department but the science department needs some help. The system could change a bit in the scheduling process since many where unavailable to graduate because many required classes where not taken and it should be up to the counselors to guide the students to graduate but if that would change it would be great.', "Most teachers try to help you as much as they can there are some that actually try to prepare you for the real world and are very understanding. I've had some rough times in this school but overall I had a great experience by joining sports and being in the Performing Arts Academy.", 'What I really like about Memorial high school is the diversity it has. There are students from almost all over Latin America, and I personally like that, because it is fun seeing when all of them come together for a game or just a normal activity in an everyday school day. You also get to know almost every school due to the size of the school and get to make many friends that basically turn into your family. Yout teachers also get very close to you and help you individually if you need to.', 'I chose Memorial High School because it felt like home. I had the option of going to two other high schools, but when I walked through those doors, I knew I made the right choice. Memorial may not be considered prestigious, but what matters is what you make of it. I made the most of everything Memorial offered. Because of my hard work and the support of my school, I will be attending an Ivy League University in the fall.', 'The school spirit is incredible, you can feel the tiger pride when it comes to activities, sports, and events. There are clubs, and things you can spend your time on.']

There are clubs, and things you can spend your time on.']
column6: ['Overall, the four years in Memorial High School were great! The school may look old and rusty however, you can not judge a book by its cover. The faculty and teachers were always prepared, they all worked well as a team when preparing big events and always showed a postive attitude. Memorial High School is known for the student’s pride as a whole, whether in the football games or special events, we all came together as a school to support each other and have a great time. I’m proud of being a Memorial Tiger!', "While some teachers are great with students and caring for the pupils' grade, most are not. It would be nice to see a change in teachers attitudes concerning the student's hard work. Also, juniors and seniors should have a greater exposure to college preparedness. Most students are first generation and have no idea when or how to begin researching colleges as well as applying for scholarships, financial aid and summer programs that could be beneficial when applying to college.", 'I liked all the english teachers I had and they offer some interesting classes that were fun to take. However, I would like to change their sweater policy.', 'I like how teacher help students in their lunch hours, even though they dont have to. what Memorial should improve its facility.', 'Memorial High School definetly helps me if I am ever in doubt, emotionally or academically. Staff make sure we are aware about college and what we need in order to succeed.', 'Good school but needs more improvement and dedication from the students. It needs more investment for better classes and preparation.', "Memorial High School was ok. During my four years there, there were plenty of clubs to join, but I wasn't necessarily ready for college. They just recently added engineering courses and it would have been really helpful if it was there when I was there. The counselors are nice, but they don't help much. I almost couldn't graduate because I was suppose to take a certain elective that I had no idea about. The staff is nice, but a lot of students lack motivation. Also, there ware way too little pre-calculus classes. If you weren't the top student, it was hard to get into any upper level math classes.", 'I entered Memorial High School in September 2014. I had graduated 8th grade from a Catholic school in a nearby town. At first, I had not been exposed to so many different ethnicities and backgrounds. I had culture shock, even though I came from another town. I was in a school with no more than 500 students enrolled, we all knew each other\'s names and we were all friends. The amazing thing about Memorial High was the sense of family. My teachers had a huge impact on my academic career. I entered high school with some problems at home, and school was the one thing I would look forward to every morning. I was never a straight "A" student prior to my high school career. I entered Memorial High School, and I immediately excelled. All of my teachers saw a potential in me and when I saw my Final Grades for freshman year- I started believing it too.  My four years at Memorial High School have mentally and physically prepared me for college and my future endeavors.', 'I loved going to school for most of my high school career. I am a very hard working student and I feel like I made the best out of my time in high school by excelling to my fullest potential with the material that the school had to offer. I was ranked top 10 out of my senior class of roughly 480 students. However, I did not feel like I was absolutely prepared for college one hundred percent since I did not learn a lot of prerequisite material that I was required to understand before I took the tremendous leap from high school to college. I still love my high school and hope to go back one day to share some of my knowledge in mathematics and science.', 'My overall experience was good. I wish teachers would be less of friend and teacher more.  I wish they would better assist students with the college enrollment process.', "I love memorial because its anti-bully and you can be anyone and act anyway. The food is very healthy and even the vending machine is. The thing that has to change is that they need to fix the tracks and the air conditioning because in the summer it's really hot.", 'It’s a average high school, nothing too crazy. The thing I hate about this school is that you have to test to get into honors or ap classes', 'It may not seem like much, but this school will suprise you a lot. You will be able to interact with fellow classmates, and you will always have your teacher helping you by your side every second of the way', 'They need more organization. The administration needs to at least listen to and have an open mind with their students. Too strict in the wrong areas.', 'This school was honestly horrible when preparing for college. Most teachers are there to help you but there are a couple that are complete trash. The trigonometry teacher especially, Mrs. Jameson. She does not teach and is extremely lazy. She also feels suprerior to the students.', 'I honestly loved the people and environment. In every city, they are local rivals. Here in West New York, our rivals were North Bergen and Union City. If I were to have the opportunity to change schools, I would stay right where I am. North Bergen is very known for fights. There would be fights in the hallways and even the bathrooms. Union City was very known for the amounts of gossip that travel through their hallways. And Memorial? Memorial had more bums and sleepy heads than ever. I would take bums over fighters and "chismosos" any day. Our students are very calm yet very out spoken. But I can\'t say I don\'t feel comfortable, because everyone is so welcoming. Of course every school has its faults. There is not one high school that is perfect except High School Musical.  But I can say my class are my wildcats. I am blessed to say I graduated from Memorial. I have made memories and friends for a lifetime here. And I wouldn\'t change that for the world.', 'Memorial high school is a great school. The teachers were always so insightful and ready to help with any problems or concerns you had. Teachers and staff always mad sure they were doing their best at giving students the best education possible. I never did join a sport at memorial but I knew memorial had one of the best football and track teams in the area.', 'I am an alumni of Memorial High School and it pains me to say that this school was underwhelming. it was underwhelming in the fact that it lacks in diversity, assistance, food, and environment.', 'I liked the most the diversity and the arts program.  There is not much guidance when it comes to college. One has to do it on your own.  The guidance counselors are not available.   There are many clubs and activities.  One club that I find useful  is the peer group.  Teachers tend to try to be friends with students at the level of feeling comfortable of using bad language and feeling free to take students phones and throwing them down stairs.I will not miss my experience at Memorial High School.', 'Memorial high school was a great high school. i learn so much from every subject in school .the teachers really care about you and want you to learn.']
column8: ['Overall, the four years in Memorial High School were great! The school may look old and rusty however, you can not judge a book by its cover. The faculty and teachers were always prepared, they all worked well as a team when preparing big events and always showed a postive attitude. Memorial High School is known for the student’s pride as a whole, whether in the football games or special events, we all came together as a school to support each other and have a great time. I’m proud of being a Memorial Tiger!', "While some teachers are great with students and caring for the pupils' grade, most are not. It would be nice to see a change in teachers attitudes concerning the student's hard work. Also, juniors and seniors should have a greater exposure to college preparedness. Most students are first generation and have no idea when or how to begin researching colleges as well as applying for scholarships, financial aid and summer programs that could be beneficial when applying to college.", 'I liked all the english teachers I had and they offer some interesting classes that were fun to take. However, I would like to change their sweater policy.', 'I like how teacher help students in their lunch hours, even though they dont have to. what Memorial should improve its facility.', 'Memorial High School definetly helps me if I am ever in doubt, emotionally or academically. Staff make sure we are aware about college and what we need in order to succeed.', 'Good school but needs more improvement and dedication from the students. It needs more investment for better classes and preparation.', "Memorial High School was ok. During my four years there, there were plenty of clubs to join, but I wasn't necessarily ready for college. They just recently added engineering courses and it would have been really helpful if it was there when I was there. The counselors are nice, but they don't help much. I almost couldn't graduate because I was suppose to take a certain elective that I had no idea about. The staff is nice, but a lot of students lack motivation. Also, there ware way too little pre-calculus classes. If you weren't the top student, it was hard to get into any upper level math classes.", 'I entered Memorial High School in September 2014. I had graduated 8th grade from a Catholic school in a nearby town. At first, I had not been exposed to so many different ethnicities and backgrounds. I had culture shock, even though I came from another town. I was in a school with no more than 500 students enrolled, we all knew each other\'s names and we were all friends. The amazing thing about Memorial High was the sense of family. My teachers had a huge impact on my academic career. I entered high school with some problems at home, and school was the one thing I would look forward to every morning. I was never a straight "A" student prior to my high school career. I entered Memorial High School, and I immediately excelled. All of my teachers saw a potential in me and when I saw my Final Grades for freshman year- I started believing it too.  My four years at Memorial High School have mentally and physically prepared me for college and my future endeavors.', 'I loved going to school for most of my high school career. I am a very hard working student and I feel like I made the best out of my time in high school by excelling to my fullest potential with the material that the school had to offer. I was ranked top 10 out of my senior class of roughly 480 students. However, I did not feel like I was absolutely prepared for college one hundred percent since I did not learn a lot of prerequisite material that I was required to understand before I took the tremendous leap from high school to college. I still love my high school and hope to go back one day to share some of my knowledge in mathematics and science.', 'My overall experience was good. I wish teachers would be less of friend and teacher more.  I wish they would better assist students with the college enrollment process.', "I love memorial because its anti-bully and you can be anyone and act anyway. The food is very healthy and even the vending machine is. The thing that has to change is that they need to fix the tracks and the air conditioning because in the summer it's really hot.", 'It’s a average high school, nothing too crazy. The thing I hate about this school is that you have to test to get into honors or ap classes', 'It may not seem like much, but this school will suprise you a lot. You will be able to interact with fellow classmates, and you will always have your teacher helping you by your side every second of the way', 'They need more organization. The administration needs to at least listen to and have an open mind with their students. Too strict in the wrong areas.', 'This school was honestly horrible when preparing for college. Most teachers are there to help you but there are a couple that are complete trash. The trigonometry teacher especially, Mrs. Jameson. She does not teach and is extremely lazy. She also feels suprerior to the students.', 'I honestly loved the people and environment. In every city, they are local rivals. Here in West New York, our rivals were North Bergen and Union City. If I were to have the opportunity to change schools, I would stay right where I am. North Bergen is very known for fights. There would be fights in the hallways and even the bathrooms. Union City was very known for the amounts of gossip that travel through their hallways. And Memorial? Memorial had more bums and sleepy heads than ever. I would take bums over fighters and "chismosos" any day. Our students are very calm yet very out spoken. But I can\'t say I don\'t feel comfortable, because everyone is so welcoming. Of course every school has its faults. There is not one high school that is perfect except High School Musical.  But I can say my class are my wildcats. I am blessed to say I graduated from Memorial. I have made memories and friends for a lifetime here. And I wouldn\'t change that for the world.', 'Memorial high school is a great school. The teachers were always so insightful and ready to help with any problems or concerns you had. Teachers and staff always mad sure they were doing their best at giving students the best education possible. I never did join a sport at memorial but I knew memorial had one of the best football and track teams in the area.', 'I am an alumni of Memorial High School and it pains me to say that this school was underwhelming. it was underwhelming in the fact that it lacks in diversity, assistance, food, and environment.', 'I liked the most the diversity and the arts program.  There is not much guidance when it comes to college. One has to do it on your own.  The guidance counselors are not available.   There are many clubs and activities.  One club that I find useful  is the peer group.  Teachers tend to try to be friends with students at the level of feeling comfortable of using bad language and feeling free to take students phones and throwing them down stairs.I will not miss my experience at Memorial High School.', 'Memorial high school was a great high school. i learn so much from every subject in school .the teachers really care about you and want you to learn.']

column1: John V. Lindsay Wildcat Academy Charter School
column2: ['Reviews are always based on opinion.  Mine is on facts.  Fact 1:  Teachers and staff are awesome!  Students need to learn how to study and respect their teachers who are there to teach the students the subjects to graduate.  Fact 2:  You can earn internship experience if you want to get a job after you graduate.  Fact 3:  The Bronx school offers culinary training skills.  Fact 4:  There is a college advisor who works with each student on a 1 to 1 basis.  Fact 5:  Graduation ceremony is filled with grateful parents, guardians and guests because their loved ones graduate.  Fact 5:  If you want to join the military, an appointment is made for a recruiter to see you.  Fact 6:  If you just need a job, they help you find training programs to help you get a job and they help you make a resume.  This school is small enough to help you, not like the large DOE schools, but you need to work hard, VERY HARD!  The diploma is not given to you like a free lunch.  You need to work for it!', 'It was amazing they changed my life. Every thing that has happened to me u thank you. I was such a hot head and didn’t listen. Thank you for all the support and time. If it wasn’t for them I would’ve never graduated at all. Still running the streets fighting acting a fool. This school is great and it has a great support system.', 'I loved that the crowds were very small and that teachers paid attention to all of their students. Environment was great and the culinary program was awesome', 'I loved it !!!! Teachers have a great understanding of each and every student . If you don’t understand something they make it their business for you to understand', 'It was great and many things were offered.', 'The staff and teachers went above and beyond for the students as if they were their own children. With class work and home work and extra help. The staff even cared about the students outside life to make sure they were on the right track at all times.', 'Teachers always went above and beyond for students.', 'Bullying does not occur. If and when it does occur it is quickly ended', 'The school is a safe environment there are not many violent actions that occur at the school.', 'There is not a lot of sports to pick from. But, on the other hand no one on the team does not judge because we understand the importance of team work.', 'There is never any fights. There is always great communication about what is going on. The bathroom are sometimes clean. The eating area is always clean.', 'The teachers in my school are a little above average. Most of them make sure you understand the material, others are more lenient. My assigned teachers are nice overall. They make sure they explain their work clearly.', 'Overall my school fulfills their promise to make sure you get the proper attention and education. They make it not boring for you at your time there. The teachers are happy always to help and see. Your bound to get greeted in the morning time.']

column1: School of Business, Technology, Marketing & Finance
column2: ['The School of Business, Technology, Marketing and Finance is exceptional. I love how my teachers have established relationships with my peers and I. The staff of BTMF wants us to succeed and I know I am with their continuous help.', "I didn't like the school a lot because its whole infrastructure has barely improved and the only thing that they have somewhat improved are its administration/rules.", "My experience in the school of business, Technology, Marketing & Finance has been an journey over these past 3 to 4 years. I had my times with one or three teachers but I have overcame the bad part of them and starting to grow up. I really don't like the school but I need my education. This school can be better and clean up more plus get some new technology for the students to learn in the way of our future.", 'My experience in the school was great is a well manage school they  prepare you for college. The teachers are always there for you and always there to help. Its was a 4 year journey that I enjoyed.', "My experience with School of Business, Technology, Marketing & Finance is great but it could always be better, when it comes to academics, teachers, resources, and parent involvement. They're not the best but it's not the worst.", "BTMF is an OK high school. The administration is very concerned about uniforms. They should be more concerned about books for our classes and supplies to use during testing. The only thing that I do like about BTMF is that I'm graduating this year to go to bigger and better things for my future.", "I didn't like my experience at BTMF that much. The main thing I liked was meeting the people I am friends with now. I didn't want to come to this school but I had no choice but to come. I do not wish to pursuer a career in Business, Technology, Marketing & Finance  but if I did I would not recommend coming to this school. When you pick your pathway the whole point is to start focusing on that specific path you picked. Having only one forty minute class isn't going to get you ready for a career in that area of study.", 'My overall review of the school of Business, Technology, Marketing and Finance is it was better than I expected it to be. I came to this school because it was my only option but I ended up liking it. The experience I had in high school helped me grow as a person.', "The School of Business, Technology, Marketing & Finance is an okay school. It have it's ups and downs but what school doesn't. They can improve there school by interesting there  lesson plan so students will enjoy going to class.", 'My experience in my school was okay.It was not as great like I would had like it to be.This is not that bad but it has a lot of problem evolving the student.Also what I would like them to do is fixed the school building form the outside and inside.', 'My experience in BTMF was poor. I was able to meet new people which is a plus however there is a huge lack of motivation in teachers and students. Overall the school lacks skills in many places.', "The school of Business, Technology, Marketing and Finance is a very diverse school. When I was a freshman, this school was unorganized and students did whatever they wanted. Now as the years past by and that I'm a senior, the administrators have become more involved with the students and set some rules. This school has definitely progressed over the years. I feel as though the teachers have found a way to connect with their students even more for a better understanding of them.", 'My overall experience at the Academy of Business Technology Marketing and Finance, was a bitter sweet one.  At this academy I have grown and learned so many things with the help of lovely teachers. I have grown fond of some students as well whether we just socialize on class or we have a club or do  an activity together.  This academy have taught me  many life traits that  I seen suitable to carry over in the real world as soon as I have graduated. Leaving with be a sitter sweet money just like my experience but if I  could change anything I  would not.']

['University Academy has helped me grow as an individual . We have a anti phone program called yondr where our cellular devices are not accessible all day , which helps us learn and promotes us to socialize more with eachother . i feel like University Academy has stepped up to the plate and offered a good foundation for the rest of my life', 'The school is average. They some good teacher but most are not very good. Sports suck except for track and there is close to no clubs or facilities. I will say however that the school is very safe compared to nearby schools. There are no metal detoctors, which means that that they trust students.', 'This is a great school, lot of great teachers who actually care about you! A lot of great opportunities, if you have a high enough GPA you get to go to NJCU for free with a full scholarship. Its such a small school so everyone is very close. This school is very much fun too.', 'I enjoyed the student to teacher ratio. The classrooms are small enough that you get to have one on one teaching with the teachers.', 'I graduated from this school in 2016 and my experience here was good. I got along with some of the staff members and teachers and I have a personal connection with some of them. I would recommend this school.', 'The staff is AMAZINGGGG!!! Teachers are HELPFUL!! Students are very DIVERSE!!! I love it!!!! The school itself is very CLEAN!!! The food is TASTEFULLL!!!!!!!! They treat you like you are their very own FAMILYYYYY!!!!! ENROLL TO UACHS NOW!!!!!!!', 'The classroom sizes at University Academy Charter High School are smaller and more intimate.  My learning experience was good, I liked most of my teachers and mentor.  I think that other sports should be part of the extra curriculum activity.  I enjoy playing Soccer and I had to play for another school in my district.', "This school is pretty small, but that's what I like about it. They're fair amount of clubs to choose from. The staff are very nice. Clean school. My experience in this school so far is positive.", "My experience at University wasn't that great. I am now a college student at the University of Rochester and I don't feel like they prepared me for college at all.", 'University Academy is a small high school which makes it easy to know the teachers and for them to know you so they know how to help you when you need it.', "I like how the school is involved in student's better education, however extra help and preparation for college needs an increase.", 'University Academy Charter High School was a very small and unique high acuity really enjoyed having to leave the building for gy, it allowed us to get some fresh air outside of lunch time.', 'A bitter/sweet experience. Sometimes the teachers are up to par with thier grading and are fair with grading other times teachers tend to lose student work and the student suffers from thier mistakes. There are many fun and engaged withthe students pesonally which makes the enviornment more tolerable.', "As a senior of University Academy Charter High School, I can proudly say the school offers numerous of opportunities for students such as internships, and college material. We do have classes that can help us with college and thr future. Its a great clubs and sports. The teachers are great and truly care about the students. It's a great learning environment. What could change about this school is the lack of variety of food options in the cafeteria. It feels like we have the same food everyday. Also the school should have  football and volleyball since students will have to play at different schools for those two sports.", "I attended University Academy Charter High School from 2010-2014 and those where one of the best schools I ever attended. University was a small school and I really love small schools, I don't care to much for big schools because it's a lot of confusion during class switches. During omg my days at University my favorite teach was Mr. Timpanaro also known as Mr. Tip. Mr. Tip was a very nice and easy to understand teacher, and he also was the best trip planner", "These have been the most horrible four years of my life. Most of the teachers don't care about the students because they're being paid in the end no matter what. Most of the students are dangling on the edge of failure and will fail. The school does not prepare you for college and you are wasting your time if you cone to this school.", 'I like that the staff keep the students organized to ensure the safety of the school. I like the academics that the school has to offer because it is well taught. However there should be more electives that students would enjoy as well as extracurricular activities.', 'I have never felt unsafe at this school. The nurse is good although students complain about how she always ask if we ate breakfast', 'The teachers at University Academy Charter High School are nice and helpful. They are willing to help any student in need', 'Sometimes the teachers are up to par with thier grading and are fair with grading other times teachers tend to lose student work and the student suffers from thier mistakes. There are many fun and engaged withthe students pesonally which makes the enviornment more tolerable.']
