column6: ['The food is definitely not of good quality, but it is enough to survive on, sort of. ', "There are certainly no more than 5 clubs within the school. This really sets backs a lot of their students, not just because it restricts personal growth and the expanding of one's horizon and passion, but also because it also inhibits one's college prospects. It greatly cripples any college application being submitted from this high school. ", "We have the occasional school fight, but nothing too serious. Bullying can't really be helped sometimes, since often, the victim will not voice themselves. The school does not acknowledge that bullying occurs within school grounds, so that does not help either. Safety drills are ran regularly, which improves safety in case of threats in any way, shape or form.", "This school has close to nothing when it comes to sports. I've squandered my years here, and not just because of the sports. ", "The athletics in my school mainly revolve around the basketball and baseball team. Their equipment are decent and sport our school color: green and gold. There aren't plenty of fitness opportunities since it's a small school. ", "There are a minimum of extracurricular activities coming from a charter high school. The ones that stand out the most and are valued in my the school are the sports such as basketball and baseball. Students that are a part of those teams are very passionate about what they do and are considerably good team players. Aside from that, we have leadership clubs such as junior ambassador where students address a problem and formulate ways to help the community. Also, the strong minded and outspoken enter the debate team, including quiet students with loud minds that want to practice their public speaking. Lastly, an interesting club or rather an after school activity that was created by the fellow students would be the Geek Club. This club is filled with a variety of people who stay after school to catch up with each other, help each other out with school work, or simply find something random to keep themselves occupied. I believe this would be a favorite club of mine because the ones who found it were simply a bunch of students who didn't consider themselves popular but welcomed anyone who wanted to find a place to socialize after school. Even though there isn't anything particularly glamorous about these clubs compared to other suburban high schools, i still applaud my school for its efforts and time to do something for the students and help guide them into educated, level-headed individuals coming from an urban city.", 'the teachers were very good and helped each student in different ways. They also challenged us in many ways making my class the best class to graduate yet. I believe my teachers are among the best to teach in high school, some of them teaching for more than 30 years.', 'There are not that many students, so there is not that much diversity among the students. The school does accept students of different cultures, but there were not many that applied. As peer pressure goes, there is quite a bit of it that goes around, but you can get around it and avoid it from affecting you. Even though diversity lacks a bit among different cultures in the school, there are quite a few different sexual orientations around the students. Students were gay, straight, lesbian and also transgender.', 'High School was very easy and a lesson learned. I am glad that I payed attention in high school because it really helped me out when I got to college.', 'The food is great this year. Anytime before then during my four years of attending the food was disgusting. It was always recommended to bring your own lunch or go out for lunch to buy what you like.', "There aren't many activities at my school. As far as sports there's Basketball for boys and girls and baseball/softball. There is a chess club and that's about it. Sp the students are still engaging in some activities."]

column2: ['From the moment my son stepped into the doors I just knew that he had a chance to succeed. The teachers and staff do everything in their power to make sure their students succeed in all they do. My son was never very social and always closed off which effected his work greatly in a previous school. But Bronx Letters brings out the shine and brings out the hidden characters in their students. My son is doing amazing and is more social and involved in school. Thanks to the staff that NEVER gives up on their students.', "My experience in Bronx academy of letters so far has been great I've been in that school since 6th grade and now I'm in 9th and I'm still loving the school and all the teachers there", "the 5 years that ive attended there was the best honestly, ive had alot of embarrassing moments as you're suppose to when i high school, ive met alot of god people some of who im not friends with anymore but overall my experience was amazing and i would do it all over again", 'My Experience of Bronx Academy of Letters was great. I loved the teachers. They are very inspiring and the teachers will push you to do bigger and better things. The education is okay. Most classes just push you to do well for only the regents, but other classes that are just electives are amazing. I loved every moment of the elective courses. The staff is okay. I do believe the staff can be better at monitoring situations such as arguments, but overall my experience of attending Bronx Academy of Letters was great. I enjoyed the sports team. The different cultural backgrounds and just the nonstop happy environment.', 'It was an amazing experience they prepared for college, by doing these college prep class as well by taking us to the colleges, and giving us tour of the college the teachers were all amazing they helped acquired  knowledge on our education, and by asking such challenging questions for better prepare us for college, especially the teachers that taught us the AP courses. They really helped us improve our writing and reading and even would go so far as to speak to us if we were struggling with that specific class. My experience at this school was amazing one and if I could do it again I would.', "What I like about this school is that teachers give you a lot of advice if you're stuck and don't know how to undo yourself. There is nothing that can be change. It's really a good school.", 'From my personal experience and opinion Bronx Academy Of Letters is a pretty small school which has benefits. Teachers know you a little more and you can get the extra help you need by going to them. They put in the time and effort but you have to meet them half way, they give students opportunities to get the extra help they deserve. The teachers at Bronx Academy Of Letters are very caring and welcoming which makes us students connect better with the teachers.', 'I am a senior at the school.  I am in two different clubs softball,  and step.  Thankd to my college conselor i got a good amount of college acceptance.', 'Throughout my 4 years in Bronx Academy of Letters I have made friends, and lost friends at the same time. While there I gained a family that never gave up on me even when I was at my weakest. The teachers was so helpful that even after school they would stay for a few hours, so you could understand what they taught in class. School was like a second home to me because I was always in there until the school safety says "Alright now it\'s time for ya to leave". Even though I had a rough four years in Bronx Letters I found myself in that school, and knew what I wanted to be and do in life.', "I like Bronx Academy of Letters because they shown me this website to get scholarships. They also have a lot of programs for we can have experience on what we want to major in. Bronx Letters showed me the options I can have with my goal and the options I have right now. It helps me plan out on what I have to do in the next 2 years for can go to my goal college. This high school is good in protecting there students because they have strict rules in where you going and what passes.  They know where I'm going to be and where I'm at all times.", 'I like that my school is involved with the sports team heavy. something i want my school to change is parent involvement.', 'This is Avery safe school there is many was the to stay safe, and there is many people to talk to and get help.', 'There a high variety of clubs and after school activities that creates the high rate of students participation and commitment. They are all free is just take time and commitment to be able to participate. This allows that students create greater bond between grades and helps bring a lot of team spirit.', "This is not a bad school. Students get an equal and fair opportunity to do things they want to. There a lot of activities and opportunities that meet students different wishes and you could get them for free. It has been rated as one of the best school, in the four year I have been here there has been only two fights. Students act with respect to one another and the teachers, there has been a lot of activities that allows us to connect to the staff members and create bonds. I recommend this school to everyone, it's great.", 'Teachers are great example for students. They encourage student to be a great person in the future, they are really supportive and they have a good communication with students.', "Bronx Academy of letters is a good school but if I could do everything again, I won't be be choosing the school because the students are more close in the school. Leaving the other students or the new students left behind.", 'What made BAL so special are the people who you come i contact with and the teachers that make the experience of learning worth it in the long run. Our teachers and faculty expect a lot of us which is more than most can say about kids from the South Bronx in that area in particular. To have someone encourage you and believe in your pursuits and passions as much as you do make us strive for more. BAL may just be another school in the Bronx, but they strive for the students to express their selves and excel in almost any way possible. So  out of everything opportunity and connection is what you gain from going to Bronx Academy of Letters.', 'Its a very independent study kind of school. Yet the staff is on top of students about things which are not primarily included in their education. Also there is not much educational freedom offered.', "I grew so attached to this school and the people in it that if I could go back in time and do it again I would. I would've realized earlier to take advantage of everything they offered me.", "It's better to bring home packed lunch and seniors get to go out for lunch so either way there is never many students eating lunch."]

My son was never very social and always closed off which effected his work greatly in a previous school. But Bronx Letters brings out the shine and brings out the hidden characters in their students. My son is doing amazing and is more social and involved in school. Thanks to the staff that NEVER gives up on their students.', "My experience in Bronx academy of letters so far has been great I've been in that school since 6th grade and now I'm in 9th and I'm still loving the school and all the teachers there", "the 5 years that ive attended there was the best honestly, ive had alot of embarrassing moments as you're suppose to when i high school, ive met alot of god people some of who im not friends with anymore but overall my experience was amazing and i would do it all over again", 'My Experience of Bronx Academy of Letters was great. I loved the teachers. They are very inspiring and the teachers will push you to do bigger and better things. The education is okay. Most classes just push you to do well for only the regents, but other classes that are just electives are amazing. I loved every moment of the elective courses. The staff is okay. I do believe the staff can be better at monitoring situations such as arguments, but overall my experience of attending Bronx Academy of Letters was great. I enjoyed the sports team. The different cultural backgrounds and just the nonstop happy environment.', 'It was an amazing experience they prepared for college, by doing these college prep class as well by taking us to the colleges, and giving us tour of the college the teachers were all amazing they helped acquired  knowledge on our education, and by asking such challenging questions for better prepare us for college, especially the teachers that taught us the AP courses. They really helped us improve our writing and reading and even would go so far as to speak to us if we were struggling with that specific class. My experience at this school was amazing one and if I could do it again I would.', "What I like about this school is that teachers give you a lot of advice if you're stuck and don't know how to undo yourself. There is nothing that can be change. It's really a good school.", 'From my personal experience and opinion Bronx Academy Of Letters is a pretty small school which has benefits. Teachers know you a little more and you can get the extra help you need by going to them. They put in the time and effort but you have to meet them half way, they give students opportunities to get the extra help they deserve. The teachers at Bronx Academy Of Letters are very caring and welcoming which makes us students connect better with the teachers.', 'I am a senior at the school.  I am in two different clubs softball,  and step.  Thankd to my college conselor i got a good amount of college acceptance.', 'Throughout my 4 years in Bronx Academy of Letters I have made friends, and lost friends at the same time. While there I gained a family that never gave up on me even when I was at my weakest. The teachers was so helpful that even after school they would stay for a few hours, so you could understand what they taught in class. School was like a second home to me because I was always in there until the school safety says "Alright now it\'s time for ya to leave". Even though I had a rough four years in Bronx Letters I found myself in that school, and knew what I wanted to be and do in life.', "I like Bronx Academy of Letters because they shown me this website to get scholarships. They also have a lot of programs for we can have experience on what we want to major in. Bronx Letters showed me the options I can have with my goal and the options I have right now. It helps me plan out on what I have to do in the next 2 years for can go to my goal college. This high school is good in protecting there students because they have strict rules in where you going and what passes.  They know where I'm going to be and where I'm at all times.", 'I like that my school is involved with the sports team heavy. something i want my school to change is parent involvement.', 'This is Avery safe school there is many was the to stay safe, and there is many people to talk to and get help.', 'There a high variety of clubs and after school activities that creates the high rate of students participation and commitment. They are all free is just take time and commitment to be able to participate. This allows that students create greater bond between grades and helps bring a lot of team spirit.', "This is not a bad school. Students get an equal and fair opportunity to do things they want to. There a lot of activities and opportunities that meet students different wishes and you could get them for free. It has been rated as one of the best school, in the four year I have been here there has been only two fights. Students act with respect to one another and the teachers, there has been a lot of activities that allows us to connect to the staff members and create bonds. I recommend this school to everyone, it's great.", 'Teachers are great example for students. They encourage student to be a great person in the future, they are really supportive and they have a good communication with students.', "Bronx Academy of letters is a good school but if I could do everything again, I won't be be choosing the school because the students are more close in the school. Leaving the other students or the new students left behind.", 'What made BAL so special are the people who you come i contact with and the teachers that make the experience of learning worth it in the long run. Our teachers and faculty expect a lot of us which is more than most can say about kids from the South Bronx in that area in particular. To have someone encourage you and believe in your pursuits and passions as much as you do make us strive for more. BAL may just be another school in the Bronx, but they strive for the students to express their selves and excel in almost any way possible. So  out of everything opportunity and connection is what you gain from going to Bronx Academy of Letters.', 'Its a very independent study kind of school. Yet the staff is on top of students about things which are not primarily included in their education. Also there is not much educational freedom offered.', "I grew so attached to this school and the people in it that if I could go back in time and do it again I would. I would've realized earlier to take advantage of everything they offered me.", "It's better to bring home packed lunch and seniors get to go out for lunch so either way there is never many students eating lunch."]

column1: The Bronx School For Law, Government And Justice
column2: ["My school experience in LGJ had it's ups and downs. I had teachers I could confide in, and classes I loved. However, there were also the strict rules, some of which forced kids to be late to classes. There was also the constant asking for money, for dress downs, events, etc.", 'What I like about the Bronx school for law, Government, and justice is how the staff makes me feel welcome to the school. I been in LGJ since freshmen year. Now I’m a senior. The school is clean and fights are rare. The area is safe because there’s always police around since the criminal court is really closed to the school. My freshmen year I was really shy and I didn’t talk to anyone. Making friends was hard for me since I was really shy. Now that I’m a senior I have friends and I feel more comfortable in the school. I do service in the school for a class period. I enjoy doing service. I love how this school provides programs and activities that makes you closer to others.', 'As a student of this school for seven years, I can honestly say that it helped me grow as a person. Honestly speaking, though I might want a change in environment I can say that there is so much love in this school. There’s not always a consensus and there might be disagreements, however, at the end of the day that school is the place to go to grow and better yourself.', "The Bronx School For Law, Government And Justice is a pretty good school where you don't have to worry about pretty much nothing because the teachers or staff are always there to help you out with anything. The staff their make us students feel safe at all times. The teachers in the school will always push our thinking so we can become better at what er are doing. Our school has both middle school and high school and every year the school has celebrations in where both middle school and high school come together as a family. Over all the school is a great place to be at.", 'I’ve been in the Bronx school for Law, Governments and Justice for about 7 years it’s a very good school that challenges you', "I have been attending my school for 4 years. My school is pretty good with academics, but when it comes to diversity, you won't see much. It is located in the South Bronx, so it is made up of primarily hispanic children. The lunch is all that great but that because of D.O.E food regulations. This school is big on sports and has multiple sports teams.", "My experience in this school was overall good academic wise and sports wise because the school is very limited but its good in the college readiness program. This school provides good clubs and overall programs that covers all bases however the rigorous classes we have isn't as rigorous you will expect", 'The Bronx School for Law, Government, and Justice is a good school, there is a strict uniform policy, and a strict phone policy. The school has teachers who care for their students and want to see them succeed, and several guidance counselors to help students when needed. However, there is also a very limited budget to this school, and some classes will go without certain resources or materials needed.', 'This school has many rules and restrictions; however, throughout the years there has been some changes to improve students college readiness skill and graduation rate has been increasing.', 'I love the welcoming environment within LGJ. The people are respectful, kind and well organized. Something that I would like to see change within the school is the college and career readiness class we are given at the end. I feel like, as a senior, I’m not provided with enough in school college support (and only CUNY options are being advertised to me).', 'My experience in this school has been pretty positive. I have been able to participate in programs outside of the school due to how good I was doing in the school. The school provides clubs and opportunities to better people’s lives. The teachers overall know what they are doing and seem supportive. We get to form genuine bonds with the teachers as we go about our day. The only issue I have ever experienced is how things are managed. By this I mean that money is not spent on the wisest thing. I believe, along with plenty of other students, that the money should be spent on something important that will improve our education. Other than that, the school is like a family to me.', 'The school is a very safe environment. Teachers and staff are my child second family. Classrooms are not over crowded. The school goes the extra mile or miles to help their students. The school is very clean. The school offers a lot of resources for their students as well as for the Parents. From IEP, college prep, Sat prep, immigration and etc.', 'Being a senior at Law, Government and Justice has prepared me for the real world! I went to LGJ as a sixth grader, ever since then I became very close to the staff and I would always get pushed to do better just to become college ready. Being in school where the environment is great and challenging makes you feel like you are home. One thing I love that this school has provided is College and Career Prep for seniors. Being a senior is stressful especially when you really do not know how to even start your FASFA or CUNY applications! This class is just an extra boost to guide us with everything though college applications and after college!The one thing I think this school should improve on is just the food. Even though the fruits are good at breakfast and lunch!', "My experience overall was average and enjoyable.  I learned what I had to learn and I did all the work that I had to do. There are some school rules that of course are hard to get used to or follow, for example, you can only use the bathroom during certain times and most of the time most of the bathrooms are locked so you can't even go to the bathroom at all. That makes it a little bit hard especially when you have an emergency. but in terms of the academics and teachers, They helped me learn a lot of things and also my favorite thing about the school is that they help prepare you for college. They have a lot of college visits and the emphasize college a lot which is really encouraging especially to those who are confused about the process of actually going to college.", 'This school has a lot of room for growth. There were a little AP classes in the high school. Administration seemed more focused on uniform rules than education. They cut out some programs like credit recovery which was beneficial to those who needed it. I did not feel challenged.', 'The counselors in the school do everything to help students improve their grade and better understand their decisions regarding their education..The stuff helps you get on your feet.', 'My experience at this school was not a bad one , but the help I received towards finding the colleges of my choice and being encouraged as a young student could definitely been better and could still improve for future students that are to attend. The school itself was always clean and the food was okay most of the time and the professors were great !', 'I think they did a good job preparing me for college, but my classmates were not very good in fostering a learning environment.', 'The Bronx School for Law, Government and Justice is working towards creating a better academic environment for students. There used to be little to no advanced placement courses, but there now are. Soon not just seniors will have the ability to take AP classes. The school is also recognizable by achievements in extracurriculars such as sports. Some track runners are recognized by the city. The girls volleyball team is undefeated with nine wins. The debate team has trophies lined up in cases in the lobby.', 'The teachers show a big interest in helping students in and out of the classroom. School is kept clean. Administrations are very fair with rules. Everything is student-class orientated.']

column6: ["Since 6th grade, I've seen improvements in sports such as soccer, and bowling. Garden on the Terrance. Teachers may not have control in classrooms but students manage.", 'The entire environment  at The Bronx School for Law, Government and Justice fosters growth. The teachers and administrators there truly care for the student body and see it through that each student receives what they need in order to prosper.', 'I love this place. Yes, it is in the South Bronx and its not perfect but it feels like a family and this place brought me out of my comfort zone, introduced me to lifelong relationships and to the most amazing adults who have become mentors.', "Bronx school for law, government & justice is a diverse school where students can experience different activities and a variety of different classes. I've been going to LGJ for about 7 years and I wanted to make a change. My friends and I created a Black Student Union (BSU) in our school so many students could have representation.", "The bronx school for law government and justices once had stability and great personal ( teachers ). As time progressed new teachers came in and old teachers left. Work wasn't work any more it became lazy work. Specially mathematics. We were pushed to use calculators as a way of learning. But there is no better way of learning then doing it by hand. The old teachers were great, effective and can not be compared to those teacher who became their replacement. This school surely gives many teachings going from doing your work to creating a friendly atmosphere.", 'Being in this school for almost seven years made me realize everything comes and goes. The students from every grade are influenced by the another. The teachers are great and the students are alright. Teachers are usually on top of students and making sure they get their work done. There are many clubs and sports team to be involved with. My experience in LGJ made me a better person and learned from my years of being in this school.', 'This school provides a welcoming environment. The administration is very strict with their rules- which can be very annoying. The teachers are accurate with grading and care about the  effort and work students put into things.', 'Alot of activities for everyone.', "Most teachers in the school care about the well being of the students. They make sure that we push ourselves to the best of our abilities. Some teachers are great at being in top if grading, while a few wait till the last minute, when the marking period is done, to put in their grades. Theres a strict policy for most teachers where they don't accept late work and they don't give extra credit.", "The school has cameras I'm the hallways to prevent fights from occurring. There's also safety guards in the hallway in each period change. The nurse is okay but no one really goes because they say she's not going to do anything.", 'There are some good extra curricular activities however some clubs fail to prosper because most people stop going after some time. Due to this, is hard for those clubs to stay in the school.', 'everyone is stuck-up and rude', 'The teachers At LGJ when I was in school , were all very great we were like a big family. They care and are dedicated to the students and they give the students a chance to keep up with there grades on there own with Jupiter grades, and they update the system frequently so there is no trouble.', 'The lessons are great. Sadly, not all staff members are friendly or understanding. Plus have foolish rules and regulations.', 'The teachers are very interactive in the students lives. They try to relate to them and teach all at the same time.', 'There not doing a great job they need to improve', 'I would say they could do better', 'I can see their not that bad', 'The school stays on track with safety and can easily feel like a second home.', 'I like the school, but I feel like it could improve a bit.']

column1: Academy of Medical Technology - A College Board School
column2: ['My experience was your typical high school experience. My school was pretty average but i wish it was more fun.', 'I like that the teachers treat kids equally. It’s pretty fair. I would like to have more extra activities to be able to engage in.', 'There was a wide variety of clubs and organizations to get students involved outside of the classroom.', "I've been in academy of medical technology since middle school. They have became family the new teachers and old one also the new principle at first it was getting us to the fact we getting a new principle but he has made us felt like his children and that goes for everyone else its really a great school.", 'My experience in this school was very good, I got to meet many people, was involved in different clubs, for example, the Guitar Club, Dance Club, and Muay Thai Club. It was a very fun a new experience. My academics were good, I was able  to learn a lot and my teachers helped me improve as an individual.', 'My experience at Academy of Medical Technology was something I never expected. I came from a strict middle school so in my mind I thought high school was going to be like that. But over the years I found out you can do anything that interests you at Academy of Medical Technology.  For me I joined a lot of sports teams. I made a lot of friends on the soccer , softball and cheerleading team . The teachers there like to motivate and challenge you . There are a lot of advanced placement courses you can take . One thing they can change about the school is offer more medical classes because some students applied for this school thinking it was based on the medical field.', 'Attending this school prepared me to understand how hard college will be . I hope to see more math and science teachers .', 'I am a former student from AMT. I graduated in 2015. This school was good and it had some great opportunities like classes with college credit, volunteering at a  nearby hospital and an amazing program called HOSA which stands for Health Occupations Students of America. Students can do all kinds of health related competitions nationwide through this program.  The teachers were amazing. I visit every now and then and there have been improvements to the school for the better.', 'Students are respectful to each others. Teacher try their best to help students. Students are also creative and capable to have a bright future and having a big family.', 'The teachers at this school play favorites and push kids who actually need help to the side. There are very few people here who make your four years here worth while and it is sad to say I had discovered these people in my last few months here.', 'This is a very nice school that will help you learn and grow from it. There’s many opportunities at this school which can help prepare you for college and life. The teachers at this school are so interested in helping the students better themselves and educate them while doing it in a way that is entertaining.', 'Its like any other high school. Some faculty is more into there jobs than others. College advisor is decent.', 'As a high school junior, I know that there are a lot of teachers in this school that want to help you. I like that there are many programs and classes that help prepare for our future, no matter what the direction we want to go in. It is a good school, but not great. There are such issues involving organization and cleanliness, but the security is exceptional.', "I liked most of the teachers and I made a lot of friends since I started in 6th grade and when I graduated 12th grade in June 2017 I made life long friends. I also had a chance to work there this summer and I'm looking forward to working there again next summer.", 'My experience at Academy of Medical Technology was good for the most part, because the teachers and staff were always helpful but the kids there were often rude and judgmental. I wish that the restrooms, cafeteria, and classrooms were more clean and I wish that there were more programs to keep students active.', 'the schools have metal detectors. they also have school safety everywhere', 'the school offers a few things. They offer HOSA, St. Johns internship. National Honor Society, SADD, etc...', 'Im really enjoying this school. Im getting along with everyone and everyone is friendly.', 'The teachers are great. They will do what ever to help you understand and pass.', "It's a typical high school.. it ain't the greatest but I learned to deal with it.. it's actually not a bad school"]

Students can do all kinds of health related competitions nationwide through this program.  The teachers were amazing. I visit every now and then and there have been improvements to the school for the better.', 'Students are respectful to each others. Teacher try their best to help students. Students are also creative and capable to have a bright future and having a big family.', 'The teachers at this school play favorites and push kids who actually need help to the side. There are very few people here who make your four years here worth while and it is sad to say I had discovered these people in my last few months here.', 'This is a very nice school that will help you learn and grow from it. There’s many opportunities at this school which can help prepare you for college and life. The teachers at this school are so interested in helping the students better themselves and educate them while doing it in a way that is entertaining.', 'Its like any other high school. Some faculty is more into there jobs than others. College advisor is decent.', 'As a high school junior, I know that there are a lot of teachers in this school that want to help you. I like that there are many programs and classes that help prepare for our future, no matter what the direction we want to go in. It is a good school, but not great. There are such issues involving organization and cleanliness, but the security is exceptional.', "I liked most of the teachers and I made a lot of friends since I started in 6th grade and when I graduated 12th grade in June 2017 I made life long friends. I also had a chance to work there this summer and I'm looking forward to working there again next summer.", 'My experience at Academy of Medical Technology was good for the most part, because the teachers and staff were always helpful but the kids there were often rude and judgmental. I wish that the restrooms, cafeteria, and classrooms were more clean and I wish that there were more programs to keep students active.', 'the schools have metal detectors. they also have school safety everywhere', 'the school offers a few things. They offer HOSA, St. Johns internship. National Honor Society, SADD, etc...', 'Im really enjoying this school. Im getting along with everyone and everyone is friendly.', 'The teachers are great. They will do what ever to help you understand and pass.', "It's a typical high school.. it ain't the greatest but I learned to deal with it.. it's actually not a bad school"]
column6: ['They do offer a few opportunities in the medical program but only a very few students are accepted . the teachers are okay but what we are taught and college readiness could be better .', 'theses policies are made to contain order , so they are very active and very reasonable.', 'from what I seen in this district , its a fine environment to learn and grow up together as family at school.', 'my overall experiences at the Academy of medical technology is that they really go by no child left behind. they focus on every student because they believe everyone has dream to become successful. it all starts as a goal and then making it into a reality by working hard for it.', 'This school is full sports that the students can participate in. The teams are very supportive towards each other.', 'The school is full of diverse cultures which make the school more interesting.', 'the teachers are very respectable adults and well civilized human beings.', 'I have participated in theses clubs and organizations for the fun of it and to know more people. its so much fun to be part of theses activities.', 'well from what I experienced , I been taken care of every time I payed a visit to the nurse.', 'We have many diverse clubs and after school activities, from guitar classes to health clubs, and everything in between. Commitment to these clubs is high. Most of them are very beneficial for the student outside of school, such as the guitar classes. It teaches classical and Latin guitar and exposes kids to other forms of guitar playing as well. Every club is supported and approved by administration.', "The teachers are great. They're knowledgeable, great leaders, and great friends. Outside of school they always lend helping hands. In school it's no different. Grading consistency is what they're known for. Sometimes it may seem unforgiving. We earn our grades, and rarely get the chance for extra credit. That's only if we're completely struggling. The overall quality and culture of the teachers is high.", 'The school offers many AP classes. The workload is a lot, but it prepares students for college and its intense workload. The teachers for the most part are very well versed in their subjects. Scheduling is based off of previously earned credits in middle school.', 'There are many sports offered at my school. Some are track, basketball, and swimming, Our teams perform really well, with some students having district bests in each sport. Students always attend and support their school, and in turn it makes us perform well.', "Student diversity is what makes my school shine. It's not limited to one race. Many languages are spoken and many cultures are present. This makes student acceptance among others really easy. Students involve themselves intimately with tons of school functions. Most of them are actually completely student driven, with the principal overlooking everything at the end.", "The administration is very strict, yet lenient as well. They're down to earth and always willing to help a struggling student. But in an instance they can switch to your worst enemy if you're out of uniform. They don't tolerate bullying whatsoever. The dress code policy is very strict, with 3 warnings issuing a detention, and 3 detentions that haven't been served leading to a suspension.", "I was never a fan of school lunches or school food, so my rating me be a bit biased. There are salads available only when asked for, so no one really knows if they're there. Usually the food is fish, potatoes, pizza, turkey, chicken etc. The cafeteria isn't unlike any other NYC public school cafeteria. For snacks, we have chips mostly. And vending machines that give out seltzer water, vitamin water and normal water.", "The Heath and Safety policies at my school are very good given the money it has. Very rarely do fights happen, and when they do they're disbanded in only a few minutes at the most. Bullying is virtually nonexistent. We have truancy officers stationed around the surrounding streets of the school in case any students leave without proper reason or are cutting the morning before classes. The school nurse does her job and nothing more, which isn't always the best. We have a few good health classes. We're a very small school and don't have room for more classes, let alone the funding it. The highlight is an EMT training course. It teaches you enough for EMT certification at the end of the year as long as you're 18. I feel my school is really safe. If we had more funding it could be raised to a new level.", "After school activities are strictly for the building. Sports are for the entire campus, not just for my school which is a school within a school. Extracurricular activities don't include much, but when there are activities they are mostly interesting. The best after school activity would be HOSA, health occupations students of america. This club allows students to go to state level competitions which is funded by fun raisers and the school. Students within this club experience the competition and journey of state level activities with kids from around New York. In addition, it looks great on college applications, and it gives students basic knowledge of medical terminology. Lastly, writers group, Thursdays  @2pm with Mr. Ragazzi is a nice thing to have for students to express their writing ability and imagination. The teacher, Mr. Ragazzi loves his job and actually had a short story published. He takes pleasure in listening to the creative writings of students. It is very interesting.", "Phones aren't allowed in school, therefore the social scene is low. Not much peer pressure besides those who cut classes and school together. From there on I wouldn't know further peer pressure because I get to class and have never cut any of classes. Students are accepting, for the most part. Lesbians are accepted, and all religion, except for the occasional male homosexual orientation.", "We do have HOSA, health organization students of america. If your looking to be in the medical profession, this teaches you medical terminology and more. The school tied students to St. John's internship. Also there are around 4 health centered courses, which are armature but something. There are good amount of college classes and courses available which is very interesting and allows for great opportunities. I am sure most highschools are like this, but I wouldnt know. This school makes great effort on extended academics once students apply for them. Regular classes however are a joke. I stay above a 90 and do not wish to go further above a 95 because most classes are too easy. Unless a teacher grades unfairly or poorly, it is easy to get a 90 average, however it won't help for college life."]
column8: ["The school security guards mostly hate their jobs, in exception to a few. The scanners work, a little too good actually, causing students to get scanned after passing the scanners.The guards do their jobs in the morning, and are very strict on phones and kids who bypass the scanners. However, after school, the security at the school is low. This is because sometimes, only bags are scanned, but not your person for metal objects. One can infer the potential catastrophe of this. When there are fights, the guards go running, which is good, and safe, but that leaves the school vulnerable because most of them on a two floor radius go. The nurse is extremely neat and clean, newly renovated. It is part of North Shore LIJ, and they do their job perfectly, better than my family physician. Great job to them. Once a girl complained of her head hurting and the nurse gave her snacks, very nice of her. They honestly love their jobs. The nurse's office is for the entire building, which has 4 schools within.", "To my knowledge, apparently Academy of Medical Technology was founded 7 years ago. I personally don't believe the school staff are prepared for the intake of kids in recent and future years. The school is on one floor and branches into several rooms on the 1st floor and in the section of Kappa, the school next door. I know high school and middle school should be separate, but they are on the same floors, just with different schedules, except in the morning, so these two grade ranges don't mix. Because of this, only 3/4 of he second floor is for high school, making transition to class very crowded and hard. Freshman year to senior year, I've witnessed more and more kids. On another note, the guidance counselor (called Ms. Wap) is not efficient. I believe that because there are so many students that once your schedule is given to you she doesn't prefer to change it. I personally went to her and told her that I wanted a first period class Junior year, but she told me no to take it easy since I have hard classes. I insisted further but agreed, to my surprise my Spanish teacher told me I should have been in her class. Many students complain about their schedule, and I believe it is because she gives students classes the state requires them to take a certain year and fills the rest with electives leaving them to fend for important credits later on. Schedules are 'messed up' always with not as much fun electives to choose from. \r Mr. Merced, the principle, is a very nice guy, hard working, honest, and caring, honestly, along with all other faulty members. Mrs. Chavez, is the only exception. She should have her teaching methods reviewed because  most of the class is based on her personal stories.\r There are no policies on bullying, from my view as a student, maybe just the inference not to do it. Lastly, the uniform policy is strict, however I do understand uniform improves the conduct of high school children. I believe this school will be over all better in the future.", "the school resources isn't bad it's just not enough resources for every student to use. the tutoring is really well , there is tutoring for every regents class like English Algebra Global etc.", "I say it's great because I've been at this school since it started so I've gotten used to all of it and know all the teachers that were there when I was in 6th grade. But over all I have a love/hate relationship with this school. Being a junior in AMT, I go over all of the memories of being in this school. All the smiles, tears, friendships, relationships and achievements.", 'The teachers at my school are amazing. They give us different internships and opportunities.', "I say it's the best because everyone can get involved with a sport or school activities.", "I say it's okay because when ever there is a altercation going on between two students it takes them about 5 minutes to get there and break it up", "We don't have many classes that students would really enjoy. Most of the students either go to class, roam the hallways, go to the gym, or go home. I think my school could do so much better.", "I say it's okay because we have a strict dress code but people still break it. Also people in my school are not very motivated to do their work or listen to the teachers/principal.", "It's not the best high school I've been to.", 'There are not enough activities available.', 'It has 2 gyms and a pool, although the gyms are pretty small.', 'It is 100% mandatory to wear uniform to school. If a student fail to these rules disciplinary actions would be enforced.', 'Everyone welcomes each other with respect. We are like one big happy family. Any other person who is not like this, knows self control and would start any problems', 'I love the teachers,classes, sports and programs my school has to offer however school trips is a problem :( . On a positive note this is is the only school in the area with an college advisor. ', 'The food welcomes a lot a variety. And most of the days we have surprises like chips or a carribean day etc..', 'So many different things to do during school or even after school', "The school's facility and the resources available to us are quite poor. We don't have a computer lab, nor many honors or AP classes available to us students. We do have guidance counselors, college prep resources, and tutoring, but the time we get to utilize their services isn't enough.", "It's not the best, but it's quite okay.", "The food is really great. They have different varieties and they're healthy."]

column2: ['I did not enjoy the last three years of being in this school. The lunch was sub par and teachers would leave too often. Also, I don’t feel like I recurved the real high school experience in this school.', 'My school really helpful and it offers a bunch opportunities to learn and make a connection with the staff', 'My experience at ILCHS was not the best at all. Beginning the school year was a struggle because the hallways were always cramped up during line-ups, the lunchroom was cramped up as well, and there was no heating whatsoever during the winter. When it came time to switch to another building, problems like lack of activities, school trips, decent lunches/decent packaging of lunches, and most importantly low teacher retention remained with the students year after year.', 'I found this school online and saw this was the top 8th best school in new york. I       immediately wanted to go since it was the best school. I enjoyed how the classrooms are small because the teacher focuses on me more. Another great thing is the safety of the school. The whole school is surrounded by a gate and usually, there is a security guard at the front. The academics are great because they focus more on college readiness. There are some cons to this school such as bad lunch and we are treated as a middle schooler but overall it will prepare you for the furture.', 'What I love about International Leadership Charter High School is how it prepares students for college. I am someone who has switched schools a couple of times and ended up coming back twice due to the fact that being in other schools made me realized how well ILCHS prepared us students for college. Even though it is lacking in other areas, the college readiness aspect of it out beats the importance of  any other aspect in my opinion.', "In terms of education and safety, ILCHS, is really good because is actually prepares us students for college and all the work we are going to be facing. As for safety, I don't ever feel threatened when coming to this school everyday.", 'This school is very chaotic and unorganized and sound have better rules to control the chaotic students in this school. As well need more activates like art, book clubs and other clubs that students will be interested in.', "What I like most about ILCHS is that the school is pretty small so everyone knows everyone. ILCHS also has very good security which can make one feel safe during school. Teachers and staff try their best to offer students in ILCHS a good education. However, I feel like ILCHS needs to fix a lot of things that are not good about the school. They should make sure that this school is actually a zero tolerance bullying school because there has been incidents where kids in younger grades are getting bullied and not a lot of necessary steps are being taken to deal with this issue. Overall, my school experience was alright it wasn't the best but it wasnt' the worse either.", 'The school was very helpful in terms of the college application process, as well as giving the students a rigorous curriculum. However, the school could work on bettering extracurricular activities and clubs.', 'In this school, I was fortunate enough to receive rigorous academic structure and the opportunity to prepare for the real world outside the classroom. With requirement to complete 200 hours of volunteer work I encountered a new opportunity to keep my mind open about others circumstances, instead of only mine. Furthermore, the school provided a balance of academics and real life experience. Although the school did not have enough extracurricular activities, I feel prepared to continue my path into higher education.', "In my past 4 years in this school I have learned a lot. This school has provided us with classes that will prepare me for college. Although, the school doesn't have a gym and up until Senior year the school days were extra long with only a 30 minute lunch break which isn't enough. I hope that in the near future, this school will provide extra-curricular activities to further engage students.", 'International Leadership Charter School is a very unorganized school. I wish I would of gone to a school that I would of been more active in.', 'ILCHS is strong in preparing students for college and applies strict rules to structure students for higher education and the work field. The regents is viewed extremely important, and students are given 2 or more weeks of learning days focused on the topics of the regents that will be taken. What I would to see a change of is the organization and resources of the school. There needs to be an establishment of clubs and a wider range of physical activities. There are not many clubs students can join, there is only a band club and it is only available for 2 grades There are many factors the school needs to improve in that involves students in creating a complete community.  Although, the community within the school is very diverse and celebrates diversity when they get the chance. The school also holds holiday lunches in which classes bring in food and desserts to celebrate and eat with their grade. The school is strict but helps students prepare and focus on academic studies.', 'amazing school with dedicated staff. staff and teachers really care and want to help students succeed', 'My overall experience was very rocky. During my time there I was miserable and felt like I was in prison. They have long hours and no teachers which makes absolutely no sense.', "When it's come to growth a big part of it has been the education I've received at this school. Many of it has been due to experiences and memories I probably won't forget for a while.  As a student and future graduate of this high school I would recommend this school to someone because of the education and college prep. I'm sure that for college Ill certainly be prepared and will try and overcome any obstacles which come my way.", 'For the most part my experience has been completely positive. The teachers are there to really help students, mold young mind and create the leaders of the future. Students learn in a clean, controlled, and safe environment ideal for teaching the future. The food is delicious did is always served with a smile. All in all, this school is truly one-of-a-kind and should definitely receive the credit it deserve.', 'This school was a major disappointment. I can’t say that I had any experiences that were memorable or unique. The only thing I know is that I had a lot of different teachers and there were a lot of rules for no reason and the principal always was in arguments with the students for small things  the school was strict with everything and the students were really upset about not having a gym or a program for PE. We didn’t have any technology at all', 'At first i believed going to this school was the worst thing that ever happened to me. With time i came to realize this wasn’t the case. I had opportunities here that i dont think I could’ve had at another school .', 'I did not like this school at all. The teachers and staff only care about a pay check. They do not prepare you for college at all. The staff really does not care about the students. The school gets teachers that can’t even teach. The students don’t learn anything. The school has long hours for no reasons. They don’t even have that many teachers. They don’t have any clubs. The students cannot express themselves in any way without getting kicked out of the school. Students and teachers cannot speak out unless they want to get kicked out of the school. The school needs to change everything but that can only happen if you change who is in charge.']

column6: ['It is overall a great school. It can be a rigorous education, but it is good and prepares you on what it is to come. Although there are no sports, there is Tae Kwon Do, a fitness program for the freshman, internship, and so on. The facilities are extremely clean and the school is a very safe environment to be in.', "My experience at International Leadership Charter High School is okay. The academic instruction is very rigorous. The teachers want to see the students succeed. They will help in any way if a student has a problem. The security is top notch. If they think there is a problem, they will stop class and address the problem. They try their best to help you with college applications. They show us videos on how to fill out applications and help us one-on-one. The things that they need to work on is keeping their teachers, when teachers leave mid school year, it affects the students' learning and progress. The school also needs a gym for physical education. They provide TaeKwonDo, but only for 11th and 12th grade. Overall, it is a good school.", 'In my school I would love to see clubs or any activities that will allow us students to have fun and enjoy ourselves while learning.  The students and administrators should have a bond or at least an open suggestion to what the kids need in a school. For example a gym ever since 2006 there has been no physical education in International Leadership Charter High School.', 'There is no clubs or organizations in this school.', "If you want a real High School experience, do not come to this school. ILCHS is way too strict and there is no fun what so ever. We don't even have gym until we get to 11 grade so I'm probably going to get super fat because I don't do exercise(sometimes if I feel like it but I'll start really soon hopefully). My favorite experiences were being with my friends, that was the only thing that made the school tolerable...my friends. The school might be horrible but you make about 3 or 4 friends that are really cool and funny from what I know. The only good thing about the school is that we get longer vacations but with like 5 packets of summer homework and winter break homework too. that sucks to be honest because I was expecting more freedom in high school and I got less. I wouldn't choose this school to go because even though you make good friends and you have longer vacations, there is too much homework that makes you stay up all night, we get out at 5:00 (they said it's 4:30 but that's a lie) and when a freshman goes to orientation or whatever they do, the staff lies to them and tells them that there are sports and a lot of activities which there isn't, at all.", "Most of the teachers know how to teach and put effort into the lessons that they teach the students. There is a few that I do not like simply because they treat the students like we are in middle school and not in high school. Overall all 6 teachers that I had did help me expand my knowledge about things. I wish there were field trips though because there wasn't this year ( just one but to the library in front of the school... that doesn't quite count in my opinion)", "It's great when it come to safety and health.", "It's good when it comes to academic.", 'its a very safe and secure school nothing ever happening do to the quility of security', 'the school does not have alot of activities but  the activities they have are help to the students', 'i had lot of fun experiences which led to who i am now', 'the teacher are very knowledgeable of the topics and always take time to teach and challenge students', 'In terms of education and college preparation, my school is great at training their students. They also excel in teaching their students how to have a professional demeanor in professional settings for the real world(career settings). When we leave that school, we leave as bright leaders of tomorrow. However, my side of the school has no windows and everything is blue. Hopefully they can change that in the new building. Also, sometimes they would announce things at the last minute, like mock regents. If the school were to fix things like these, along with better lunches, the school would be perfect. Curriculum is good and staff is very kind.', "It's a good school with teachers that will help you pass the regents. Hopefully with the new building it'll get better.", 'My experience at this school wasn\'t the best but certainly wasn\'t the worse either. I met many students to which I\'ve became very close to. There were many exciting yet educational trips to which brought everyone of the students together as well as staff. Some of the staffs were friendly but most importantly the teachers showed a lot of importance and care in the students learning life. I learned many things in this school and met many wonderful people but I surely won\'t consider it the "real high school experience".', "It's great because the rules are strict at a oint where students know not to get in trouble because it makes no sense to get in trouble.", "It's the worst because there is no sports, fitness program, and/or any other factors that affect the athletic scene in my school facilities", "It's great because of the trips we've attended especially the senior trip.", "It's okay because some foods are badly re-heated or cooked, most fruits and/or vegetables are spoiled and don't look normal", "It's great because they know exactly what they are talking about, and they help students understand the lesson when it gets difficult."]

The students and administrators should have a bond or at least an open suggestion to what the kids need in a school. For example a gym ever since 2006 there has been no physical education in International Leadership Charter High School.', 'There is no clubs or organizations in this school.', "If you want a real High School experience, do not come to this school. ILCHS is way too strict and there is no fun what so ever. We don't even have gym until we get to 11 grade so I'm probably going to get super fat because I don't do exercise(sometimes if I feel like it but I'll start really soon hopefully). My favorite experiences were being with my friends, that was the only thing that made the school tolerable...my friends. The school might be horrible but you make about 3 or 4 friends that are really cool and funny from what I know. The only good thing about the school is that we get longer vacations but with like 5 packets of summer homework and winter break homework too. that sucks to be honest because I was expecting more freedom in high school and I got less. I wouldn't choose this school to go because even though you make good friends and you have longer vacations, there is too much homework that makes you stay up all night, we get out at 5:00 (they said it's 4:30 but that's a lie) and when a freshman goes to orientation or whatever they do, the staff lies to them and tells them that there are sports and a lot of activities which there isn't, at all.", "Most of the teachers know how to teach and put effort into the lessons that they teach the students. There is a few that I do not like simply because they treat the students like we are in middle school and not in high school. Overall all 6 teachers that I had did help me expand my knowledge about things. I wish there were field trips though because there wasn't this year ( just one but to the library in front of the school... that doesn't quite count in my opinion)", "It's great when it come to safety and health.", "It's good when it comes to academic.", 'its a very safe and secure school nothing ever happening do to the quility of security', 'the school does not have alot of activities but  the activities they have are help to the students', 'i had lot of fun experiences which led to who i am now', 'the teacher are very knowledgeable of the topics and always take time to teach and challenge students', 'In terms of education and college preparation, my school is great at training their students. They also excel in teaching their students how to have a professional demeanor in professional settings for the real world(career settings). When we leave that school, we leave as bright leaders of tomorrow. However, my side of the school has no windows and everything is blue. Hopefully they can change that in the new building. Also, sometimes they would announce things at the last minute, like mock regents. If the school were to fix things like these, along with better lunches, the school would be perfect. Curriculum is good and staff is very kind.', "It's a good school with teachers that will help you pass the regents. Hopefully with the new building it'll get better.", 'My experience at this school wasn\'t the best but certainly wasn\'t the worse either. I met many students to which I\'ve became very close to. There were many exciting yet educational trips to which brought everyone of the students together as well as staff. Some of the staffs were friendly but most importantly the teachers showed a lot of importance and care in the students learning life. I learned many things in this school and met many wonderful people but I surely won\'t consider it the "real high school experience".', "It's great because the rules are strict at a oint where students know not to get in trouble because it makes no sense to get in trouble.", "It's the worst because there is no sports, fitness program, and/or any other factors that affect the athletic scene in my school facilities", "It's great because of the trips we've attended especially the senior trip.", "It's okay because some foods are badly re-heated or cooked, most fruits and/or vegetables are spoiled and don't look normal", "It's great because they know exactly what they are talking about, and they help students understand the lesson when it gets difficult."]

column2: ["Great school if you're looking for a tight Knit community. The staff are exallent and it doesn't take long to become familiarized with them.Teachers strive to give you the best education possible. Students are normally respectful with a few exceptions.Verbal and physical altercation although inevitable are stopped before any real damage can occur. Never were there any reports of a student bringing a weapon to school.School is kept very clean and new technology is constantly being integrated.Clubs however are few and far in between the dance club is one of the few clubs consistently offered.Sports teams offered include women and men's basketball, men's baseball and women's softball. Pep rally's are also implemented to cheer on are sports teams.This school is great if your primary goal is to get a good education .Although it lacks many extracurricular activities offered at some other schools it makes up for that with vibrant halls and a equally vibrant staff.", "This school is small which is great for me because there's more attention focused on students. Attending Wings Academy a lot of times makes me feel at home because of the family environment. You cannot attend the school without a group of faculty knowing your name for the most part everyone knows who you are. The principal is really easy to talk to you can easily walk into her office and spark a conversation. If you would like to start a club in the school you can without a doubt all you have to do is write the changes you would like to see on paper and they will definitely happen otherwise the school is really great in my opinion. There shouldn't be a reason for academic failure being that the environment is small enough to the point that you can receive the attention you need.", 'Sexual Orientation\r Peer Pressure\r Bullying\r Fights\r Acceptance of all things', 'This school is diverse between ethic/racial backgrounds and sexual orientation', 'This school is a huge sports school. the Varsity and Jv basketball teams are highly ranked in the state. There is alot of school spirit and fan support with sports involvement.', 'My overall experience at this school was average. I do appreciate the memories , friends and lessons i learned while here', 'Some teachers put in the extra effort to go above and beyond for their students. Students notice these teachers and appericiate their efforts', 'The teachers dont really care about the students.They dont give homework.The school teachers arent good teachers', 'their is no peer pressure at school about college, good grades, or graduating', 'my overall experience was alright because when i first started high school i audution to a dance  program.now they elliminated the dance and the new principle cannot controlll the school.', "the schools sports are not very good and alot of students don't participate\r", 'The school does not have a dress code . It is also not strict with the punishments', 'My school wings academy does not have much sports. All it has is boys and girls basketball and girls softball. The teams arent that good', 'The school safety does their best at stoping the bullying and physical fights.', 'The food at my school is healthy. They serve a good amount and the cook is friendly to everyone', 'theres not much to do at my school besides basketball', 'the food at the school can be better with more variety of meals served, but the cooks are very respectful']

['I like how the teacher really help the students they stay after school and they have Saturday school for sat preps and others things to help the students. And I would like to see more after school activity', 'The teachers and academics is very good. College readiness and guidance should improve. The school environment is safe. The school should input more sports activities and clubs available to the students. A lot of students get lazy and wouldn’t want to be in a club in college. There should also be more classes implemented such as physics, calculus, earth science and more AP classes available for the students.', "Academy for Health Careers, a high school in Brooklyn, is not bad of a school as it may seem. The school does offer health classes that are very helpful and maybe even interesting. Some of the teachers are great but others just can't teach at all and require some personal learning like I've done. Getting high grades really isn't that if you just put some effort into it and do your best. Getting distracted by your friends or your own lack of focus is going to get you nowhere. This school, again, isn't so bad but maybe shouldn't be one of anyone's first few choices for high school. Wouldn't suggest it, sorry.", 'This is is a fairly good school that contains some wonderful teachers and staff that care about the children attending the school but it also has some bad teachers and staff with very bad attitudes.', 'the school has lots of sport teams but not enough activities not involving a sport. The teacher here makes sure the students are well prepared for college.', "Academy for Health Careers is a moderately decent high school in Crown Heights, Brooklyn, New York. Their lack of health classes is made up by the familial environment provided by the students and teachers. They're slowly but surely improving by providing SAT tutoring, more clubs, and unique health classes such as introduction to medical technology and phlebotomy.", "Academy for Health Careers is a really nice school. They have specific academic classes set up that not every typical Public High School has, which is really good for the students. Some of them wish there were AP classes though. Although a school can't control the students and their actions, a lot of the students deem themselves superior to others. There are no visible signs of bullying, but there are moments where there are feelings of being unwanted. The staff is extremely helpful in the classes and studies, and are always available to help any students in need.Extracurricular activities are an option but having requested specific activities to be considered and begun, they still have not. But there are most certainly activities to be done for everyone.", 'I liked that some of the teachers of Academy for Health Careers always encouraged our learning and curiosity. They tried their best to keep us focused on learning and doing what was necessary in order to succeed. Many of the teachers also gave us projects that encouraged us to working in teams. By doing this, they increased our leadership skills, creating a bond that promotes strength and reliability in each of us. This helped me in the long run.', "I really enjoyed the personal Medical classes because it gave you an intro into the actual medical field. Being introduced to these classes help me because I realize that my initial profession was not the best suit for me and it helped me realize which profession in the medical field would better suit me. There are many good teachers who are there and help us in more ways than one they're like our second home.", "The four years that Ive attended this school have been the most transformative thus far. The staff is some of the best you could ever come by. In most of the teachers and staff (assistant principals and guidance councilors) you can see that they care deeply about the children and their futures. The students aren't perfect but they are really friendly and the people you meet here will remain friends for life. The only problem that we have is the schools disorganization the seniors never really know whats going on and if you don't ask questions and find out on your own you aren't really told anything.", 'all of the extracurricular activities help the students, they also have fun ones that we can do before we go home and we could hang out with our friends', 'They try to help as much as possible.', 'They try their best with the students, They even help us outside of the classroom with work we have which is really great', "So far, i think this school is okay. I do believe  if we had more engaging activities and the students had a say in what they'd prefer, the school's quality would improve incredibly.", "Some teachers aren't friendly and approachable, nor respect student's ideas however  they effectively teach students what is needed.", 'There are teachers who are passionate about what they do and they encourage the students to do their best. The medical classes are a great experience for upcoming medical students.', 'This school is great if you know you want to go into the medical field but is unsure of what exactly you want to. They educate students very well on there options and generally do what they can to make sure all willing students will succeed.', "The food is not bad,but it could be better. Some kids don't even eat lunch.", 'This school  has alot of rules and breaking them comes with consequences. Detention, suspention, etc...', 'Everythimg in this school is just okay!  It could be worst, but it is not.']
