column1: Frederick Douglas Academy VII High School
column2: ['Frederick Douglass is a very good school. It feels very home like and has a nice sense of community. The school is not very big so most students know each other and also know all of the professors. The teachers are very active in students learning and are very helpful to those who need extra support. The faculty attends to students needs and are provide a firm hand to help kids stay on the right track and make sure they succeed. Helping students graduate and prepare for college is very important to the school. Teachers stay until dark with students to help them go over college essays, applications, and even mailing documents to schools. Frederick Douglass was an integral part of helping me get where I am today.', 'My school ttys their best in making sure that every individual is being successful . And they would go to any extent to make sure of it.', 'It had there good and bad days. Been there for four years and got tired of it.', 'Didnt have a lot of activities.', 'There is alot of police and school safety agents around. The nurse is always on duty and very helpful and when there is danger, we always have locksowns just to be safe.', 'I love all my teachers they are cool and funny and I always take away something from class. Class is usually fun and exciting and is rarely ever boring unless you genuinely do not like that subject or teacher. Grades are always fair and they give you many chances to make up work. So if you fail then that is on you.', 'The school building is not new. It is shared between two or three schools so it can get dirty especially the bathrooms. Technologies are inproving, they are bring more computerized work into the classroom on laptops. The guidance councler is always there and is helpful and so is the college advisor. There is tutoring every week, morning and evening. Teachers are always willing to put it extra time with their students.', 'Staff are very strict. They will quickly suspend you for any wrong doing and if you are not wearing proper uniform , you either stay in the office all day without going to class , get a call home or have to go home to go get proper uniform if the school is out of loaners.', 'We have every subject you would ever need and the best teachers. There is always something new to learn and the teachers are always prepared with work and lessons for their students. There is medium to a lot of homework weekly hover it is not always alot. Gym will always be the favorite class.', 'There is a really good basketball team at the school. Both male and female teams. We love our players and many students come out to support them', "There aren't enough clubs to get the students interested in joining and the clubs that we do have, have little members. However we still have fun in our small groups and the club advisors are great.", "My experience has been satisfactory. My eduacation and professors have been great. But I haven't had much fun being there. It is a small, low budget school so we make due with what we have. There aren't many trips or clubs and some of the children like to act out making learning harder for other students.", "It is very easy to make friends at this school but I wouldn't say it is very social. Everyone has their own clivk and tend to stay within their groups of friends. People love to show off around their friends but I wouldn't say that there is much peer pressure. Everyone is basically black or hispanic and from the Caribbean. We all get along for the most part but there are always those people who have problems with everyone for no reason. Overall the school is pretty good but not very social.", 'My school is very efficient on all counts of personal safety, bullying, special security measures, police and safety services.  Our staff is very well trained and efficient in all areas.  \r There has never been a problem since i have been a student.', 'College course\r workload very fair\r morning tutoring and evening touring\r excellent teaching staff\r advance schools', 'Excellent\r National Honor Society\r we have a variety', 'The Student Culture & Diversity is excellent.', 'At our school our nurse takes great care of the students', 'What made my experience pleasant is the acquaintances I made. Also some teachers made learning fun which kept my interest throughout the year.', "In our school the athletic opportunities we're given are basketball and baseball. Our basketball team's coach and players are very driven and take the game seriously. At a point they were ranked number 1 in their division."]

column1: Eagle Academy for Young Men of Newark
column2: ['Eagle Academy for Young Men of Newark is an all boys school in Newark, NJ and  is a great school that helps kids prepare for college.  The school has many different cool clubs that helps kids bond and the teachers care about the students.', "Eagle Academy is a school based on brotherhood that brings a great deal of confidence in each and every student. This school doesn't purely focus on developing young men to do well academically, but it focuses on the character development of each and every student. Many students like myself have changed a lot since the first day of attending Eagle Academy in the sixth grade. This school is also partnered with Streetsquash Newark which is an urban squash program. This program brought a unique sport into both my life and Eagle Academy. Eagle Academy has helped me grow in confidence to speak out in public and even develop a strong passion for the sport I love, squash.", "I enjoy that eagle academy is a small school so you receive individual attention that's really good for you in a way.", 'I’ve been at Eagle Academy for 6-7 years now  and I  enjoy the environment the teachers, staff and students bring everyday.', 'I enjoyed being with friends who is the same color as me. I enjoyed getting along with teachers, but sometimes teachers need our help, so we help them out.', 'Being at Eagle Academy for Young Men of Newark I learned how to be confident and resilient also Eagle Academy gave me the tools to be a young successful men when I get into real world by teaching me how to be properly dressed, code switching and always be open to new opportunities. The school culture at Eagle Academy is excellent, we have different traditions that we have to follow like libations when we pay respect to our love ones, house where learn about our house leader ( Malcom X, Roberto Clemente, Nelson Mandela and Muhammad Ali) we also have our annual moving up ceremony where we come together as a school and celebrate new beginnings for the school year by rewarding every kid in each grade with their specific tie. Eagle Academy for Young Men of Newark keeps the young men in my city grounded and show them what it takes to be adult in the world by giving us multiple opportunities to expand our knowledge and choices in life.', "One thing I like most about the school is their care for the students' futures, ie: their preparation for tertiary institutions and their personalities."]

["Although I was only at Bronx Haven for only about six months, it was one of the best six months every. Bronx Haven is a very small community and everyone at Bronx haven cares about you and want to see you success! We truly are a family. Not only is Bronx Haven academically up there, you also have a whole lot of fun. They try to make it as traditionally as possible while also keeping and en growing our culture. The trips are amazing and there's always great food! I loved it there and I miss it!", 'the teachers and advisors made me feel so comfortable, but yet pushed me to my potential i recommend this school to anyone who needs a small environment']

['I transfered to Media and Communication in my Junior year. Being the new student can be difficult; however, everyone welcomed me. The staff are professional and the teachers are knowledgeable. They are serious about learning. They are available for tutoring, if needed.', "What I'd like to see in my school is a sense of organization with activities and faculty, things are pretty chaotic but I make it through the day with ease. It is pretty easy to access different college preparation programs because of all the flyers and helpful guidance counselors.", 'Being an student here since 10th grade and coming from the Dominican Republic this school was pretty easy to adapt for me. The school has an amazing diversity and the teachers are pretty nice, it has a family-like feeling. The resources that could help this school develop even more are not a lot, since it does not get a large amount of help from the higher authorities. From my personal perspective as an student, I consider that with more help this school could become a really above average education center in some time.', 'High School for Media and Communications is a very nice and welcoming school. Their staff is very kind and helpful and make you feel a part of their family.', 'I am currently a junior in this high schools, and this is the school that you want to come to for your educations. The teachers are great and they know how to make yourself improve.', 'The High School for Media and Communications is a great high school. A lot of diversity. many students from different parts of the world especially from the Dominican Republic. I would like for there to be a little bit of more strictness and teachers to be more involved with the students. As well as more school activities together such as performances and trips.', "Great school for diversity.  The time I was there I wish they would've been more flexible and organized. ", 'There is a health center where students are able to get check ups or any medical need they require', 'My favorite after school activity was Cycling, and doing various of  things, such as swimming, riding bikes, running, and working out', 'If I could do it all over again, I would. The teachers really support students to make them move forward.', 'Many Of the teachers get students involved', 'Everyone at this school gets along with each other, they will discuss any misunderstanding and will continue to be friends.', 'The health and security of our school is very good! they are always protective of their students.', "Overall through the past years, this school has provided me with a different world. I have learned that things wont work my way, but instead i can intend to ameliorate them. It's been a heck of a high school experience, i feel greatly inspired by all my teachers and specially the principal of my school. This school is very unique in my point of view, simply because the teachers and staffs and principal are not just there for a paycheck but to change our lives and support us all the way. I am very grateful to have them as mentors. Sadly this will be my last year and the school is at faced out, which means the good and overwhelming spirit will end.", "Not the best food.. but it's alright for a public school. Most lunch ladies are nice.", 'If a student disobeys the school policies he will be warned, but if the this individual continues a disruptive behavior he will be punished. The principal is very fair with everyone.', 'Most students that were inactive are very dedicated to participate in activities at school. Many students are willing to do team work and are very fair when competing.', 'Teachers are very respectful and are willing to come to saturday school to help with any troubled students', 'We are very grateful for all the clubs and opportunities the school provides everyone no matter who they are.', 'Ever since we encounter and worked very hard with our new principal, Mrs.Poswell, she has brought to us  many opportunities to our dreams. Even though the school is closing, she has given her all and we all really appreciate it. She took us all to Harvard! , even though we may not get accepted to that university we at least had a little taste of the world outside our miniature bubble inside another gigantic bubble. We are required to write weekly essays for all our classes. This pushes us to become better writers and it teaches us that responsibility and determination can really take you places.I do believe we are all ready for any challenges.']
column4: ['I transfered to Media and Communication in my Junior year. Being the new student can be difficult; however, everyone welcomed me. The staff are professional and the teachers are knowledgeable. They are serious about learning. They are available for tutoring, if needed.', "What I'd like to see in my school is a sense of organization with activities and faculty, things are pretty chaotic but I make it through the day with ease. It is pretty easy to access different college preparation programs because of all the flyers and helpful guidance counselors.", 'Being an student here since 10th grade and coming from the Dominican Republic this school was pretty easy to adapt for me. The school has an amazing diversity and the teachers are pretty nice, it has a family-like feeling. The resources that could help this school develop even more are not a lot, since it does not get a large amount of help from the higher authorities. From my personal perspective as an student, I consider that with more help this school could become a really above average education center in some time.', 'High School for Media and Communications is a very nice and welcoming school. Their staff is very kind and helpful and make you feel a part of their family.', 'I am currently a junior in this high schools, and this is the school that you want to come to for your educations. The teachers are great and they know how to make yourself improve.', 'The High School for Media and Communications is a great high school. A lot of diversity. many students from different parts of the world especially from the Dominican Republic. I would like for there to be a little bit of more strictness and teachers to be more involved with the students. As well as more school activities together such as performances and trips.', "Great school for diversity.  The time I was there I wish they would've been more flexible and organized. ", 'There is a health center where students are able to get check ups or any medical need they require', 'My favorite after school activity was Cycling, and doing various of  things, such as swimming, riding bikes, running, and working out', 'If I could do it all over again, I would. The teachers really support students to make them move forward.', 'Many Of the teachers get students involved', 'Everyone at this school gets along with each other, they will discuss any misunderstanding and will continue to be friends.', 'The health and security of our school is very good! they are always protective of their students.', "Overall through the past years, this school has provided me with a different world. I have learned that things wont work my way, but instead i can intend to ameliorate them. It's been a heck of a high school experience, i feel greatly inspired by all my teachers and specially the principal of my school. This school is very unique in my point of view, simply because the teachers and staffs and principal are not just there for a paycheck but to change our lives and support us all the way. I am very grateful to have them as mentors. Sadly this will be my last year and the school is at faced out, which means the good and overwhelming spirit will end.", "Not the best food.. but it's alright for a public school. Most lunch ladies are nice.", 'If a student disobeys the school policies he will be warned, but if the this individual continues a disruptive behavior he will be punished. The principal is very fair with everyone.', 'Most students that were inactive are very dedicated to participate in activities at school. Many students are willing to do team work and are very fair when competing.', 'Teachers are very respectful and are willing to come to saturday school to help with any troubled students', 'We are very grateful for all the clubs and opportunities the school provides everyone no matter who they are.', 'Ever since we encounter and worked very hard with our new principal, Mrs.Poswell, she has brought to us  many opportunities to our dreams. Even though the school is closing, she has given her all and we all really appreciate it. She took us all to Harvard! , even though we may not get accepted to that university we at least had a little taste of the world outside our miniature bubble inside another gigantic bubble. We are required to write weekly essays for all our classes. This pushes us to become better writers and it teaches us that responsibility and determination can really take you places.I do believe we are all ready for any challenges.']
column6: ['The school offers a variety of sports for females, males and coeds. The equipment serves the purpose to the fullest extent. The school rallies behind the teams, showing love for the team during home games where seat availability decreases extremely fast. Our weight room has led to many transformations as well.', 'Overall the teachers are fair. The teachers that are my personal favorites make up for the teachers i do not prefer. The classrooms however are great. There is never a dull period in my school, as my classmates and i possess good relationships with one another and it allows us to consistently interact with humorous results. Also, the teachers sometimes become the butt of our jokes and they are okay with being so as well.', 'The school offers a variety of sports from football to wrestling. The school also introduces new programs such as Peer to Peer tutoring which also helps seniors such as myself build community service hours. Our school administration strongly pushes students to get involved in rallies and school painting projects. I personally Look forward to the grils basketball season and the annual spring cookout.', 'In the Girls swim team theres no fan support. Maybe 4 or 5 people will come to watch a meet and other days just 2 people. In popular teams in the school like the baseball team or football or basketball there is a lot of people going to the games. The team performance is excelent in every team. Teams work hard and so do the coaches.', 'A teacher that I have only teaches in computers and another teahcer I have talks more. I like both styles being in AP in both of the classes with the teachers. Its important to have teahcers teach different ways because it will be benificial for college.', 'The swimming team is great. My school doesnt fund the team, another organization funds my swimming team and its great we have everything we need. We have tw coaches and a lifeguard. We have lots of swimming equiptment to swim.', "The school sucks...it's under funded and under staff.", 'The bathrooms are bad some are missing stall doors. Poor water in sink and fountain.  There are a lot of kids and meetings so when u need your guidance counselor they may not always be available. And we rarely u smart boards in our school.', "The school is full of Spanish kids some black and very few white. They don't know much english so everything has to be translated.  And it just takes away from the minority.", "Choices are pretty limited...they had a salad bar with one dressing.  Didn't have too many fruit options the normal was oranges or bananas but the quality of the fruit is poor. And the lunch itself was pretty bland. Pizza taste like microwave pizza. The over all quality and taste of the food is bad.", "Sports teams are okay. Or best sport teams are baseball,  softball,  volleyball,   soccer, and my last year there out football finally got to championship and won. School spirit could be better, they didn't have pep rallies or anything to show school pride.", 'For me personally I got lazy during my senior year and that should not reflect badly on the school. But they provided little to no help in preparation for life after high school.', 'Most of the teachers are great and helpful.', "They had volleyball, track, baseball, softball,  soccer,  swimming,  basketball,  etc they programs most of them are very much under funded, and they have no academic activities. And getting students aware of what's going on in the school as far as that goes it's pretty poor. They school has poor communication skills in letting students know about things going on in the school.", 'The school is in a bad environment but all "school safety" doesn\'t make u feel safe but more trapped and watched. Students and teachers are bond to get into it wherever you go when you have opinionated students. They have anti bullying speeches and gatherings but the guidance staff there seem to favor the Spanish kids because they are the same race as them. And offer little help when you have a problem. They have a strict no hat policy which is understandable in the classroom but is a bit annoying outside of the classroom.  The school doesn\'t have any lockers or anything so we have no where to put those things as well as coats, bag, umbrella etc.', "When I first started in that school they laid out what was expected of us as students for the next 4 years of high school.  As freshman we all had 8 to 9 periods and as we progress through high school and pass all our classes the following year we're suppose to have less classes. My senior year I had 7 classes and only needed 4 classes to graduate. The teachers are very helpful but the way the principal runs the school is inefficient. The feel of the school it self is more of a prison than a school.", 'Most of teachers really care about the students', 'all this school cares about is sports', 'the administration really does genuinely care', 'many different sports that students are available to']

column1: Academy for Urban Leadership Charter School
column2: ["This school is still new compared to many other high schools. Because of this, trial and error seem to be the method they use every year in order to figure out what's best for the school. They tend to be unorganized and messy. Despite that, there is passion and love in everything they do. The administration, faculty, and students have a family-like relationship.", 'The teachers there are great, they really try their best. However, the administration (the board) really does not care about the students and rarely listens to them. The size is both a good thing and a bad thing. Everyone knows each other so there is a sense of community, but the school is so small that we had to go to another building to eat lunch.', "In our town, there used to be only one high school. Since everyone was mixed in with each other, it would be easy to get lost in a sea of students. However, when my parents heard of AUL, they didn't think twice to enroll me. Charter schools such as this focus on college readiness, and provide many events and resources to help their students plan for their future careers. If I could change anything, I would say that the school would run more efficiently if they focused on fixing and improving their internet access (and have more than one tech person on call).", 'Avoid this school at all costs. Students threaten teachers and administration looks the other way. There is no salary guide and a first year teacher makes more than an experienced one. Also, there is no motivation to want to do good when all you receive is threats and paycuts.', "The experience wasn't good, because the school has just started becoming a school. The education was okay, but needed better teachers.", 'I was part of the first graduating class for this high school and I truly loved my experience here. I am a now 22 year old young lady who now reflecting back can say I had wonderful teenage experience thanks to this charter school. Teachers were available any time after or during school hours, grading was college level which truly prepared me for Montclair State university where I attend school now, I made true life long friendships, was provided an internship opportunity, and attended/volunteered for several after school activities, on top of the many class trips I went on (technology services at Apple in NYC, Empire State Building, Rutgers University, Montclair University, etc.)', "The school is great there are flaws but if you look beyond them you'll she the good things the school has to offer", "It was terrible the school wasent really a school it needs to be fixed it lacks a lot of things textbooks desks classrooms it's way to small and teachers don't really teach", "Although the school wasn't great, it was a very diverse school and small as well where you know almost everyone. they have great sports team and few great teachers", "It's a small school where you know everyone and we all work as a team to show leadership. The teachers are amazing they know what they are doing. This school consist of students joining a lot of activity after school and during school. Aul has shown me to be more confident and also it made me prepare for college. I would totally recommend this school for any students that would like to be in a small environment to learn quick and better.", "When I started in this school there wasn't enough classrooms so sometimes learning would be hard due more then one class in the auditorium. But teachers would make the best from any situation. So many fun events and fundraisers that we did will always be remembered. This is school is unique because its about becoming a leader thinking about our future not only for our self but our whole community and class. You learn leadership skills and become a better person within. Learn not to be a boss but a leader!", 'The teachers really try to work with they have and make the best to teach the students, as well include life lessons to make have a more understanding of our environment and society. The teachers are very helpful when needed. This school is not a regular school its a family, teachers influencing all students for the better and  even teachers learning from their own students. Teachers here have fair grading and know their subject!', 'It was a \'better than I expected" experience attending my four years at AUL Charter HS. I met great people, with great intenstions and experienced more than anticipated. I attended prom, visted multiple college my junior year, went to broadway plays, the Federal Reserve Bank of NY, Senior sleepover trip, field days, battle of the classes, student government, and so much more. The school is so much more family oriented and invsted in striving to impact urban families. Teachers put in their own money for class trips to visit colleges. Teachers met with students outside class to assist emotional needs. I felt more like a person and less then a number. I would definetly both recommend and reattend The Academy for Urban Leadership Charter High School.', 'The best thing about being an Alumni from the Academy for Urban Leadership Charter HS was that my fellow classmates and I were the first ever graduating class! The school started with 100 freshman, than invited another 100 freshman the next year and continued untill we had all 4 grades with one 100 students per class. Teachers were honestly really great. It was a start up school which worked out incredibly well! We were a bit babied due to being the very originals, so favoritism was noticable, however; my teachers never made that an excuse to due poorly. Teachers were their for students inside and outside of school. Grading was harder than usual since it was ranked on a college grading level.', 'There are not many after school activities available for students.', "My favorite experience in this school has been the fashion show because a lot of people go and support and everyone has a good time.  This school is very unique the fact that is small makes it great but the fact that we have to constantly go to other buildings to use other facilities and it gets annoying.  Also the fact that we don't have a wide variety of clubs and organization it's not enjoyable.  I would only come back here just because of the education and preparation for college."]

column1: W.H. Maxwell Career & Technical Education High School
column2: ['I like how it is easy to pass your classes in this school. The teachers are interested in what they are teaching. They try to get the students interested in what they are teaching.', 'At Maxwell high school I really enjoyed their cte programs. I majored in cosmetology which I have grew to love over the past 2 years. There is nothing I would change about my school.', 'This school is amazing. The staff always goes above and beyond to make my child feel safe, secured, and ready to take on new challenges. The teachers are kind, and very intellectual in their subject. I trust in my heart that my child will be ready for college when she is finished at Maxwell. The principal is one of a kind; very friendly.', 'My first year was great. A lot of activities, kind teachers, and a safe environment. I feel safe and secured in this school. I can talk to some teachers, and trust them, and I feel like I am being prepared for college already, which is amazing. Love this school!!!!', 'Amazing school. The teachers and staff helped my daughter academically, and mentally, for college and the real world. Two of my kids attended this school, and it was a wonderful experience. Love it!!!!', 'This school is truly amazing. The classes help prepare students for college and the real world. The teachers are friendly and easy to talk to. I loved my experience here and I wish it never had end!', 'I believe being apart of a team that can use their experiences to shape the lives of the generations to come is a heartwarming gift. With reliable coaching, mentorship and cosmetology expertise, I am becoming a teacher worthy of trust and admiration. I made a decision to devote myself to the future leaders of tomorrow. Feeling lost is scary but with great support or guidance, empowerment wins. I plan to enrich the lives of youth who seek to gain valuable experience in our shared love of cosmetology. Upon completion of my degree in Career and Technology education, I plan to become an educator that builds future leaders.', "My time at W.H Maxwell CTE High School was very enjoyable. The school offers a wide variety of clubs as well as sports teams, to get students highly involved and interactive with each other. The kids are friendly so it's not that hard to make friends, and each student is very smart and creative. Not everything in that school is for everybody, but there is something in that school that everybody will like. The school offers HOSA, Robotics, Soccer team, Basketball team, Student Government and Skills USA. The classes are difficult so its best to study to pass the classes, but they are enjoyable with good teachers. There's an Honor Society as well as AP and mock college classes to get students ready for college with,  of course, college-like work. College fairs, college advisory, college applications, and scholarships are all available to you, as the school is trying to make sure we are all college ready.", 'My overall experience at Maxwell was truly amazing. I believe going to this school helped structure me into a stronger, wiser, and better individual. I encountered many wonderful souls that I can call my friends, and I developed genuine relationships with some teachers. This school helped me find myself, my passion, and my voice. I finally realized my dream of becoming a writer and feeling empowered by my amazing teachers to pursue that dream. Also, I really enjoyed my major class which is Vision Technology, which makes us learn about the eyes, make glasses, and repair them. Therefore, I would 100 percent recommend anyone without a single doubt to attend this school since it will help you find your purpose.', 'T he school is very strict, has a very strict uniform and no phone policy. the teachers are friendly. they really push you to do your best in order to graduate on time.', "I liked the different majors they offer with different possibilities. They ensure students know what to expect in the upcoming years. They could possibly add more clubs and student activities to add more diversity in career options. It would open up student's eyes more to numerous new hobbies or careers.", 'I liked how diverse and creative this school was. The teachers were helpful and honest although a little strict. The only thing I would probably change would be the phone policy', 'I like that the school have after school which you could go too for a credit or extra hours.The school needs to change the uniform and the school lunch.', "I've been in Maxwell since 2013 from freshman year till Senior year. It offers majors such as fachion, cosmetology, graphic design and health care. Maxwell offers lots of opportunity for students to succeed after high school. It prepares the students to be college bound students. The teachers make sure everybody is on track with their work. They make sure they teach at a level that is understandable to every students. Maxwell has good teachers/students interaction. The one thing I'd change is in the health care department. I want them to offer more CTE classes that will get the students motivated and more active.", "Not enough teachers. No good college readiness. They overwhelm their students. They give you classes that you don't need.", "So far my 3 years at Maxwell High School Has been fun but also bad. I've been able to take college classes , Do an internship, Do the Breast Cancer Walk and many other things. This school is not really a good school to bring your child if you want to keep them safe. Security there well most of them will do somethings but others will sit and not do nothing. The teachers are not all that good they don't really help you but a few. They only real good thing about this school is that you have a choice of choosing your major , taking college classes, going to visit colleges, joining a club involving your major, or doing an internship.", 'Very few clubs have fun options.', 'The school nurse provides many essentials to students, so their resources are always needed.', "Playing on the softball team was one of my favorite experiences in this school. I got learn to about a sport that I didn't have much interest in, but when I got to actually play on the softball team I really started to enjoy it. The reason why I wouldn't really chose this school again if I could do it all over again, is because of the lack teamwork. No one really wants to support each other, or even try to work together.", 'Most teachers interest in students is helping them to get into a good college or helping them write good college essay. Some teachers are consistent in their grading, others take very long to grade, they might even start grading a few days before grades are actually due.']

I loved my experience here and I wish it never had end!', 'I believe being apart of a team that can use their experiences to shape the lives of the generations to come is a heartwarming gift. With reliable coaching, mentorship and cosmetology expertise, I am becoming a teacher worthy of trust and admiration. I made a decision to devote myself to the future leaders of tomorrow. Feeling lost is scary but with great support or guidance, empowerment wins. I plan to enrich the lives of youth who seek to gain valuable experience in our shared love of cosmetology. Upon completion of my degree in Career and Technology education, I plan to become an educator that builds future leaders.', "My time at W.H Maxwell CTE High School was very enjoyable. The school offers a wide variety of clubs as well as sports teams, to get students highly involved and interactive with each other. The kids are friendly so it's not that hard to make friends, and each student is very smart and creative. Not everything in that school is for everybody, but there is something in that school that everybody will like. The school offers HOSA, Robotics, Soccer team, Basketball team, Student Government and Skills USA. The classes are difficult so its best to study to pass the classes, but they are enjoyable with good teachers. There's an Honor Society as well as AP and mock college classes to get students ready for college with,  of course, college-like work. College fairs, college advisory, college applications, and scholarships are all available to you, as the school is trying to make sure we are all college ready.", 'My overall experience at Maxwell was truly amazing. I believe going to this school helped structure me into a stronger, wiser, and better individual. I encountered many wonderful souls that I can call my friends, and I developed genuine relationships with some teachers. This school helped me find myself, my passion, and my voice. I finally realized my dream of becoming a writer and feeling empowered by my amazing teachers to pursue that dream. Also, I really enjoyed my major class which is Vision Technology, which makes us learn about the eyes, make glasses, and repair them. Therefore, I would 100 percent recommend anyone without a single doubt to attend this school since it will help you find your purpose.', 'T he school is very strict, has a very strict uniform and no phone policy. the teachers are friendly. they really push you to do your best in order to graduate on time.', "I liked the different majors they offer with different possibilities. They ensure students know what to expect in the upcoming years. They could possibly add more clubs and student activities to add more diversity in career options. It would open up student's eyes more to numerous new hobbies or careers.", 'I liked how diverse and creative this school was. The teachers were helpful and honest although a little strict. The only thing I would probably change would be the phone policy', 'I like that the school have after school which you could go too for a credit or extra hours.The school needs to change the uniform and the school lunch.', "I've been in Maxwell since 2013 from freshman year till Senior year. It offers majors such as fachion, cosmetology, graphic design and health care. Maxwell offers lots of opportunity for students to succeed after high school. It prepares the students to be college bound students. The teachers make sure everybody is on track with their work. They make sure they teach at a level that is understandable to every students. Maxwell has good teachers/students interaction. The one thing I'd change is in the health care department. I want them to offer more CTE classes that will get the students motivated and more active.", "Not enough teachers. No good college readiness. They overwhelm their students. They give you classes that you don't need.", "So far my 3 years at Maxwell High School Has been fun but also bad. I've been able to take college classes , Do an internship, Do the Breast Cancer Walk and many other things. This school is not really a good school to bring your child if you want to keep them safe. Security there well most of them will do somethings but others will sit and not do nothing. The teachers are not all that good they don't really help you but a few. They only real good thing about this school is that you have a choice of choosing your major , taking college classes, going to visit colleges, joining a club involving your major, or doing an internship.", 'Very few clubs have fun options.', 'The school nurse provides many essentials to students, so their resources are always needed.', "Playing on the softball team was one of my favorite experiences in this school. I got learn to about a sport that I didn't have much interest in, but when I got to actually play on the softball team I really started to enjoy it. The reason why I wouldn't really chose this school again if I could do it all over again, is because of the lack teamwork. No one really wants to support each other, or even try to work together.", 'Most teachers interest in students is helping them to get into a good college or helping them write good college essay. Some teachers are consistent in their grading, others take very long to grade, they might even start grading a few days before grades are actually due.']

column2: ['My experience with Global Studies was not so great but there was one teacher who I can say they really cared about our future.', 'I would like to first clarify that my high school is, Digital Arts and Cinema Technology high school. It was Brooklyn school for Global Studies two years ago but it has gone through many changes since then(We also no longer take middle schools students). It focuses on film and art and has two teachers that are constantly ready to work with students to create a project. With our small school population, all students are cared for by the faculty and classmates. The actual students are the only area of concern but once they mature, our school is perfect for any student wanting to  pursue the arts and prepare for the real world work environment.', 'I very much liked the school, the people are very supportive and truly know how to help the students out', 'Global is a very unique school and if I could I think I would probably choose this school all over again. My reason why is because the teachers there are very reliable and helpful when it comes to certain topics your stuck on and depending on your grades they can help you get into Advanced Placement (AP) classes and colleges classes as well. Also, some of the teachers are very nice and can be very friendly when you get to know them.', 'The principle and guidance counselors do not really reach out to the student individually.  In my school there is not really any bullying but lots of the students have no problem expressing their frustrations whether it is in a verbal or physical manner.  People do not really respect the dress code rules and do not bother with even trying to wear the uniform.', "My experience at my current school has had its fair share of ups and downs.  One of the best experiences that I have had was when I spoke to my science teacher about my job at the Brooklyn Children's Museum and we connected with each other over or love of animals.  Another great experience I had was when my school had a dance team and luckily we were able to preform three of our dances at Borough Hall.  If I could I would choose my school again because even though it is not the best the teachers offer help after school before school and during lunch, because they like to see their students succeed.", 'Although my school does not have lots of extracurricular activities the ones that we do have are engaging and fun.  We have cheerleading, basketball, volleyball, baseball, and the year book committee.  As a cheerleader in the school we show up to basketball games and do lots of fun things like have pep rallies.  To participate in any of these groups you must be dedicated, once you are a part of the team you are expected to be understanding to one another and responsible.', 'the resources and facilities are there for you but you must take advantage of it.', 'Unless you have a personality of a leader do go here ...', 'Not the best school for sports and fitness...', 'I Dont Like The Food ', "It's In A Bad area .. I Actuaaly didnt want to go to this school but this was my last choice", 'The extracurricular at this school is very fun ', 'I am a current student that goes to brooklyn school for global studies .I joined the volleybell team and i love it . it was my first time ever  playing volleyball', 'Health is okay .. And the safety policies i believe is not secured ', 'the overall experience at this school is fun and the best class was gym because it was a lot that we learned from like team work and leadership.', 'The academic offered at this school is ok because some will help but most teach does not .', "The school does not take pride in any of the activities or sports. Coming to school you can see that most people just come to finish their work so that they may get out of high school as fast as possible. What makes the process more delightful are the few teachers who take concern in the students as well as the college advisor who helps students as much as she's able to.", 'The teachers are actually a reason that most students tolerate staying at the school. Teachers seek out the students and helps us keep on track as well as taking the time to make sure we understand what we are learning in class.', 'The school administration are not bad. However, I can only think of a few teachers who are truly interested in seeing students be what they can be inside and outside of class. Most of the teachers think of themselves.']

column1: Arturo A. Schomburg Satellite Academy Bronx
column2: ['What I liked the most about Arturo A. Schomburg Satellite Academy is the warmth of welcome that the school staff brings. Also they treat you a little more like adults instead of kids to prepare you for the real world. I would like to see a change in the school spirit, meaning students being more in to activities such as clubs and events.', 'Satellite is a very good school , the school helped me grow as a person. Being a student at AASSAB was challenging but I’ve overcame it with the support from administrators.']

column1: Frederick Douglas Academy III Secondary School
column2: ['What I like about this school is the teachers and students there. They support and respect me heavily, which is beneficial. What I would like to see change is the school adding more college preparation courses.', "In my four year as a FDAIII scholar I had many fun experiences, such as being able to present my poetry to many people, also participating in the stunt team, being able to have a one on one relationship with teachers, all the resources that are available for those in need, all the AP classes available,and many more, and because of this is why i love FDAIII, however there are many other things i'm not so happy about, some examples are how dirty the bathrooms are, the food sometimes is not so great, we dont really enjoy of a big diversity, not many parents are involve in what occurs to their chilld, the area is not the best since so gangs are around, however our security is always keeping us safe. Frederick Douglass might not be the college of choice by many because it has some bad things, however what school is perfect, not even one, they all have their ups, and downs but not one is perfect and that is why i love Frederick Douglass Academy III.", 'It was pretty average not great and not bad just average. Like the school is good its just the students. So like people cant get mad at the school because its up to the students to take advantage of what the school offers. Instead of complaining about the school being bad but its whatever you make it out to be.', 'The school has an unique environment but not enough to make up for all its short-comings.  The water from fountains is undrinkable , there are infestations,and at times is very dirty. The thing that makes the school somewhat bearable are all the different people you will meet.', 'The Teachers and staffs are so supportive. The students are there for one another *friends* and no one gets left behind!', "What I enjoyed about my recent years in FDA III was the diverse programs they offered. There was always something to keep you involved in the community. Whether it was being in student council, national honors society, or taking a trip to Africa. What I would change is not the rule emplied but they way they are emplied. If you enforce restrictions on one kid, do the same to all kids. There should never be a school where they pick and choose which child should follow directions and which shouldn't.", 'There are many different clubs and teams the students can chose from and the teachers help students to better understand the work. There are also AP classes if they pass the refular courses.', 'I like the teachers and therefore the staff. Its overall an alright school. If i were to change one thing would be the schedule... and or... the way the students treat one other and or the teachers.', "When I had first came to Frederick Douglass Academy III I didn't know what to expect. It was a new school with new students and new faculty and I couldn't get adjusted right away. I went through many trials and tribulations, though as time passed I built bonds with many of the people there and they helped me grow into a better person both in and out of the classroom for which i'm thankful for.", 'I personally do not see any bullying at this school towards no one. Special security measures are always intact and fast responsive in case anything seems to occur.', 'What makes this school unique is most of the caring teachers and loving counselor. I know if i ever have a situation about something their is always someone i can confide in the building.', 'Most of the teachers care about the students education and want to push them to their full extent.', "The deans here are the best, although short-staffed, they do their jobs as best as they can. Dealing with a lot of these kids that don't respect their peers or parents can be frustrating, but they do their best to contain the situation. The environment surrounding the school is not good at all, but they try their best to keep all the negative things out, so it won't affect the education they are getting in the classrooms.", "The low funding doesn't allow for the development of extracurricular activities for after school. The low budget also limits the availability of materials needed for these activities.", "If it wasn't for the teacher there, I would've transferred. The environment is not safe. The teachers often have to pay of-of their pockets for their classroom materials. The students do not have any respect for the teacher, and the parents do not have respect for the staff. They began recently to do peer groups which help influence other students, but the matter of it all is the low level of discipline these kids have. It's just a sad situation to see.", 'Because of the geographic location, and the poverty in the area, the school does not recieve the appropiate funding it needs in order for their students to suceed. The classrooms are overcrowded, the school is short- staffed. It could be a better situation, if it was funded properly.', 'its fun . we go on trips', 'I am not really sure', 'They can be cool at times.', 'Since the school used to be from 6-12th grade a lot of the people had prior connections with each other and it was hard as a new comer to try to create connections because everyone was already so cool with each other.']

column6: ["The teachers would go above and beyond yet they can only try so hard. I entered in 11th grade where college is all they could talk about. Although they were encourging us to go to college most were suggesting not to try anything other than community college. Although community college has a great education method i personally wanted to dorm and this wasn't as encouraged because they were lucky to have their students even wanting to go to college.", 'I think the safety of this school is pretty good. The school nurse takes good care of us.', 'well the extracurricular activities that I know of is basketball, volleyball, and soccer. There is a lot of commitment to these activities because we have practices everyday and everyone comes whos participating in them.', "well my favorite experience is when we do something good for the community. For example, doing community service at many different parks with the whole entire school. I think what makes this school unique is the teachers that we have, who really cares about us and what to see us succeed in the future. But the students we have today does not respect that and does not want to see that also the mostly do not care at all either. I wouldn't choose this school again because in my opinion I feel like their unorganized in what they do. For example, I wasn't able to get my advance regents diploma because they did not give me the class that I wanted to be able to receive it by the time I was ready to graduate.", 'the teachers at Frederick Douglas Academy III Secondary School is great at what they do. Their teaching style is great but not as great as they should be, meaning the teachers has to stop a few minutes for students that is not a scholar and behaving like a five year old. the interest is okay but of course not every lesson that a teacher is teaching are going to be interesting. But I will agree tremendously that teachers communication skills are great because when a student needs help or needs some catching up to do. they give a variety of options to make up the work so the student can pass the class and they have after school open to students that wants the help. the grading is not consist because we would do work that is from like 2 weeks ago and its not updated until a few days the marking period is over, which is not helpful because we cant fix the grade and get the grade that we want if the grading system is not updated.', 'This school is great academic and extra curriculum wise. The quote "Without struggle there can be no progress" is the perfect explanation for FDA III. The work challenges your knowledge and the teachers are very helpful. If I could do it all over again I would choose this school because all of the staff is so friendly and willing to help with anything.', 'its okay meaning its just that, not good and not bad', 'this school is okay meaning its just that, not good not bad.', 'Staff are always concerned about children safety', 'School safety always make sure everything is controlled.', 'Perform lots of relevant trips. Committed to students', 'Facilities get cleaned about once a week.', 'High school did not help me at all.', 'The extracurricular activities at the school are very open but they also come with a commitment. They have rules that come with the activities and sometimes they have requirements in getting into the programs. In some of the programs you travel all around the United States and explore many new cultures. Some are leadership programs which offers scholarships and help you become a better person in life.All the activities in the school help you in some type of way it just all depends on how you obtain the information.', 'All of the required classes are stressed the most. Teachers and faculty make sure students pass the class and do what they have to do. The work in the classes are sometimes difficulty because the teachers love giving students a challenge and believe in higher level thinking. They believe every student has the chance to be successful so they challenge us.', 'The school is strict with uniform and disciplinary policies. The faculty are involved during the school day. The deans make sure all students are in uniform and are always in class. The guidance counselor and office staff are very supportive with students and make sure they are always on the right track.', 'Many of the teachers in the school care about the students and their grades. They stay after school to help them with work they need help with. At certain times the teachers will stay to 8:00 pm just trying to help the students pass or get a higher score on the test. Many of the teachers in my school love to award the students with their hard work, so sometimes they would order pizza or any type of food for the students that did good. Some of the teachers are like the students best friend where they listen to the students problem and help them with situations. Also the teachers love to be involved with student activities, many of them come to the basketball games and many of them participate in the student vs staff game.', 'the school is great but the students are the problem.', 'she helps a little bit.', 'Some policies are senseless especially one about students are not able to bring their phones to school. That is not safe at all because my school is around projects.']

column2: ['I like that the fact the teachers want to see  you succeed and are willing to put out extra effort to ensure that u have the best possible chance to succeed. They have a good administration that not only can interact with children great academically bit can also communicate with students on a social level by understanding where their coming from and this allow some students  who are not outspoken to be able communicate. I would like to see more after school activities for kids to be able to learn and become more involved.', 'Schulerville Preparatory High School is a very good school with fun classrooms. The teachers not only educate you but they get you prepared for your life after high school which for most is college.', 'Could improve in its curriculum and requires more resources; for what they have they are doing an amazing job, they need help is all', 'This school has been both a positive and negative change in my life. I love the staff and the energy everyone gives out when entering the school. However when it comes to the grading system, a couple times, they would round my grades to the nearest tenth percentage. Which I found to be completely unfair. On the other hand, it is progressing every year.', 'My experience has been great in schuylerville. If you hang out with the right people you’ll be sure to be out in 4 years. There are a lot of things about schuylerville that I love.', "Schuylerville isn't a bad school but it could be better. Teachers at the school are nice and they care about how you're doing in class.", 'I like the fact that the school is very welcoming of the freshman’s and anyone who is new. I would change the fact that they only have a small amount of clubs and activities to get me and my fellow classmates envloved.', "It's a good school with not a lot of activities but a lot of good people. The school has a lot of good teachers who are very professional. However being that it's a new school it's now that it's starting to have good programs. Overall it's a fun school.", 'My time in this school has been worth it. The teachers are outstanding and care about the students. They teach to learn which is the main goal in this school. The peers are  wonderful and everyone gets along perfectly fine.', 'Its a decent school, its still in its rebuilding process. But overall thre experience was pretty mediocre', "The school is very family centered. It's a small school in a big campus so everyone knows each other . The school is very disorganized . The teachers don't always do their best to engage the students, they always seem to give up and not make them work hard. Some teachers are even lazy and they accept it. The school barely provides help to those going to college. Once you get accepted to a college, the help is gone and it's rare if you see your counselor. You are left on your own and get your own help. There are not a lot of clubs or activities and the ones that exist aren't really legit and they don't really benefit the students. The school itself could be safe but with 5 other schools involved it is not safe. Students there get influenced easily and start acting upon how they see the others and it creates a not so safe environment. There are fights and incidents constantly. Parent involvement happens, which is good.", 'The staff are friendly and easy to relate to.Its an easy environment to adapt to and not hard to make friends in.The teachers do everything to help their students exceed in their academics.I would hope in the future there will be more college programs.', "This school is a very friendly and engaging school. We are in a building with 5 other schools so there's always something to do and a club to get involved in. The teachers are caring and very loving they understand your frustrations and they will help with anything you need.", "I didn't like anything about it. They messed up our credits and didn't give un electives so most seniors won't be able to graduate because of them.", 'The teachers at my school are phenomenal when it comes to making lessons engaging and intertesing. Some of the teachers have good communication while some do not. For example, some teachers state they will post grades online but it will take them a long after to do it.']

column1: The Marie Curie School for Medicine, Nursing & Health Professions
column2: ['Throughout my years it’s been a lot of change. The new principal created so many changes. More attention in sports, more activities involving students.', 'My experience in Marie curie was amazing wonderful and very helpful because of how it got me where I am Know. Teacher are ver wonderful and amazing they help you in anything you need and there very understandable and very har working with there students. It was a amazing 4 year of my life that I would never forget', "Pretty great school while i was there. School was small enough to get to know everyone including administration. I graduated back in 14 so don't know how much the school has changed on a daily basis. I can definitely say that the teachers do keep in touch! I've gone to a couple homecoming events and they have greeted me with open arms. Anytime i need anything regarding work or school they are always willing to lend a helping hand.", "As a senior in MCHS I feel that it could be a better school. It's only one floor but everybody will know your name. The staff are really nice and supportive. That's probably the only good thing about the school.", 'Marie Curie High School is a great school that offers college readiness classes that helps prepare students for college.', 'This school has prepared me and helped me through my college process and the staff is very supportive through our academics.', 'They don’t give what they promote l. Don’t have many programs to get us started on the health Professions that’s the students are interested in. They took away many sports programs so children aren’t constantly active. They changed over time', 'During my attendance at Marie Curie High School I was given the opportunity to earn my CNA license during a two year internship. Academically this gave me an advantage because I was able to experience what classes outside of high school were like. It also gave me a great platform to get a job that helped me and my father support my two younger brothers. Marie Curie is a very small school, by senior year the entire class has an unbreakable bond with each other and the staff. Although I have plenty of great memories of being in high school I do get passionately mad when I realize just how little resources we had. We often saw teachers come and go very quickly, the books and desks were in an unimaginable condition. But somehow the teachers who did stick by our side made it work. When I graduated, with honors, I genuinely felt I had made two families proud. My own and the teachers and staff at Marie Curie.', "Since my high school was so small, everyone knew everyone, which was good and bad. The teachers remembered your name and they were very cool. I would love for this school to expand it's location and staff, as well as be more involved in the nursing field.", 'because i want  to be a nurse in order to help people. i want to treat people injury. i want to go back to my country to save people life in suffering.', "I graduated in class of 2012. It's a very interesting enviroment; in the specific one floor the institution is concentrated on. The teachers are attentive, and very wary of each student. To cut it short, and sweet. It was a FINE high school. The place doesn't always make the person, but the person makes the place. A great institution for Medical concentrated students. Overall a better choice, than an average big school. More attention towards the students. My peers and I misunderstood the concept of being looked after. Now 6 years forward nothing but respect for this once a second home for me.Former soccer captain,Student Government, Overall a athlete for the school.Go cougars and love for the green and white.M.R.O", 'The school is very unorganized and the students there have a hateful attitude which makes the school worst but its what you make of it.', 'Marie Curie is a small 1 floor school which allows a tightly knit school community. T principal and teachers know all the students and make the learning enviroment warm and welcoming. Being a medical high school many medical after school programs are offered. The school has a strong partnership with Monteforie Medical Center Hospital, creating an array of activities for the students.', 'Marie Curie is an exceptional school for students who thrive for more. They offer all sorts of club activities such Green Club, National Honor Society, Dance, Mock Trial and many more. Sports are also offered through Softball, Flag Football, Basketball, Soccer and Volleyball. School spirit is shown everyday especially for homecoming. However with all schools, there is bound to be a minor set back such as school food. Marie Curie has an abundance of classes that help juniors and seniors think about college and how to prepare through advisory and junior/senior seminar.', 'There are some staff at this school who are truly devoted to pushing students  to do their best everyday and continue their education after high school. However, I feel that there needs to more of a push to get students involved in extra curricular activities and the school need to provide more academic support to student who are struggling in a certain area (especially math).', 'It is a small school with dedicated staff. Staff members are very helpful and informative about high school and college tasks. The environment is friendly when with the right people.', "I don't think it's the worst school but there are definitely better choices. The best nursing program they offer is the Jewish home program.", "My experience at this school was good overall. There are teachers that really care about you, and that want to see you succeed and want the best for you. The teachers can teach really well, and will make sure you understand the class. What I don't like it's that we are on one floor because we share with a middle school, so the halls can get very crowed.  The students are nice, and since it's a small school, you will get to know a lot of people. There are no fight in this school, because the majority of the students get along well. Another thing I don't like it's the food. Sometimes it's good, but other times you'd rather starve. But the school is very nice, I like it.", "My experience in Marie Curie high school was honestly very mind changing. This school contains so many clubs where you can get your mind off things. Most of my time I spent it playing softball which I am really passionate about. Playing softball my communication skills increased and I also got so close to my coach. He made me feel like his daughter and I think I am speaking for everyone in the team when I say he puts us first. I also grew up after joining this Sisters group. Those girls become your sisters and we seriously looked up to each other. These clubs seriously changed my life, not only because of the girls but the instructor is now my second mother and always kept her word no matter what. Something this school has that most schools don't is people who care. I felt affection and encouragement from all the staff members and the teachers I grew a bond with. Everyone there genuinely want what’s best for you.", 'I like that my school is a very small school. Most staff members know your name and a lot of them work hard to encourage kids to work hard and fight for anything they want in life.']
