column8: ['There was little players compared to other high schools. There is plenty of gym though.', 'The school has a regular school cafeteria, there are no menus, staffs serve each student as they come to retrieve food. Healthy options are provided, we have a salad bar and fruit bar.', "Since it's a health school, health is taken very seriously. Health programs and resources to help better your education is provided such as internships. The school nurse is shared with another school but is well known for helping those who needs him/her. Security guards are always around and providing a safe environment. Bullies are not allowed and violence is taken care of once or if it ever occurs.", 'Teachers are interested in the well being of the students, in their prosperity and their individual works. Teachers recommend many options for students and provide students with internships and activities. Teachers also provide their time after school hours to offer help with any topic. Teachers are also available during school hours and are easy to be found when needed at the school.', 'Guidance counselor and the assistant principle or the principle  are always involved in punishments and in policies. Parents are called in the school after a warning by the student has been broken. Teachers are attentive and detention is given if any rules are broken.', 'A.P courses, Honor Roll classes', 'Soccer, basketball. running team, music and art are provided. Clubs like Student Government, year book, National Honors Society is very helpful, engaging and great!', 'Our guidance counselor is very helpful, and organized.', 'My experience at The Marie Curie High School has been very good so far. It has most of the stuff i need when i need them. The staff is very helpful and very social to every student. My overall experience in this school since the day i entered has been very pleasant. Every teacher tries its best to have all students in track and they do care about their students when they need help or are going through a rough moment. For me, the fact that teachers try to always maintain you in track is far the most important thing i get from this school. Many people when they graduate say that the school does not have many things to offer but the reality is that even though the school does not have many activities, all staff members work very hard to help each and every student when they need something and are always there to make sure they can graduate one time with everything they need. This school is very unique because ts very small, but has a lot of students and not much place. But its also unique in the sense that we have great teachers who do not just sit there and let you do everything to learn, we have teachers who actually go to the front of the room, teach, and explain. If i had the opportunity of doing it over i would still be in this school because i do not regret coming here and staying in this school for almost four years already. ', 'In this school you need to try your best to get good grades.', "I have many friends and it's not difficult to get a high grade you just have to do what the teachers tell you to do. I love soccer even though we didn't go to the play-offs and I love most teachers. It's just the students in general that makes it bad.", 'The school is very small in general and every time you see somebody you know (which will be almost all the time) they will say hi to you or you say hi. Most people know each other and the teachers challenge you to work harder even thought the students get lazy most of the time.', "If the students don't say anything about the school sports nobody would know anything about it unless if it's only basketball which only some people like. I feel like the coaches and other staff members should make the teams better and more practices. Also i would love it if we have our own fields that we can practice at.", "They don't go to you to tell you for open houses, meetings with the colleges, but there is staff that you can go to and talk about anything and they will do their best to help you out.", "There's is pizza EVERYDAY and I think it's not that healthy to eat pizza everyday. Even thought they do offer sandwiches and salads.", 'This school in general is good but people make it bad.', 'Food options are terrible. We have the same bland burned pizza everyday. The chicken nuggets and chicken are always pink in the inside or extra dry. The bread used is suppose to be whole grain but it taste like it should be fed to dogs. ', 'Our school is not too good when it comes to technology. We used to have a college room where students could go use the computers for class assignments and do college research but we no longer have that. We only have 2 computers for 500+ students cramped in the 3 counselors office. Tutoring is good we have Saturday preps and regent prep on Tuesday and Thursdays. We have absolutely no parent involvement. ', 'Food is rarely good, but at the same time very poor. ', 'I have never been to school nurse before, so I do not know.']

column2: ["My experience in School of Education & Training was average. It has it's ups and downs at time but you can still get your education. Somethings i would change is how there security system is which is kind a terrible at times.", "The current high school I attend may not the best school in New Jersey, but it has been beyond great to me regardless of its faults. Though teachers come and go, one thing this school has taught me that has stuck to me, is to never give up and strive for greatness regardless of your circumstances. My particular academy gave me a sense of character and community. They gave us to the opportunity to speak our mind and we also had the opportunity to be a part of something bigger. We job shadowed early childhood teachers at a local preschool and bonded with kids who helped us build character and a sense of empowerment. Not only was did I excel academically and play a partial role in community service, it taught me a lot about who I need to be and where I need to be and I couldn't more grateful.", "What I liked about my high school was that I was able to gain knowledge and experience in education early on. I was able to learn about the different careers and certifications available to those pursuing this field. I was also able to get hands on experience in early childhood junior and senior year by going to a head start program and observing during my child development class. This was all great but the overall school needed more influencing and goals. Students need to be motivated. If I could speak about one change that was needed that would be the curriculum. Teachers and administrators need to enforce it rather than to let it slide and assume students in that school just don't care.", 'My Experience here as taught to have a lot of patience\'s with people, and that it is okay if you do not get it right the first time but to go harder your second time. Also Set taught me that no matter where you go, your are always are going to be stigmatized, but it is okay cause you no matter where you from its how you carry yourself and what you make of what you have.  What i would like to see change is the options that school offer, These kids are very intelligent but they do not have many people to show that too, When i first began here, i wanted to give up on all my dreams because my guidance leader told me i should  change my career choice.. My goal is to prove him wrong and let him know just because i live in " ghetto" place does not mean, I\'m going to be trapped here forever..', "I love my teachers to death. They are extremely supportive and understanding. They will help you if you are struggling in the class. We have after-school programs called Compete For Life which is very cool. However, the food is gross and we can't drink water from the water fountains due to our fear of the possible lead in it. We also have little money and constant fights. Even with all the negatives, I've met my closest friends there.", "Since this school is an urban inner city school , it was difficult for the motivation to be a great student to be visible. Throughout my years, I have met countless teachers, counselors, and friends who have made it outstandingly clear that it's not how you start but how you finish. I would like to see more resources brought to the school for more hands-on approaches to our curriculum and more significant progress in its athletics.", "It's been a really good expirience. Administrators and teachers are very helpful. I would like to see a change in the hallways where kids would not be able to walk around when they suppose to be in class. More securities in the hallways would be really helpful.", 'Out of all the four academies, I prefer my school (School of Education and Training) the best because of a better family friendly vibe I get from that school and I encourage any student to consider this school a prospect']

['The small school as very little in terms of resources compared to those around it yet the size makes for a close community and overall healthy environment with little to no bullying.', 'I like that the school is very small and that makes it easier for me to focus on academics as a student but I highly dislike the wedge formed and kept between stud ya and staff.', "Although the school doesn't have sports they make the best out of it by linking the kids who want to play sports with the boys and girls high school sports teams.", "No sports or clubs for students to engage in except debate and soccer. Teaching style is okay especially the math classes the teacher are willing to help students to understand materials. but as for the other subjects the teaching style is horrible. the principal is never around. i don't recommend.", 'This school helped me to get into college and chase my dreams of becoming and architect the teachers in this school are very motivational speakers and they work hard to make sure each student has achieved his or her personal goal. This school is in very need of a gym for sport for the following students there now.', "My favorite teachers are Mr. Alexander, Ms. Pigford, Mr. Nozil and Mr. Buford. They are the only teachers at Acorn Community High School that takes their jobs seriously and treats us like their kids. It was an honor getting to know these teachers because they opened my eyes to what the world really is like. Thank you and if you're willing to attend Acorn Community High School please look out for these teachers because they need all the recognition possible.", 'It needs some more extracurricular opportunities for students.', "There isn't much to do. There was hardly any school trips. Students have to pay for everything. The school never had any funds. There was no clubs. There was no use of lockers. There isn't a real gym to actually do exercise and students wasn't able to even use the gym lockers. If I could, I would go to a high school that would give me the high school experience I wanted such as having lockers so that I don't have to carry my heavy bag and coat everywhere, an actually gym, clubs and a school that goes on trips.", 'Some of the teachers are great and knowledgeable in what they do. I respect most of the teachers, who tries to encourage students to do better for themselves to have a good future in their life.', 'Ive met a lot of good people my age as well as other ages. We tend to stick together as a school, it is very small so everyone knows one another. I was able to get very close to the principle as well as my guidance counselor and at my weakest moments id seek them for help.', 'Some teachers put in more effort than others. After attending Acorn ive learned a lot from the staff as well as many of them care about me but its my job to love myself enough to want to succeed,', 'Teachers are good at providing knowledge', 'The teachers are very helpful if you take the time to help yourself than they would take the time to help you. Also the school is small so it will be easy to make friends.', 'The students are really accepting & non-judgemental. Most teachers work really hard to keep the students on track of their work & provide videos & group work. My favorite subject is ELA because you get to interact with the kids about your personal life & debate on the questions given.  I wish there was a Cheer leading team & a football team.', 'For my senior year there were three new A.P classes offered to us, including the two i took, A.P studio art and A.P college english. Each class offered a college credit if passed and the teachers worked with you to help you get assignment done.', 'Soon after graduating i got my first job. During the interview i remembered a lot of interview skills, for both jobs and colleges, that were taught to me and a week after my interview i was hired, that was a years and four months ago and i still have my job. A few months after getting my job i was accepted into Kingsbrough college.', 'As far as dress code u can wear what ever you want to wear.', 'The college prep resources are very helpful for all the seniors that are graduating.', 'Peer pressure is everywhere you go and all you go to be is say no.', 'the teachers care about their students and are very helpful. Sometimes the teachers would stay later to help you if you need help.']
column4: ['The small school as very little in terms of resources compared to those around it yet the size makes for a close community and overall healthy environment with little to no bullying.', 'I like that the school is very small and that makes it easier for me to focus on academics as a student but I highly dislike the wedge formed and kept between stud ya and staff.', "Although the school doesn't have sports they make the best out of it by linking the kids who want to play sports with the boys and girls high school sports teams.", "No sports or clubs for students to engage in except debate and soccer. Teaching style is okay especially the math classes the teacher are willing to help students to understand materials. but as for the other subjects the teaching style is horrible. the principal is never around. i don't recommend.", 'This school helped me to get into college and chase my dreams of becoming and architect the teachers in this school are very motivational speakers and they work hard to make sure each student has achieved his or her personal goal. This school is in very need of a gym for sport for the following students there now.', "My favorite teachers are Mr. Alexander, Ms. Pigford, Mr. Nozil and Mr. Buford. They are the only teachers at Acorn Community High School that takes their jobs seriously and treats us like their kids. It was an honor getting to know these teachers because they opened my eyes to what the world really is like. Thank you and if you're willing to attend Acorn Community High School please look out for these teachers because they need all the recognition possible.", 'It needs some more extracurricular opportunities for students.', "There isn't much to do. There was hardly any school trips. Students have to pay for everything. The school never had any funds. There was no clubs. There was no use of lockers. There isn't a real gym to actually do exercise and students wasn't able to even use the gym lockers. If I could, I would go to a high school that would give me the high school experience I wanted such as having lockers so that I don't have to carry my heavy bag and coat everywhere, an actually gym, clubs and a school that goes on trips.", 'Some of the teachers are great and knowledgeable in what they do. I respect most of the teachers, who tries to encourage students to do better for themselves to have a good future in their life.', 'Ive met a lot of good people my age as well as other ages. We tend to stick together as a school, it is very small so everyone knows one another. I was able to get very close to the principle as well as my guidance counselor and at my weakest moments id seek them for help.', 'Some teachers put in more effort than others. After attending Acorn ive learned a lot from the staff as well as many of them care about me but its my job to love myself enough to want to succeed,', 'Teachers are good at providing knowledge', 'The teachers are very helpful if you take the time to help yourself than they would take the time to help you. I wish there was a Cheer leading team & a football team.', 'For my senior year there were three new A.P classes offered to us, including the two i took, A.P studio art and A.P college english. Each class offered a college credit if passed and the teachers worked with you to help you get assignment done.', 'Soon after graduating i got my first job. A few months after getting my job i was accepted into Kingsbrough college.', 'As far as dress code u can wear what ever you want to wear.', 'The college prep resources are very helpful for all the seniors that are graduating.', 'Peer pressure is everywhere you go and all you go to be is say no.', 'the teachers care about their students and are very helpful. Sometimes the teachers would stay later to help you if you need help.']
column6: ['On the soccer team everybody gets a fair chance even if you was on the team last year.', 'Most of the teachers try their best to help the students but, the other are ruled and just don\'t care like they say "WE STILL GETTING PAID AT THE END OF THE DAY"', "Being that we don't have the most awesome gym in the world we still are active . If anything I want a more enthusiastic gym teacher. Our gym teacher is not really motivated and just lazy honestly .", 'If anyone at my high school reported a student being bullied or bulling someone else automatically the school would look into it and help in all the ways that they could to put an end to it.', "The teachers at the school were busy the first three years of my attendance so although they had after school programs that were focused on helping smaller amounts of students they were still too busy running around preparing things to focus their full attention on the students. But on the last year a lot of the teachers found time to help students one on one and be available to answer any questions that weren't answered during the day.", 'Many of the people who graduated in the Class of 2014 have found very nice schools to attend. A lot of my friends are going to diverse colleges all around the world from Buffalo to California and even Vermont or Canada. During our senior we got to experience the real world when we began applying for jobs and different colleges while trying to maintain a good GPA and still have fun. We learned how to pay bills and even to have more responsibilities around the house, school and community. I am excited to say that the Class of 2014 has had the most graduates within the last ten years of graduating classes and that with the constant help of the ten students that went to college summit (including myself) all of the graduates were leaving with a resume and at least one scholarship. Many students are going to their dream school and though some of to pay back loans when they are done, we have faith that it was all worth it.', 'During my Junior year of high school my school sent about 10 students away to a college prep that was called "College Summit". I had the great opportunity to be one of the 10 people that went along for this trip. We got to visit Daemen College in Buffalo and were allowed to stay in the dorms. This this week at Daemen we were taught to make resumes, personal statements and much more. We were also taught how to work together to make our last year of college easy and memorable. Once we returned back to Acorn the Principal was very excited to welcome us back and hear all about our experience. After talking to the Principal we began to see a change in many of the areas we felt needed help. The school became more organized, and the faculty was more available to the students and it was a great experience over all. Many of the students that went to the College Summit program returned to ACORN as new people willing to help our school  achieve in ways many people doubted. Being a school of the Community we had a diverse population of students and we found way to use that to our advantage. We gathered often times on Saturdays to help clean the neighborhood as well as our school and we started to see that all the people who were involved in the process were very happy after the changes we made.', 'People at this school are very diverse and nice when it comes to sharing personal experiences that they encountered while at UVM. When I went on a trip to visit UVM, many of the Alumni and the Juniors that were at the school were very nice to me and helped me see why UVM was such a great school that would provide a great experience for me. There is no bullying that occurs on campus and there are so many different people available that the school to help with different situations. The students at UVM are very accepting and nice when it comes to meeting different  people.', 'Everyone works to help build the next generation.', 'teachers work very hard and do their best to teach kids what they need to know, they are strict on getting us to stay on top of our game and continue excelling in school and out of school', 'the dress code is a very strict policy in the school anything inappropriate can result in suspension or being returned home', 'guidance counselors and college prep resources are very helpful in the school. they help students remain well informed on whats to be accomplished and how to be accomplished.', 'the workload in the school is manageable and the teachers are very helpful towards the students.', 'faculty members are strict on bullies but there are bullies nonetheless, its best to know who to steer clear of.', 'the school is to small to have an actual gym therefore athletics and fitness opportunities are very grim in the school', 'the policies are okay. before we used to have to wear uniform no we dont. they enforce school laws', 'the food is good for what they offer their variety is okay also the food is generally healthy', 'it has its ups and downs you have the thugs the "geeks or lames" regular people weirdos and stuck up', 'we have many technology in school. every room has an smartboard for teachers to use. it helps students get information easier and learn better. i would say that our school is one of the most technologically advanced schools in brooklyn', 'we have no gym, no teams but we do have a basketball program that students are allowed to come play on Tuesdays and Thursdays and we have games for students to watch on special events']

column2: ['Perth Amboy High School for me was an overall great high school experience. It has great teachers, and a wide variety of clubs to choose from. However, it’s administration has no consistency, and the school lacks parent involvement.', "Perth Amboy High School is taking amazing steps towards trying to make the students feel comfortable, represented, and like they have many opportunities. This high school has college fairs and meetings, always allowing for kids to see the opportunities they have and have a wide range of possibilities. Success is never impossible is the idea that this school highlights. As well as that, there are many clubs and sports, and the school pride is refreshing. The students are allowed to work towards their dreams and have fun while doing it. This school goes the extra mile to make sure the students have access to all of the materials, help, and advice that they need, giving an open environment to the students as well. Perth Amboy High School is a great school, but it isn't perfect. It's not as organized as it could be, but it's definitely improving in that aspect.", 'What I liked about Perth Amboy High School is that the building has everything you need. They give you laptops to take home and they redid the library and the offices. Plus, they do trips for juniors and seniors towards the end of the year.', 'I wish they would fix the lunch. A lot of the teachers are good and caring. It has a lot of variety in the classes that you can take.', 'Perth amboy high school is a school known for its culture and readiness. teachers here are always prepared for anything. A change i would like to see is the food. i would like if they upgraded it and started to give better food and tastier.', 'The thing I like/love about Perth Amboy High School, is the overall view and interior of the school as well as the teachers.', "So far, as a Senior at Perth Amboy High School my experience has been nothing short of humbling. Coming from a predominantly Hispanic and very prideful community, we take value in what we have to offer. Perth Amboy High has come a long way in the 4 years that I've been here. With the Freshman, Communications, and Health and Sciences academies Perth Amboy has made a turn for the better. Not to mention winning the National School of Character last school year, I can say that your experience at PAHS will be a time where you can grow and blossom into the person you wish to be.", 'Perth Amboy High school is a one of a kind school. Our school consists of mostly Hispanics and as soon as many people hear that, they associate our school with being inferior. But today, I’d like to enlighten the misinformed, for we are not as horrid of a school as many believe. Just because we’re from Perth Amboy, it doesn’t mean we have fights at school everyday, that we have no sense of manners, or have morals. No matter what many people have heard of Perth Amboy, one thing is for sure, our students crave for success. I gave our school four stars because we’re not perfect, for there are still small aspects that should be changed such as the fact that we lack teachers in some areas. Essentially this is not the students fault, because albeit the students want to succeed, one cannot do so if one is not given the right tools. Despite it all, we try to make the best out of everything and we support each other like one huge family.', "Perth Amboy High is a student that constantly seeks to improve but has miles of work ahead. One of the best aspects of the school are the teachers. Many of the teachers are very passionate about their job and love helping students in any way possible. This positive is counter balanced by the administration. Over the past few years many teachers have changed districts because of mistreatment from administration. Many staff from the current administration either work their hardest to limit a teacher's ability, drive away teachers through disrespect, or drive away teachers with high potential.Even though there are many teachers (and some staff) trying to improve the school for the community and teachers, it will take decades for it to catch up to top high schools.", 'great school really gets you involved in things and makes you want to put yourself out there and try new things .PAHS gets you ready for a real world experience and helps you if your struggling  in your academics.', 'The majority of the teachers are amazing and care so much for their students. They’re the type of teachers that will get stepped on constantly by their students and still remain with the same amount of compassion towards them. They choose to stay in the school district despite the terrible treatment they are getting from the administration. I am extremely grateful to have had such amazing teachers and they honestly deserve better than what they are getting at this school district. The academics at this school aren’t the best but 95% of the time, it has nothing to do with the teachers. Most students just don’t have the motivation to excel. They CHOOSE not to pay attention in class and they CHOOSE not to do the work. They do the bare minimum in order to get by as opposed to doing their absolute best. However, there’s also a small percentage of students that work extremely hard and it shows. As dysfunctional as it is, I would never change my experience at Perth Amboy High School.', 'I loved the unlimited opportunities that I was offered throughout all of my high school. It was truly a great experience.', 'Perth Amboy high is a good school, but I feel Like it can be better than what it is right now. I feel Like teachers and staff don’t really care about us students', 'The one major thing i liked about my high school was that everyone made me feel very comfortable with myself. From students , to faculty, they made me feel at home. I was basically a minority in Amboy high considering the school is dominantly Hispanic.  Even though i was one of the odds, Everton made and and others minorities feel very safe and welcomed. The one thing i would like to see change is more diverse students.', 'Perth Amboy has many great clubs the diversity is amazing. It offers a great dual enrollment college course with rutgers for any student being interested in the medical field.', 'Perth Amboy high school was very diverse it allowed many different people to interact with each other', "I'm starting my senior year in September, I've been attending this high school for my entire high school experience. There are many opportunities in it, you just have to look for them. The classes are good, most of the teachers are nice and care for your grades, there are assemblies every marking period in which certificates are given to students who got A's and B's in the marking period. Overall, the school gives many opportunities and is really great, I wouldn't want to go to any other school to finish my senior year.", "I've been attending Perth Amboy High school since freshman year and throughout freshman year i've seen a lot of changes through staff and the school overall. I participated in school activities and it isn't like many of the other schools. This school has a lot of diversity which makes it easy to interact and engage with one another. This school has received a lot of bad reviews but it honestly isn't a bad school and if a student is the type to not get manipulated by other students they would succeed and enjoy high school. I think one of the things that i would change is the way teachers and guidance counselors reach for students and try to get them motivated or push them to push their boundaries and join things and prepare for college. I feel like the problem a lot of students have is struggling to apply to college and they need help but they don't get the enough help from staff members in which they would sit down and talk to them and make a plan.", 'With my experience, the teachers are really helpful and want to see their students succeed.  The administration can do better to improve the school environment.', 'Perth Amboy High School is rich within Latino culture but not very diverse. The school is very overcrowded and students are not properly controlled. Administration is unreasonable and weak. Students are not properly punished and or rewarded. School events should also be promoted way more to spread the word. As for dress down days, students should be given more opportunities to dress freely.']

column6: ["I liked how, although Perth Amboy isn't filled with all the brightest students, our school had so much school pride. Our school is filled with so many talented kids, starting from dancers to artists, and there is a sense of a true family connection.", 'Perth Amboy High School had great counselors that aided me in my college and scholarship process. Many teachers really care about their students and what they teach.', "It's actually my first year in the main campus of our school. For the whole 8 months I have been attending this school, I realized the gym teachers room is in poor condition comparing to regular classrooms. Although, as a student it doesn't really affect me whether the gym teachers have a better office. I think it would help them discuss their next class for us in a cleaner office.", 'PAHS is made up of many talented kids but is also made up of many kids who aren’t interested or discouraged to push themselves to be good students. There are some amazing teachers but also some teachers who just show up to get paid. The activities available are cool but there isn’t as much student involvement as in other school and very little funding for them. Administration isn’t the best but it also could be worse. Uniform is enforced strictly for certain students and for others they’re allowed to use whatever they desire with no punishment.', 'Average college, i like the new classes they are adding like forensic class and dance class. its great to see it evolving each year. I wish to see counselors be more helpful with students helping them to see what are their interests are to pick a career and helping them to see the importance of their future is.', "Thoughout last couple of years, Perth Amboy High School has been the place where I've learned to do what's right instead of what's easy. Further, due to vicarious learning; I have a notion and realize how to behave, study, and survive without experiencing any of the consequences a bad habit might provoke. At Amboy High, the teacher I have taken classes with, always look out for you and try to enhance your proficiency level. In the other hand, I will like to see a change in what is the school's  spirit, making a family friendly environment, self appreciating from the students and being able to produce in the community.", "I've attended Perth Amboy Public Schools since Pre-K, so I am biased when it comes to my view of PAHS. This school has gotten a bad rap because of its below-average graduation rate, school fights, and poor grades. Despite this, PAHS is a great school; it offers many activities and clubs, from community service opportunities to advocacy groups, sports like wrestling football, and soccer, which are improving by the year, and a plethora of brilliant teachers who offer all kinds of courses — from AP to Honors. The truth is that if you want to accomplish something in high school, this school will help you do just that, but if you want to fail in high school, you'll see that failing is just as easy. The school can definitely use some improvement. For instance, there's a massive disconnect between the students and the administration, but there's no such thing as a perfect school, and PAHS is great for what it's worth.", 'Perth Amboy High was very connected. Everyone always made you feel welcomed and it was super easy to make new friends. Teachers were always willing to help you out if you needed extra help in certain courses and they made the classroom environment fun enough to help students learn easier. I loved that school.', "My name is Anibelka Sanchez, and I'm studying at Perth Amboy High School. This school for me is like my second home since it treats all students in the best way with teachers and an excellent work team. I am very proud to be a student of this wonderful high school. I am also very proud of myself because even though I do not have much time in this country, I have the motivation to continue studying to have a better future. Although the one who helped me to think like that was the wonderful High School since this school gives us a lot of motivation to all the students. For this reason this school is very important for me, since it makes all students think about a better future.", 'It’s a high school, where anything can happen once you achieve your goals. You start from very little and as you go grade by grade you grow to the best you can be.', 'I love my school because we have some great teachers and we get offered a lot of great opportunities. We also get a lot of help before, during, and after school.', 'PAHS is a good school with well trained students as well as well mannered students. During the past few years, the graduation rate of the school have increased substantially and I believe the school is going to be in greater heights and students will also aim higher for bigger and better opportunities in life. Teachers are always there to help and what I love most about the school is the After school learning center which is for free! Not many schools have this so I believe Perth Amboy High is a good school and we will always strive higher.', 'While the school had some teachers that cared; most of the attention was focused on the "honors" and "advanced placement" students that already have the self-motivation to succeed', "About P.A. High School I personally liked the way you are treated when you are a new student and everyone offers to help you but, I don't appreciate that months later everyone assumes that you know every event that is happening in the School or where to find all the teachers during classes. I will like to see change in the school's food due to the fact that most of it is fast food.", 'I like about Perth Amboy High School that there they give you opportunities to grow up and they help you to do what is better for you to be a great and profecional person. Also they have differents programs that is better for some students like hispanic or latinos because they some times dont know speak the English but they help everybody and the example is me because I was a new student and now I learn speak and read in  English.', 'The teachers in Perth Amboy High School care and do the best they can with the resources they have, however with that being sad the School could absolutely use a good amount money to allot to supplies and other resources they need.  Some say this school is not great at all and will refuse to send their children here, but as a former student of this school I can honestly say the school does not live up to its bad reputation. It has plenty of varying clubs and activities, some of which do volunteer work for the community.', 'Perth amboy high school is not one of the best schools to attend, neither am I implying that it is not a good school. It really depends on the staff you end up with and the students interest and effort in completing their four years with a job well done. Academics can be questionable but the extracurricular activities they provide are up to par. There will always be something or everyone to enjoy.', 'I loved being involve in the Performing Arts and Soccer. I had teachers who cared about my success. I was able to receive assistance with college application fees. I felt like I was challenged and was pushed to be the best I could be.', 'The faculty and staff are very friendly. The teachers make learning a great experience. However, they should give the students more options by providing other classes such as criminal justice.', 'I liked how the teachers tried to help you as much as they can, they always came ready to teach. One thing I think the school should really fix is the administration.']
column8: ["I liked how, although Perth Amboy isn't filled with all the brightest students, our school had so much school pride. Our school is filled with so many talented kids, starting from dancers to artists, and there is a sense of a true family connection.", 'Perth Amboy High School had great counselors that aided me in my college and scholarship process. Many teachers really care about their students and what they teach.', "It's actually my first year in the main campus of our school. For the whole 8 months I have been attending this school, I realized the gym teachers room is in poor condition comparing to regular classrooms. Although, as a student it doesn't really affect me whether the gym teachers have a better office. I think it would help them discuss their next class for us in a cleaner office.", 'PAHS is made up of many talented kids but is also made up of many kids who aren’t interested or discouraged to push themselves to be good students. There are some amazing teachers but also some teachers who just show up to get paid. The activities available are cool but there isn’t as much student involvement as in other school and very little funding for them. Administration isn’t the best but it also could be worse. Uniform is enforced strictly for certain students and for others they’re allowed to use whatever they desire with no punishment.', 'Average college, i like the new classes they are adding like forensic class and dance class. its great to see it evolving each year. I wish to see counselors be more helpful with students helping them to see what are their interests are to pick a career and helping them to see the importance of their future is.', "Thoughout last couple of years, Perth Amboy High School has been the place where I've learned to do what's right instead of what's easy. Further, due to vicarious learning; I have a notion and realize how to behave, study, and survive without experiencing any of the consequences a bad habit might provoke. At Amboy High, the teacher I have taken classes with, always look out for you and try to enhance your proficiency level. In the other hand, I will like to see a change in what is the school's  spirit, making a family friendly environment, self appreciating from the students and being able to produce in the community.", "I've attended Perth Amboy Public Schools since Pre-K, so I am biased when it comes to my view of PAHS. This school has gotten a bad rap because of its below-average graduation rate, school fights, and poor grades. Despite this, PAHS is a great school; it offers many activities and clubs, from community service opportunities to advocacy groups, sports like wrestling football, and soccer, which are improving by the year, and a plethora of brilliant teachers who offer all kinds of courses — from AP to Honors. The truth is that if you want to accomplish something in high school, this school will help you do just that, but if you want to fail in high school, you'll see that failing is just as easy. The school can definitely use some improvement. For instance, there's a massive disconnect between the students and the administration, but there's no such thing as a perfect school, and PAHS is great for what it's worth.", 'Perth Amboy High was very connected. Everyone always made you feel welcomed and it was super easy to make new friends. column2: ['I will say I was a student here, as a Freshman at the Edison Annex, where the level of education is tremendously awful. About 25% of my freshmen class was already failing a class, which meant they were losing credit to graduate. There were boxing fights in the locker room, fights in the bathrooms and school halls, and a true lack of commitment by teachers to teach. I do not blame the teachers as much as I blame EPS for not enforcing school rules to create a positive learning environment. I’m glad I transferred to a different school in sophomore year.', "My school is located in an urban district. So for everyone's safety, the protective service system is absolutely phenomenal. They try their very best to prevent any incidents from happening, and once they notice a conflict they stop it in a flash of a second. My high school stresses anti-bullying, so the bullying rate is at an all time low. The school nurses are the sweetest people you'll ever meet and they will try to make sure you're taken care well enough before you return back to class.", "The extracurricular opportunities are quite engaging. They have student council, student government, key club, peer leadership and much more. These programs that happen after school most likely will end up shaping a student's personality. It will also help them become positive leaders in the future. My high school provides exceptional motivation and support.", "As I first entered this high school, a majority of the teachers I had were welcoming. They helped me break out of that bubble over time. Some teachers knew which students needed help so they either offered help during your lunch break or after school. They reviewed heavily for the tests, midterms, and final exams beforehand. Their intellect is at a strong level and they showed you how you can apply their lessons to your life. They encourage you to always try your hardest to to be cooperative in class and with school activities. As far as the urban district, the students at times can't control their behavior so they will start unnecessary arguments/ dramas. The teachers always had the right motive to accommodate the situation by attempting to verbally stop the commotion or call in a security guard for extra help. My high school was disciplined and caring.", 'The security in this school is okay , for the most part they have everything like the metal detectors and the cameras etc which is important to have in a high school.', 'This school give a lot of good opportunities to students that are actually interested in getting a job at what they like to do , as well as it give the students a great head start.', "The parents don't really get involved in the school .", "They teachers aren't that bad", 'The school is good but needs improvemnt', "The school is mostly update with today's technology based on the school budget but they also stick to that old fashion classroom environment where students can get that one to one experience. The class doesn't only depend on technology but are taught to do it on their own to help build their own knowledge not to only rely on computers but their self and others.", 'Great the faculty is always looking to reach out to family and friends to help not only the students but within the community. No one ever stops working, you can always find someone to go to if help is ever needed. No student is ever turned down. Every single student is given the same opportunity.', 'The school gives opportunities just like any trade school offered to high school graduates. This school gives a head start in life to their studies.', 'They offer to their ability', 'The school offer college credit classes to students along with career tech classes. The school also prepares college tours to various colleges. The school provides to all students a college preparatory class. The school is filled with faculty willing to give a helping hand to their students to prepare for the real world as they are getting ready to face the real world.', 'The best three years of my life.', 'The school offers various of options which allows the students to decide wether what they would like to eat but have a broad variety of healthy items to select from. The school has plenty of security for a building that is not so big. The school is kept regulated for safety to students and faculty. The school practices safety awareness at least once or twice a month. I believe most of not all faculty is C.P.R certified.', "The school has various of clubs which allows students to engage with other students not only from their school building but most time other Elizabeth High schools. It gives that one to one between students and staff. They also give the accessibility for community service along with academic help for students. It helps build a good foundation between to school and students. Students become more appreciative with what's given to them and the value of what they have earned within the years.", 'The school celebrates all nationalities as possible, the school has a culinary arts program which allows students to cook and have had the opportunity to whip up all kinds of foods from all around. The school tries to appreciate all their students. Students allowed to make announcements for achievements birthdays etc. the school tries to hold school dances along with talents shows for numerous of occasions.', 'The school is the only school for the entire Elizabeth high school district to have the weight room and the advantage to the football field which allows the students during gym to take the advantage of an open field and the opportunity to work out with the supervision of a physical education instructor to help and guide them the correct way to use the equipment offered to the students. Throughout the years the weight room has been upgraded to new and improved equipment with motivated students who strive for fitness. Along with good weather the chance to play sports with all the room possible to play football,soccer etc along with track outside on the school field.', "The resources given to students within the school is remarkable. The school offers different careers paths which allows the student to see more or less what's right for them. They offer hands on experience and you can even graduate the high school not only with a diploma but certificates to certain careers. I was lucky enough to graduate with a certificate for a certified nursing assistant at the age of 17. I got the feel of the medical field at ages 16-17 and discovered that's the field to me. But I couldn't have done it alone I had the help of classmates & instructors. The faculty does their best to help each student strive for success."]

column2: ['I like about this school is everyone is friendly even our principals if you need anything you can freely talk to her without any hesitation', 'I was new in the neighborhood, people in that school are very sociable , what make me contiene at school. Support from my teachers and friends to pass regents and have great report cards. And I have more opportunities here than in another colleges', 'Since I arrived at August Martin High School as a Junior a lot of changes has taken place. After the appointment of our new principal, Mr. Rory Parnell, thing about the school got better.One of the  changes  made was the rule of cell phone. Normally students are allowed to bring their cell phone into the classroom, but this usually distract students from learning. Some students will be texting, video calling, listening to music, playing games and so on. The principal changed this. We were not allowed to bring phones into the classroom anymore and when we bring it, it will be collected at the entrance and given back after at the end of the school. This change improved student participation and learning in the class, student became more focused and ultimately led to good grades.', "August martin wasn't just a great when i first got there but as each year go by for me it got better. New and improve teachers that cares about and what you learn. They are people who you can go to for advice and talk to about anything you we help with", "Could've been better but I'm sure there are schools that are way worse", 'I honestly think only certain teacher put in the time and effort while others are just there to get paid.', 'It has diverse activities but not many participate', 'I hardly see any parents', 'Some teachers do make unnecessary comments towards students', 'Unsure about current methods, but the most popular are business and aviation classes. They help you accomplish and understand newer methods of calculating the world.', "When going to August Martin High School I wasn't supplied the resources I needed. For example, within my senior year I didn't get any scholarship information that could've allowed me access to funding for college. I was forced to take unnecessary courses that I had almost jeopardized my graduation.", "Sports teams are fun but academic after school activities didn't exist when I went there.", "You'll probably get a good teacher at the school that could teach but they aren't all good. There's a problem with the kids disrupting classes in the school and some teachers can't handle it. Some teachers in the school are actually good and care about educating kids. If your going in to this school go into the business academy because mr. Summers is amazing, aviation is a close second", "Well my time at August martin high School  wasn't that bad at all. The one thing i love the school is the business program which is called NFTE. It helps me and a lot of student discovering our entrepreneurship skills and offers a lot of opportunity. The one thing i hate it about the school is that a lot of school activities were being canceled due to lack of money. overall the school wasn't bad it just needed a lot more resources that could help us as student.", 'My overall experience was alright for high school. I have met great people who have changed my life and I have learned vauleable life lessons. What makes my school unique is mostly the students and the graffiti/artwork on the wall. It gives me motivation to go to school. I probably would choose August Martin again if I could do it all again just to feel a couple of things twice.', "My overall experience at August Martin high school would be an okay rating . My reason is because I have only been there two years , because i transferred from another school , so i wasn't fully able to have the full experience .", "I think that the school safety and health policies are great . August Martin high school has metal detectors which are used every time someone enters the building . The school is very social and tries to get everyone involved so I don't believe that there are problems with bullying in my school.", 'The food service at August Martin High School is decent . We Get healthy foods and always have the option to choose salad with our meal. The cafeteria was redesigned in a buffet type of style which really gave students a bigger variety of foods and opened up our options .', "One of the school policesd is , cell phones are prohibited anywhere in the school except the lunchroom .If cellphones are being used in class , usually it would get taken away and in the dean's office and the student will pick it up at the end of the day , this would be the first warning . Second warning , a parent would have to come to the school . The third Warning would be , the student would not be able to bring their cell phone in the building at all .", "August Martin's school spirit is rising . There Have been more promotions about games and flyers posted all around the school . They also give special shoutouts on the loud speaker congratulating teams for winning games . There is also an August Martin Hype Team . They get students more involved in school events and activities which is a great idea and it actually works ."]

column6: ['I believe that the teachers in this school have a good connection with the students. I also feel that teachers care about impressing the  principal and keeping their job rather than helping the students as much as they can.', 'I believe that this year , the school has done a lot to get students more interested in school activities . If i Had an extra year to spend in high school i would definitely participate . I would also recommend younger students to participate.', 'there are a good amount of clubs that i participated in to pass the time', 'parents have a part in the kids failure and troubles.', "many of the students don't care about the consequences that follow their actions", 'not enough school spirit is put into the school', "they don't force more punishment as they should to help students do better", 'the school has some teachers that help students more than others because they want students to succeed more than others', 'i think this school has room for a lot of improvement, but its not that bad.', 'Very knowledgeable. Grading consistency needs work', 'No student participation. Lack of school spirit.', "The workload at this school isn't very much for each class, which is good because students are given 7 to 9 classes a day with homework given everyday to be done. Essays are to be written in each class. Final exams are given each marking period for every class including physical education (yes we have to write essays for gym).", "I've never participated in after school activities at this school.", '1% of the School is White 1% of the school is Asian/Pacific Islander 5% of the school is Hispanic/Latino 5% of the School is Indian and 88% of the school is African American. Students do not like to be involved in school activities. Some females in the school are lesbian or bisexual, everyone else is a heterosexual. Peer pressure is rarely seen. Everyone in this school can be described as headstrong and cannot and will not tolerate being pushed around, so bulling is not a problem.', 'The food selection consists of chicken nuggets, hamburgers, pizza, fries, chicken patties, grilled chicken, fried chicken, fish patties, beef patties, mozzarella sticks, rice, beans, sloppy joe, meatballs, and a salad bar option including apples, bananas, oranges, pineapples, peaches, lettuce, pickles, carrots, red peppers, and green peppers.', 'Dress code is required at the school. However it is not enforced. None of the students wear uniform. They wear any article of clothing they want. However revealing clothing is not tolerated and is addressed by making students wear the official gym uniform. The Principal is mostly in her office, she is rarely seen around the building. Not like when she first started that she was everywhere. Guidance Counselors are the most helpful people in the building, they actually care about the students and seeing them succeed. Cell Phones as well as other electronic devices are not allowed in August Martin High School, which is a controversial policy because parents want to know their child can be contacted in case of an emergency. However the school tells its students to use the phones within the building to contact parent or guardians, then school staff denies the students use of school office property.', 'This school has scanning to prevent any dangerous objects such as knives or guns to be permitted in the school. However students still find ways to sneak these dangerous items in the school. The school safety are extremely rude. They do not care for the safety of the students. They use vulgar language towards the students. Overall the school is safe regardless of its issues. No active shooters have been reported and students "play-fight" from time to time but no one has ever been seriously injured.', 'This educational facility is committed to the learning and success of its students, however most of the students do not take advantage of the opportunities given to them and have stained the reputation of this school over the course of the last decade.', "She does not really involve herself with the students plus things weren't as bad as they were until she became the principal of the school. Our school rating was higher than an F and had a higher graduation rate.", "Many students are being held back due to the lack of teaching an some teachers to don't help students as much as they need to get the grade they deserve. Also the college counselor a do not help as much either towards managing you credits and understand graduation requirements."]
column8: ['I believe that the teachers in this school have a good connection with the students. I also feel that teachers care about impressing the  principal and keeping their job rather than helping the students as much as they can.', 'I believe that this year , the school has done a lot to get students more interested in school activities . If i Had an extra year to spend in high school i would definitely participate . I would also recommend younger students to participate.', 'there are a good amount of clubs that i participated in to pass the time', 'parents have a part in the kids failure and troubles.', "many of the students don't care about the consequences that follow their actions", 'not enough school spirit is put into the school', "they don't force more punishment as they should to help students do better", 'the school has some teachers that help students more than others because they want students to succeed more than others', 'i think this school has room for a lot of improvement, but its not that bad.', 'Very knowledgeable. Grading consistency needs work', 'No student participation. Lack of school spirit.', "The workload at this school isn't very much for each class, which is good because students are given 7 to 9 classes a day with homework given everyday to be done. Essays are to be written in each class. column2: ['Central High is an average high school which offers an average education but lacks preparation in college readiness.', 'I have been attending Central high school since my freshman year I love it.  It’s very diverse. The staff and teachers listen to the students and help in anything.', 'I graduated from Central High School with Honors. Didn’t even know if that was possible but my guidance counselor and principal helped me make it possible. #ClassOf2019', 'I would like to see nothing change it was a great school if you actually want to learn. Everyone was nice and easygoing as long as you mind your own business you should be fine', 'My experience at central was very good. I enjoy myself and the academics that we study is very good.', "I love Central high school. This will be a school that I will never be able to forget. The school, teachers and students have become my family and home. Because of Cereal I'm always open to learning something new. The school made learning fun. The school is also very diverse and loving. Even though we might not be the perfect school, Central high school will always be the best school for me. I'm very grateful to be a part of that big family.  Central high school have thought me a lot about life. Since 9 grade and now I am in 12, I have grown up to be the best I could be. I love Central even though the food was not what we always wanted it to be, but Central have help me in academic and help me get ready for college and the future. Central prepared me for the world. Central might not be perfect but to me, it's the best high school I could ask for.", "Central High School is a great school in terms of academics and diversity. They care a lot about their students. One thing I would like to change is the sport because students don't have much support like some other schools, especially soccer. Beside that, it's nice place to be in.", 'Central highschool is a very good school known for its diversity. Thats what i love most about the school. Coming from west Africa i dont have to try to fit in and be like others. The school acknowledges every culture. Our. VPS and principal interact with us very well and create bonds with us like there own children. We the advantage of academies. I personally im in the dental academy wich gives me and good headstart on becoming a dentist or part of the medical feild. I would like to see an upgrade in the school lunches and breakfast. But over central is a great school', 'My experience at Central high school was poor  just because, I was one of the ones who wanted to succeed. I feel as though going to Central high school you will face an abundance of adversity, but getting through it and Seeking help from teachers and counselors will help you along the way. I’ve became a much better student just because my surroundings, seeing. the lows of life. I’ve concluded if a person is at the bottom and you can not  go lower, the only way out is to the top. If  I was changing it will be the culture and out of the student school because the supports that can only do so much stress to his job to actually learn and actually want to learn.', "I came to Central High School during my sophomore year, I didn't any English but they had good classes for me and people who are in a similar situation. They called it ESL( English as a Second Language), These classes made the school a diverse school because different people came there to learn English which I really love about it. they also have so many afterschool programs, Clubs and sports.", 'My experience in central high school at first was amazing than it later turn into average . I wish we have more activities, clubs, and I wish we come separate the. Smart kids from the average kids.', "The things that I like about Central High School is that everybody is welcome there, it doesn't matter about what religion or background you came from.", "central high is where everybody feel welcome. It doesn't matter where you came from or what race you are, everybody is treated with respect and equally.Its also a place where you can meet new people and get a good education.", 'I came into Central with a lot of issues and problem, but with the help of the staff and Mrs.Brown I was a changed person by my sophomore year. NOw I am the best person i want to be.', 'I love this its so good no changes need to be done its a good website.You can apply for many scholarships and so much more.', 'You need an ID for everything little thing you want to do for example bathrooms, just to walk to the water fountain during class time', 'Theirs always something to do during and after school. Its great chances of getting help with the academics that you might be struggling in', 'The staff learns the students learning styles and teaches students everything they need to know by why they have learned about the students.', "I love the school. Everyone is very friendly and Caring,there wasn't a time were there was something going on and no one to talk to. I couldn't imagine myself  in another school, central is my family. The bond with everyone is unbreakable the  staff and students there knows everyone.", 'They are all good teachers and they help students in need.']

column6: ['My school is a very safe place', 'I was in the bowling team at central high school. Every year which we did bowling, there was always a financial problem, but central overlooked that and continued to let the students wholoved bowling, bowl.', 'Coming to Central high school, i experienced a lot. I was pushed to do better and trust me they actually made me feel like i belonged there and that central was the school for me', 'Its has all kind of sports like soccer, football', "Throughout all the years I been at Central High School They taught me that we all are loved and that when we don't have our real family to go to we can always go to them", 'Central high school is a loving high school where teaches and administrators care about you you can always go to someone if you have a problem and they are very open-minded to your personal and academic situation. In addition we have very diapers and we especially known for our sports performances', 'My 3 years so far is basically what I made it. I\'ve had the best times in school because I stayed out of trouble and did what was necessary for me to continue my journey in the school. There were the usual distractions "class clowns" but I really enjoyed my years and the school prepared me a lot for the future.', "So far i am liking the school but not loving it. The teachers are really encouraging and try to make the students have every possible chance at be successful. This school is unique because of it's diversity. i would choose this school again because i feel somewhat safe here and i love the teachers, although i would prefer to go to a school with better food.", 'Bullying goes on, and if you tell a teacher both of them will get a detailed talk. Ever since 2013 we dont have school IDs. We have aolt of security guards. The school nurse it good and fast. The school is safe by guns but not from peer pressure or drugs. A lot of students use alcohol and drugs and sometimes in the school.', 'The cafeteria is fixed up nice. The food is disgusting and we have very few options. Its somewhat healthy but it can be better.We get no snacks. We only have three choices.', 'The school administration is great. They have a lot of people welling to help you go to college but they will suspend you in a hot minute. They dont allow bullying, the uniform is very detailed and many students dont follow it. They have a lot of latenesses and they dont have a lgbt rule so, it gets tossed and turned around.', 'They are a lot of athletics and fitness opportunuties. They have some great athletics, a little to nothing fans, the school only really have school spirit is when we have pep rallies for the championships. The athletes facilities are great but just the horrible uniforms.', "The teachers are fine. They teach but not always explain. The only time they're available in at your lunch. Some teachers do the grade book right and some wait last minute. They dont keep the classes attention because their tactic are boring.", 'My school extracurriculars are okay because there are somewhat a lot ,but the school funding. It keeps the students from being in unity. For instance all the players dont have the same uniform or its either first come first serve. And the quality of the uniforms are not great they have numbers falling off. We also have Fraternities and Sororities. They are great they have step shows and they fund themselves they either have bake sells or sell candy.', 'if you do anything wrong they do have punishments that follow.', 'the food is ok could be better. they need to cut down on the salt and oil food', 'I enjoy big Tuesday the most because its fun', 'The sports in the school keep the kids out of trouble.', 'Teachers really do care about their students. They help us when we need help, they are perfect roll models and they prepare us for the future.', 'One of my favorite organization/committee is called "Big Tuesday". I love it because we as students get the chance to share our talent. Also we will honor someone who as pass and give speeches about the good things they have done in their life. Finally , we also have girls and boys talk where they separate us and give us positive advice.']

column1: Brooklyn Collegiate - A College Board School
column2: ["So far in my years old Brooklyn collegiate, I've been enjoying being a senior. Although it is my first and last year, I can say that anybody who goes there, would be in for an academic, social and fun experience. Being at Brooklyn collegiate has really helped me in academics. I have a very high GPA thanks for the school that I attend. It may not be easy for people to adapt at other schools, but I tell you, if you go to Brooklyn collegiate, your life would be changed. So I suggest to all students that are entering High School, to select to Brooklyn collegiate as there High School.", 'School groomed me into a great young man. I’ve experienced a lot of hardship during me phase in that school. The teachers are very caring, and will always work with you when you are in need of help. The basketball program is amazing. They fell shorty this year in the final four of the psal.', 'Brooklyn Collegiate is a very family oriented school with staff that genuinely care about the students and help them in graduating and help the seniors in their college application process', 'Brooklyn Collegiate High School has offered me a lot of support starting from my principal, down to the friends I have made. Even though I entered Brooklyn Collegiate at the start of my senior year, the staff still made me feel as though I attended the school for a long period of time. Brooklyn Collegiate has gave me different opportunities that I thought I would not experience until college. For example, I was able to have an internship  through out my senior year, which made me an even more active person. Not only did it make me active, but it also motivated me to keep my average up as well, so I can be a role model to the younger kids.', 'Brooklyn Collegiate offers a good amount of programs and advanced placements classes for students to receive the best education and also be college ready.', 'I really love this school. The teachers and staff are very supportive. Its small but good. Only sports are really basketball but the games are lit lol', "Well I came to this school in 9th grade and I felt like a foreigner in a strange land but I made some new friends. Then in 10th grade I decided to play drums and tryout for the basketball and I was warming up to the school. Then in 11th grade I was getting familiar with the school. So I'm in 12th grade and I feel like this School is my second home .And while I was in this school, it could of have more  clubs and activities.  Also the school should of have more interesting subjects.  But overall the school is not that bad", "It's my first school here. I liked it first. But gradually i came to know more about other schools too. And i realized it's okay. Not really that good. It can be a very good school if can be taken care of properly.", 'One thing I can honestly say I liked about Brooklyn Collegiate were the teachers. The teachers understood that everyone learns differently. They never designed a lesson plan to only fit one way of learning and never discouraged thinking outside the box.', "I been in brooklyn collegiate for 7 years, since I was in grade 6th. Now I am a senior and honestly I seen this school grow. It has many more programs for different people and different religions and race. Academically wise there's more diversity in programs that students can learn from.", 'The school is very resourceful, though many students do not take advantage of the opportunities the school offers. The teachers and staff are always there for students, willing to help with any trouble a student may have. The courses at Brooklyn Collegiate are challenging yet but they are put in place for college readiness to help students on the path to college. The sports and activities are also very engaging.', "I'm rather surprised this school is somehow still alive and kicking. The only memorable aspect of this school was the teachers. They legitimately cared for their students. ", "The work can be hard at times but only to student who don't pay attention in class or learn at different paces than everyone else. If the teacher sees that, they will work with you to get to the pace you need as well as put you on academic probation where you come to school earlier to get you up to speed to the level your supposed to be on. Now with common core in classes, it is tough but since we use those standards everyday, it gets easier as you go along. \r ps- i memorized most of the standards thank to Mrs.  Quinn:)", 'There is a zero tolerance for bullying and you will be suspended if you are bullying someone. you will be suspended if you are fughting, as well as breaking the rules after you have been warned 2 times. If its for uniform, you get 1 day suspensions, for cheating on test you get 5 days or less depending on the level of seriousness the test is (midterm, final, ap test, regents). You only get suspended for breaking the rules multiple times after being told not to do something and since there are cameras, they always see you as well as they write it up on pupil path for your parent to see.', "BC is currently partners with Counseling in Schools and Sports and Arts in Schools Foundation, so there are many extracurricular activities. There is Basketball Boys Varsity, Junior varsity and Girls Varsity, Track and Field, Volleyball Girls and Boys, Football, Flag Football, Cheer-leading, Pep Squad, Cooking, Drama, Drumline, Band, Mouse Squad, Graphic Design Club, Coding Club, Book Club, Crochet Club, Fashion Design, Chess Club, Art Therapy, Community service, Leadership, and Peer Mentor-ship just to name a few. At this school you can never say your bored or have no fun or are uninterested in joining after school because there's too much to do. and the best thing is that you can create an after school schedule and do up to 5 activities throughout the week. And some of the teachers throughout the day teach after school activities :)", "My overall experience was great not the best only because there was a change in administration.the old administration was the worst, the principal wanted her way with every thing and set us up for failure by not offering certain classes and only giving us that 44 credit diploma, the new principal want you to go above and beyond. I've had 3 years of the old administration and 1 year of the new. Ms.Newman, the new principal, is making AP classes available to ALL students starting September 2016, even freshman. the freshman starting from 2015 enrolled and up will graduate with 60 credits and associate degrees by taking college classes at Medgar Evers and Brooklyn College. Ms. Newman has made the students as well as the teacher love coming through the doors every day and I wish they could've fired Ms. Sias sooner.", "With the new administration at my school, Ms. Newman along with many more, I can wholeheartedly say that the teachers are more engaged in teaching us the best way possible. Everyday after class, you can find almost all of the teachers in their rooms putting in extra hours to help students or even planning for the next day.  Every teacher also has their daily schedule posted on their doors so we can even get extra help throughout  the day. I've been in Brooklyn Collegiate for 4 years, this is my last year and i can say truthfully that this year i have never been more engaged in my studies. The old principal didn't really give the teachers the proper tools to help them teach the class or even interest the students but now, you can find smart-boards and laptops carts in every class room. One of the freshman algebra teacher has a smart-board that looks like a 65-inch mac computer lol. They have the utmost respect for students, use my art teacher as an example, he takes feedback from us every day as part of the lesson and he even asks us what should he say to our peers if they happen to not be following the rules, doesn't get better than that. And as for grading wise, we use pupil path which is updated DAILY and the parent and the student are able to have an account so parents can check their grades in classes, as well as assignments, behavioral issues, attendance and even their transcript regents scores and requirements to graduate. Lastly, i want to talk about my favorite teacher in the entire school, Mr. Houck. I've had him as a teacher for grade 11 for AP Calculus and now in grade 12 for AP Calculus prep. I don't think there is anyone who is more passionate about teaching than he is, he gives up his lunch period which is also the same as ours to make sure we understand the topic. he will not leave the room until you can reiterate what he taught you back to him. The experience here will take you far,look at me, I've received full rides into 11 colleges so far :).", 'My favorite experiences in this school was the basketball games, and the dances we had. The basketball games bring all the children together to celebrate one thing. what makes this school unique is that all the students i the school really look out for each other and support their peers.', 'All my teachers are very experienced in the subjects they teach. Because of this, the students are able to get good information pertaining the topics we do. They communicate with give us one help and sometimes even give us chances to make up work that we missed.They give work that we can understand and they teach us with methods that we are able to understand', 'Some teachers are very good and really care about you']
