I have a very high GPA thanks for the school that I attend. It may not be easy for people to adapt at other schools, but I tell you, if you go to Brooklyn collegiate, your life would be changed. So I suggest to all students that are entering High School, to select to Brooklyn collegiate as there High School.", 'School groomed me into a great young man. I’ve experienced a lot of hardship during me phase in that school. The teachers are very caring, and will always work with you when you are in need of help. The basketball program is amazing. They fell shorty this year in the final four of the psal.', 'Brooklyn Collegiate is a very family oriented school with staff that genuinely care about the students and help them in graduating and help the seniors in their college application process', 'Brooklyn Collegiate High School has offered me a lot of support starting from my principal, down to the friends I have made. Even though I entered Brooklyn Collegiate at the start of my senior year, the staff still made me feel as though I attended the school for a long period of time. Brooklyn Collegiate has gave me different opportunities that I thought I would not experience until college. For example, I was able to have an internship  through out my senior year, which made me an even more active person. Not only did it make me active, but it also motivated me to keep my average up as well, so I can be a role model to the younger kids.', 'Brooklyn Collegiate offers a good amount of programs and advanced placements classes for students to receive the best education and also be college ready.', 'I really love this school. The teachers and staff are very supportive. Its small but good. Only sports are really basketball but the games are lit lol', "Well I came to this school in 9th grade and I felt like a foreigner in a strange land but I made some new friends. Then in 10th grade I decided to play drums and tryout for the basketball and I was warming up to the school. Then in 11th grade I was getting familiar with the school. So I'm in 12th grade and I feel like this School is my second home .And while I was in this school, it could of have more  clubs and activities.  Also the school should of have more interesting subjects.  But overall the school is not that bad", "It's my first school here. I liked it first. But gradually i came to know more about other schools too. And i realized it's okay. Not really that good. It can be a very good school if can be taken care of properly.", 'One thing I can honestly say I liked about Brooklyn Collegiate were the teachers. The teachers understood that everyone learns differently. They never designed a lesson plan to only fit one way of learning and never discouraged thinking outside the box.', "I been in brooklyn collegiate for 7 years, since I was in grade 6th. Now I am a senior and honestly I seen this school grow. It has many more programs for different people and different religions and race. Academically wise there's more diversity in programs that students can learn from.", 'The school is very resourceful, though many students do not take advantage of the opportunities the school offers. The teachers and staff are always there for students, willing to help with any trouble a student may have. The courses at Brooklyn Collegiate are challenging yet but they are put in place for college readiness to help students on the path to college. The sports and activities are also very engaging.', "I'm rather surprised this school is somehow still alive and kicking. The only memorable aspect of this school was the teachers. They legitimately cared for their students. ", "The work can be hard at times but only to student who don't pay attention in class or learn at different paces than everyone else. If the teacher sees that, they will work with you to get to the pace you need as well as put you on academic probation where you come to school earlier to get you up to speed to the level your supposed to be on. Now with common core in classes, it is tough but since we use those standards everyday, it gets easier as you go along. \r ps- i memorized most of the standards thank to Mrs.  Quinn:)", 'There is a zero tolerance for bullying and you will be suspended if you are bullying someone. you will be suspended if you are fughting, as well as breaking the rules after you have been warned 2 times. If its for uniform, you get 1 day suspensions, for cheating on test you get 5 days or less depending on the level of seriousness the test is (midterm, final, ap test, regents). You only get suspended for breaking the rules multiple times after being told not to do something and since there are cameras, they always see you as well as they write it up on pupil path for your parent to see.', "BC is currently partners with Counseling in Schools and Sports and Arts in Schools Foundation, so there are many extracurricular activities. There is Basketball Boys Varsity, Junior varsity and Girls Varsity, Track and Field, Volleyball Girls and Boys, Football, Flag Football, Cheer-leading, Pep Squad, Cooking, Drama, Drumline, Band, Mouse Squad, Graphic Design Club, Coding Club, Book Club, Crochet Club, Fashion Design, Chess Club, Art Therapy, Community service, Leadership, and Peer Mentor-ship just to name a few. At this school you can never say your bored or have no fun or are uninterested in joining after school because there's too much to do. and the best thing is that you can create an after school schedule and do up to 5 activities throughout the week. And some of the teachers throughout the day teach after school activities :)", "My overall experience was great not the best only because there was a change in administration.the old administration was the worst, the principal wanted her way with every thing and set us up for failure by not offering certain classes and only giving us that 44 credit diploma, the new principal want you to go above and beyond. I've had 3 years of the old administration and 1 year of the new. Ms.Newman, the new principal, is making AP classes available to ALL students starting September 2016, even freshman. the freshman starting from 2015 enrolled and up will graduate with 60 credits and associate degrees by taking college classes at Medgar Evers and Brooklyn College. Ms. Newman has made the students as well as the teacher love coming through the doors every day and I wish they could've fired Ms. Sias sooner.", "With the new administration at my school, Ms. Newman along with many more, I can wholeheartedly say that the teachers are more engaged in teaching us the best way possible. Everyday after class, you can find almost all of the teachers in their rooms putting in extra hours to help students or even planning for the next day.  Every teacher also has their daily schedule posted on their doors so we can even get extra help throughout  the day. I've been in Brooklyn Collegiate for 4 years, this is my last year and i can say truthfully that this year i have never been more engaged in my studies. The old principal didn't really give the teachers the proper tools to help them teach the class or even interest the students but now, you can find smart-boards and laptops carts in every class room. One of the freshman algebra teacher has a smart-board that looks like a 65-inch mac computer lol. They have the utmost respect for students, use my art teacher as an example, he takes feedback from us every day as part of the lesson and he even asks us what should he say to our peers if they happen to not be following the rules, doesn't get better than that. And as for grading wise, we use pupil path which is updated DAILY and the parent and the student are able to have an account so parents can check their grades in classes, as well as assignments, behavioral issues, attendance and even their transcript regents scores and requirements to graduate. Lastly, i want to talk about my favorite teacher in the entire school, Mr. Houck. I've had him as a teacher for grade 11 for AP Calculus and now in grade 12 for AP Calculus prep. I don't think there is anyone who is more passionate about teaching than he is, he gives up his lunch period which is also the same as ours to make sure we understand the topic. he will not leave the room until you can reiterate what he taught you back to him. The experience here will take you far,look at me, I've received full rides into 11 colleges so far :).", 'My favorite experiences in this school was the basketball games, and the dances we had. The basketball games bring all the children together to celebrate one thing. what makes this school unique is that all the students i the school really look out for each other and support their peers.', 'All my teachers are very experienced in the subjects they teach. Because of this, the students are able to get good information pertaining the topics we do. They communicate with give us one help and sometimes even give us chances to make up work that we missed.They give work that we can understand and they teach us with methods that we are able to understand', 'Some teachers are very good and really care about you']

column1: Urban Assembly for the Performing Arts
column2: ['My experience in the urban assembly school has been life changing. I’ve grown and learned a lot from freshman year to senior year !! I’ve overcame anything that tried to come up against me ..& came out on top everytime..! Perseverance is key!! I will truly miss everyone and all the memories that were made !! EDUCATION EQUALS OPTIONS 🤞🏾', 'Urban Assembly Allows Individuals To Express and Be Themselves. Also , while learning and building character.', 'What I like the most about mu current school is all the talent that we are surround , achievements & critical thinking we do while supporting the "lost causes " ( issues that nobody pays attention to ) . We also embrace our diffenrent cultural background .', 'Performing Arts is what defines us.', "Like I've said before it could be better.", 'Some teachers do a lot more than what they need to, but the staff as a whole could of been better.', "I love how this school is a performing arts school and I didn't have to audition to get into this school. This school gives students who love the arts to get a chance or opportunity to pursue their talent. However, I would love if this school had more clubs, activities, and sports. Also I feel that this school does not really prepare students for college.", 'This school is a place where you want to leave so bad from it and then when you leave or graduate, you miss it dearly.', "I've Grown Alot In This School And i Really Love It. i Wouldnt Do Anything Different But Focus A Little More In Freshman Year. But Now Im On Track And i got One More Year , Im Ready For It. Class Of 2016 #LETSGOO", 'i Am A Junior In My School And Junior And Seniors Go Outside For Lunch So i Really Wouldnt Know', 'Their Is Discipline Behind Every Wrong Thing We Do. Not Doing The Right Thing Their Is Consequences. If WE Get Kicked Out Of Class , We have To take to The Deaning Staff And They Decide If We Are Able To Go Back In Class', 'In My School We Really Dont Have Alot Of Sport Space. We Just Started A Flag Football Team But i Think They Practice In The Gym. A Track Team Just Started. We Dont Really Have Much Sports', 'The Teachers At My School Are Great People. They Make Kids Want To Learn , They make Their Lessons Fun But Also Serious Because At the End Of The Day We Have A Test To Pass At The End Of The Day. Due That We Are An Performing Arts School They Involve Some Of Our Arts In The Lessons. That Way It Makes It Understandable. Like We may Act Out A History Scene In Global Class Or Dance Around Like The Pharaohs Did. On All The Teachers Doors Is The College They Went To And What they Did in College. Some Of The Teachers Are Performers Themselves As Well As Our Principal. They Are Very Smart And They Want The Best For All Their Students , We can tell by The Way They Are Always On Our Back. The Teachers Dont Show Favorites , Everybody Is Their Favorite. They Treat All Of Us The Same And Have A Good Relationship With All The Students.', 'I Say Its Great Because Being A Performing Arts Schools Our Arts Carry On Till Afterschool. There Is A Very Interesting Acting Class, A HipHop Dance Class  Gospel Choir And So Much More To Participate In. The Students Love It And Because They Make It Fun The Kids Are Committed And We Can Tell By How They Are Happy To Perform Their Piece.', "There don't seem to be any", 'The teachers are friendly even to unruly students and/ or staff', "I don't feel as though this school is doing such a good job to help prepare their students for the real world. My first semester into College I crumbled. I barely understood anything I was being taught in my classes.", 'Not a lot of ethnic diversity', 'Everyone is nice and cool for the most part.', "I felt behind slightly when I got to college because I didn't have the chance to take ap classes or other advanced opportunities that others had."]

column1: New Visions Charter High School for the Humanities III
column2: ['Going to new visions charter high school was a life changing experience for me in both good and bad ways. I had the ability to meet new people, form bonds with their very friendly staff members and even made memories that will forever last. However I feel as though there could be many changes such as : students deserve the right to have their voices heard and my school is more than capable of allowing that to happen and for some reason they choose not too, they always say that they care about our voices being heard but their actions beg to differ. In order to truly uplift our community at Humanities 3 and show their students how much they care they first have to actually listen to what their students problems are and then there can be many changes made.', "Humanities is something unique, from the hallways to the classrooms. The atmosphere is very comforting and accepting. As soon as you walk in you can feel the care from staff and students, Hums became my family that never judged me and have always wanted to see the best in me. Like any High school the work was challenging but the staff always made it better, they broke it down and help me exceed in the places I lacked. Community, Communication, and Commitment was what they promised and that's what they gave. I know that not every school is perfect but One thing I wished Hums did was educate me more about the college process earlier and open more doors for me.", 'Hum 3 is probably the most enterntaining school in sheepshead bay. This is my second year in Hum 3 and I got to say this school is definitely improving and the school spirit is at an all time high with the many events coming up. Also I would definitely recommend taking a look at it from the inside.', "New Visions Charter High School for the Humanities III isn't well organized but under new management It will be.", 'My time spent at New Visions have involved many ups and downs. Thankfully, teachers were willing to listen which played a major role in getting through high school. This is one thing about being a student at New Visions. The support is amazing and the environment is friendly. There are many academic opportunities at New Visions.  I remember my first college trip. An entire week. That’s when I found my number one college and I was only a freshman. The school provides us with as many college trips as possible. In addition, there are also many outside opportunities offered. I constantly check my email because almost every week, there are new job opportunities or college opportunities or internships. It makes me feel important. The guidance counselors make it their priority to update students.New Visions is a small family and there aren’t enough clubs available. This is something I believe should be improved in order to keep students more engaged outside of the classroom.', "HUM III is a very good high school when it comes to preparing your child for college. They have very good resources. They are able to provide each child with a computer that they use during class. The administration is not the best but they are working hard to better the way the school works. the school has only been open for 5 year and as of 2017, they've only had 1 graduating class.", "I love this school. They have helped me develop and become a better man. The staff is very welcoming and relate to students. There is a lot of diversity here and little to no bullying. The staff connects with children so that they are not uncomfortable and can approach teachers when they don't understand something or need help.", 'My experience at this school is fairly great. I played volleyball, helped the school community and worked very well with others.', 'From 9th-12th grade my school has changed in many ways. From students being rude etc. To students doing what they got to do to graduate. Many students have matured and many teachers has changed for the good.', 'I would’ve loved if the organization of this school would change. At Humanities everything was unorganized, teachers left back to back, wasn’t so many activities planned for us. I had a good time spending my time with my friends and getting to bond with others.', "I have been here for almost 4 year now and I love it!!! I've met really amazing teachers and people here!", 'Personally I would rate my experience as average. It honestly could have been so much better. The areas requiring the most improvement is in courses, administration, and coursework.', 'My highschool  was good in that they really helped kids with making sure there work was done and that they Understand what they are doing . But they weren’t as organized as they should have been when It came toSchool events and activities.', 'I absolutely appreciate this school! Staff friendly and attentive! Daughter is Graduating this year! Thank you New Visions!', 'High school has been one of the most stressful experiences of my life and the community at my school helped me through it.', 'New Visions Charter High School for the Humanities III had a great start for such an unstable network. The teachers showed a passion for teaching and the students came in ready to learn.', 'Hum as we call it , is one of the best schools. Students transfer to hum because they hear such good things. As a student you can definitely relate to teachers and staff and find a friend here.', "My experience at Humanities was great. Like all schools there are ups and downs but here it's like we are all family. The community is positive and there are always students who want to help out. Academically wise the staff, principals, and the Teachers try to make sure that the students are on task. We have plenty of opportunities here at this school. The only issue there is here is that students tend to follow behind others and stir up drama, but the staff and principal makes sure they do their best so that no one gets hurt, an that everyone stay safe. Like all high schools you just have to be careful who you surround yourself with so that you don't get into any ones drama, and focus on your work.", "I'm currently a junior in this school and by far I like it however it need some improvements in doing club/activities ", 'Parent support is the key to success.']
